title: Sr. IT Delivery Analyst
description: Position Title Sr. IT Delivery Analyst Location Headquarters-Troy, MI Job Summary The Sr IT Delivery Analyst provides critical coaching, mentoring, and auditing functions for Agile projects within the Project Management Office. They are expected to review and quality assure the project artifacts, deliverables and process adherence to the Flagstar Bank Playbook and governance routines. The Sr Analyst generally has a larger volume of projects to oversee, or the projects are larger and more complex. The Sr Analyst is expected to provide advice and support around critical project delivery functions, including budget tracking and financial forecasting, project evaluation and monitoring, and maintaining compliance with corporate and public regulations. They support project governance activities including Tollgate readiness, assessing deliverable quality and completeness, and financial forecast accuracy. They are expected to verify and analyze the accuracy of all data and information used or generated by a project; and help the project managers resolve any discrepancies or problems. The Sr Analyst will support multiple Agile projects that are larger and more complex in nature: Evaluating project schedules, resources, equipment and information and budgets for accuracy and completeness Ensuring reporting of time, scope and objectives are accurately assessed and updated in Clarity / CA PPM Ensuring that the PMO is kept abreast of project delinquency and failing project health and remediation actions taken Job Responsibilities: Audit and provide quality assurance of high or multiple medium rigor projects. Advises PM on accurate project team, tasks and financial information in Clarity. Supports scope of project with budget reconciliation in Clarity. Keep current assigned project resources – both full time employees and contractors in Clarity. Facilitation of cross functional agile collaborative teams in iterative technology developments including: managing stakeholder expectations regarding target scope, schedule and budget Advises PM on project budget planning and development. Establishes project work plan and calendar framework for the projects they support, may update, review, and progress, collaborating with the project delivery resources. Establishes and maintains internal and external resources as necessary. Removing impediments that hinder project progress. Facilitating daily scrum, sprint planning, sprint demo and iteration meetings. Monitoring the progress of the sprint. Helping teams estimate iteration deliverables and increase velocity. Managing development tracking system to include product and sprint backlogs. Promoting continuous communication. Monitoring and helps improving team dynamics. Monitors record keeping and file maintenance for the program or project. Prepares records of project activities; oversees and ensures the timely processing in and the delivery of required materials. Verifies and analyzes the accuracy of all data and information used or generated by project; resolves any discrepancies or problems. Serves as liaison for Project Management Office; coordinates activities and exchanges information. Ensure the project development process follows the Project Management Methodology and Project Management Office standards. Document and submit project change requests on behalf of the Project Manager or project coordinator. Contribute to the development of the Project Management Office and share knowledge with peers. Provides advice to participants; serves as a liaison; acts as a resource person by performing research, analyzing information, providing documentation, and preparing reports as required. Staff member is expected to consistently adhere to regulatory and compliance policies and standards linked to their job as listed. Staff member will not repeatedly act in a manner signifying intentional or willful noncompliance, nor exhibit gross negligence or a general disregard for compliance and regulatory standards. Staff member must ensure compliance with applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations. Staff member must complete all required compliance training on a timely basis. Staff member will maintain knowledge of and adhere to Flagstar’s internal compliance policies and procedures. Staff member must take responsibility to keep up to date with changing regulations and policies. Job Requirements : High School Diploma, GED, or foreign equivalent required. Bachelor's Degree or comparable work experience preferred. 3-5 years of experience in coordinating projects of progressive size and complexity with 3+ years of experience with various Software Development Life Cycle methods such as Agile, SCRUM, Waterfall, etc. preferred Knowledge of project management methodologies. Knowledge of computers and database/spreadsheet/ word processing software. Excellent communications and critical skills, both written and verbal. Excellent planning and organizational skills. Strong problem-solving skills. Ability to accurately review and complete detail-oriented information. Ability to take responsibility and function under minimal supervision. Ability to work with wide range of people. Strong Microsoft Professional Suite experience.
summary: The Sr IT Delivery Analyst provides coaching, mentoring, and auditing functions for Agile projects, ensuring adherence to Flagstar Bank Playbook and governance routines. They support project delivery functions, including budget tracking, project evaluation, and compliance. The role involves evaluating project schedules, resources, and budgets for accuracy and completeness, as well as managing stakeholder expectations and facilitating cross-functional agile teams. The Sr Analyst monitors project progress, promotes continuous communication, and helps improve team dynamics.

title: Quality Control Analyst l
description: Description POSITION SUMMARY The Quality Control Analyst I position is responsible for Quality Control testing and validation of CU*BASE and related software applications. This position works closely with the members of both the Product and Programming teams to analyze reported software problems and new project specifications and assist in follow-up coordination, testing and validation. Essential Job Functions Perform testing of new and enhanced CU*BASE and related software as assigned by Quality Control management. Document test procedures and results as required by the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and CU*Answers Programming and Development Standards and Guidelines. Analyze problem Logs reported by clients and assist Technical Resources leadership in ensuring follow-up coordination, testing and validation. Support Documentation efforts as needed, including documenting software changes and testing procedures. Maintain a positive contribution as a member of the Technical Resources Team, and complete all tasks assigned by management to meet team objectives. Job Qualifications High School Diploma or equivalent required. Two-year degree or comparable work experience required. Experience and comfort working with computer software; ability to learn and explore new software independently. Experience with the CU*Answers CU*BASE system preferred, but not required. Familiarity with credit union operations, regulation and procedures, accounting and balancing functions preferred but not required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Thoroughness, excellent attention to detail, and good problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and initiate projects with minimal supervision. Ability to use discretion when dealing with sensitive or confidential data. CU*Answers is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that supports the unique perspectives and experiences from all employees and supports a collaborative community spirit. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any status or condition protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.
summary: The Quality Control Analyst I position involves testing and validating CU*BASE and related software applications. Responsibilities include performing tests on new and enhanced software, documenting test procedures and results, analyzing problem logs, supporting documentation efforts, and working collaboratively with the Technical Resources team.

title: Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description: About Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world. Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness. We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone. About Agoda Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world Get to Know Our Team Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance or cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like vertical credit cards. Its a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering. The Opportunity We are looking for engineers with experience in the fintech area. This can be a year or two at a fintech startup right through to an expert in this domain. You might have a background as ‘ back end ’ or ‘data’ engineer , either way we are looking for smart engineers who can be super agile, move fast and have an eye for detail. We’d love to hear from you if you are skilled in any of the technologies we work with and excited at building new fintech technology. In this Role, you will get to Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks What You’ll Need To Succeed Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field 8+ years of experience in Data engineering Good experience in Apache Spark Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools SQL experience Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience Systems administration skills in Linux It’s great if you have Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems Experience working with summary: Agoda, an online travel booking platform, is seeking a Data Engineer with 8+ years of experience to join their Fintech team. Responsibilities include leading technical improvements to data systems, building and scaling data processing pipelines, and designing/deploying new systems. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Scala, Spark, Java, Golang, Python, Hadoop, SQL, and S3, along with experience in Big Data technologies, SQL, and Linux system administration.

title: Associate Platform Engineer, DevOps Support
description: About the Role: Grade Level (for internal use): 08 About the Role: The Team: The S&P Global MI Cloud Engineering Shared Services - Platform Engineering team is looking for a skilled DevOps Support - Associate to join our growing team. This position requires the associate to work a flexible shift tailored to coincide with Eastern Standard Time (EST) in the US, ensuring optimal collaboration and support for our operations. Our team f acilitate s software development in the 18,000-person Market Intelligence division by managing AWS and vendor-hosted applications including GitLab, Azure DevOps, GitHub, Artifactory, Jira, Confluence, Mend, SonarQube, TeamCity and Run d eck . In this role, you will play a crucial part in providing technical support to our clients, ensuring smooth operation and resolution of any issues that arise, while also leveraging your skills as a Cloud Engineer. The ideal candidate will have experience with AWS, Terraform, Python, and/or Linux administration, possess strong problem-solving abilities, and have a passion for helping our internal developer teams by providing an exceptional developer experience. Our team is fun, dedicated, and supportive, tackling interesting technical and design challenges every day. Join us to grow your skills and make an impact! Responsibilities and Impact: Provide technical support to our clients, ensuring smooth operation and resolution of any issues that arise. Manage and troubleshoot issues reported by clients. Document all support interactions and resolutions accurately in ServiceNow - mySolutions ticketing system daily. Resolve issues in creative and effective ways. Proactively identify opportunities for process improvements to enhance the Developer Experience with our applications such as automating our manual intake process and current BAU work efficiently. Compensation/Benefits Information : (This section is only applicable to US candidates) S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $48,000 to $86,000. The final base salary for this role will be based on the individual's geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan. This role is not eligible for additional compensation such as an annual incentive bonus or sales commission plan. This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here . What W e're L ooking F or : Basic Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent work experience. Excellent communication skills with the ability to engage effectively with global teams. Basic Linux experience for server-side troubleshooting and maintenance. Basic scripting skills in Python, Bash, or PowerShell. Strong problem-solving abilities and a passion for helping both our internal developer teams by providing a great developer experience. Additional Preferred Qualifications: Basic understanding of DevOps engineering and CI/CD practices or experience as a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE). Basic knowledge of monitoring and observability tools such as Datadog and Splunk. Experience working with ticketing systems and knowledge base tools is a plus. Experience in AWS in deployment using Terraform or CloudFormation . AWS certification is a plus. Familiarity with source control (Git, GitHub) and feature branching strategies. Right to Work Requirements: This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States. About S&P Global Market Intelligence At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction. For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence . What's In It For You? Our Purpose: Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology-the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world. Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress. Our People: We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide-so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all. From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We're committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We're constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference. Our Values: Integrity, Discovery, Partnership At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals. Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That's why we provide everything you-and your career-need to thrive at S&P Global. Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body. Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on. Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills. Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs. Family Friendly Perks: It's not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families. Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards-small perks can make a big difference. For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global: At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation - Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn't stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all. Equal Opportunity Employer S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment. If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person. US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. This role involves providing technical support for clients, managing and troubleshooting issues, and proactively identifying opportunities for process improvements. The ideal candidate will have experience with AWS, Terraform, Python, and/or Linux administration, along with strong problem-solving skills.

title: Systems Engineer Level 2
description: The Systems Engineer Level 2 provides exceptional service to our customer accounts. Through analysis of service tickets, problem solving, and proactive investigation of issues, they will ensure the smooth operation of technical systems. They will address customer complaints, as well as installing and updating both hardware and software components. About K Group Companies K Group Companies is a locally owned and operated technology company that was established in 1980 and located in Grand Rapids, MI. We proudly serve clients across the United States, with a strong focus on Michigan. Our expertise spans a wide spectrum of technological services, ensuring that we deliver exceptional solutions at the highest level of quality. Rooted in principles of excellence and creativity, our culture is dedicated to fostering collaboration, innovation, and inclusivity. Why Work Here? “Great focused team environment.” For more than 40 years, K Group Companies has been one of West Michigan’s premier Technology Solutions Provider. From Managed IT services to physical security integration, our team has established itself as a known, trusted advisor to our community. As a local, 3rd generation family-owned business, we pride ourselves in reliable, intentional, and committed relationships with our customers – and each other! Whether we are helping customers secure their environment, beating each other at Mario Kart in our Team Zone arcade, or grabbing lunch at our local BBQ restaurant, we delight in collaboration and making a difference as a team. We truly believe that we are better together! Responsibilities: Engages in thorough troubleshooting and oversees customer-facing tasks with guidance Investigates and resolves problems within customer networks and IT systems using established troubleshooting methods Prioritizes effective communication, coordinating with team members to ensure distribution of work evenly Recognizes chances for upselling throughout the lifecycle of service tickets Efficiently handles support cases, ensuring rapid resolutions that surpass customer expectations Leads and owns new project deployments both onsite and remotely Works alongside the project manager to ensure project completion and expectations Compensation And Benefits Paid Time Off (PTO) Volunteer Paid Time Off (VTO) 100% employer paid family health insurance premium 100% employer paid disability insurance 100% employer paid dental & vision insurance 401k with Safe Harbor contributions from company annually Profit sharing opportunities Bonus programs Qualifications: Strong working knowledge of computer systems, hardware, and software Associate degree or 4 years’ experience required Strong troubleshooting skills with the ability to identify and resolve complex technical problems Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and communicate effectively Proven ability to meet deadlines and handle multiple tasks
summary: Systems Engineer Level 2 at K Group Companies provides exceptional customer service by troubleshooting technical issues, ensuring smooth operation of systems, addressing complaints, and installing/updating hardware and software. They work collaboratively with teams, handle multiple tasks, and identify upselling opportunities. The position requires strong troubleshooting skills, knowledge of computer systems, and experience in hardware and software.

title: Reimbursement Analyst Senior
description: How to Apply A cover letter is required for consideration for this position, and it should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position. Summary Michigan Medicine Finance is seeking a reimbursement analyst to provide support for cost report preparation, cost report appeals, audit preparation, revenue recognition, ad-hoc reporting, and other duties related to the regulatory reimbursement services of Michigan Medicine and it’s affiliates. The service delivery model will involve multiple interactions with Michigan Medicine leadership, affiliated hospitals, payers, outside agencies and government entities. The reimbursement analyst will maintain current knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid and other State and Federal regulations. The analyst also assists in the improvement of internal business processes and meeting future reimbursement service needs. Ideal candidates are reliable and can successfully function with a high degree of autonomy. The position provides the opportunity to take on additional tasks to improve operational efficiency, make or prepare presentations, and represent the reimbursement team to multiple leadership levels within Michigan Medicine. Mission Statement Michigan Medicine improves the health of patients, populations and communities through excellence in education, patient care, community service, research and technology development, and through leadership activities in Michigan, nationally and internationally. Our mission is guided by our Strategic Principles and has three critical components; patient care, education and research that together enhance our contribution to society. Responsibilities* Analyze and complete Medicare, Medicaid, Tricare and Blue Cross cost reports, settlements, audits and appeals and maintain all documentation Utilize various financial systems to perform routine and ad hoc analysis Maintain current knowledge of Medicare, Medicaid, Blue Cross, and other third-party regulations. Participate in and support Michigan Medicine and its affiliates’ initiatives and programs where third-party revenue/reimbursement advice is needed Assist with financial reporting, including monthly third-party payer accounting for net revenue and estimated settlements Monitor third party payments and perform impact contract analysis, to include price mix variance and payer mix reporting. Prepare, monitor, and reconcile reimbursement reports. Proactively work with payers and in-house resources to identify and resolve issues that hinder optimal and correct account payment. Required Qualifications* Knowledge of health care finance or accounting The ability to work autonomously Problem solving and analytic skills Effective communication and presentation skills Strong attention to detail Excellent teamwork and customer service orientation. Demonstrated competency with Excel and database software BA/BS Degree 2-5 years of experience-Intermediate 5-7 years of experience-Senior Experience Preferred candidate will have experience in healthcare finance and preferably experience with Medicare, Medicaid, Blue Cross and Tricare cost reports and their various payment methodologies. Education This position requires a bachelor’s degree preferably in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. Desired Qualifications* Knowledge of governmental and other third-party reimbursement methodologies Experience working with electronic cost reporting software used by Medicare, Medicaid, and Blue Cross Prior experience with an academic medical center, a healthcare system or large teaching hospital Working knowledge of Crowe Revenue Cycle Analytic (RCA) software Ability to present hospital facility month end financial data in clear and succinct manner to various finance leaders Prior experience as an auditor for a Medicare Administrative Contractor or other major third-party payer Experience with database design and query writing Work Locations This position is currently a hybrid role with the possibility of being fully remote. Underfill Statement This position may be underfilled at a lower classification depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate. Additional Information Michigan Medicine improves the health of patients, populations, and communities through excellence in education, patient care, community service, research, and technology development, and through leadership activities in Michigan, nationally and internationally. Our mission is guided by our Strategic Principles and has three critical components; patient care, education and research that together enhance our contribution to society. Michigan Medicine Finance serves as the central finance group for Michigan Medicine and is comprised of six functional areas: Clinical Financial Planning & Analysis, Enterprise Financial Reporting & Forecasting, Academic Financial Planning & Analysis, Reimbursement, Medical School Finance, and Financial Systems. Background Screening Michigan Medicine conducts background screening and pre-employment drug testing on job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent job offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background screenings. Background screenings are performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Report Act. Pre-employment drug testing applies to all selected candidates, including new or additional faculty and staff appointments, as well as transfers from other U-M campuses. Application Deadline Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended. U-M EEO/AA Statement The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
summary: Michigan Medicine Finance is searching for a reimbursement analyst to support cost report preparation, appeals, audit preparation, revenue recognition, ad-hoc reporting, and other duties related to regulatory reimbursement services. The role involves interactions with Michigan Medicine leadership, affiliated hospitals, payers, outside agencies, and government entities. The analyst will stay informed about Medicare, Medicaid, and other state and federal regulations. This position offers opportunities for growth and responsibility, including taking on additional tasks, preparing presentations, and representing the reimbursement team to various leadership levels within Michigan Medicine.

title: Business Systems Analyst Sr / Inter
description: How to Apply A cover letter is required for consideration for this position and should be attached as the first page of your resume. The cover letter should address your specific interest in the position and outline skills and experience that directly relate to this position. Your resume and/or cover letter must demonstrate how you meet all the required qualifications. What You'll Do The University of Michigan Medical School department of Medical School Facilities invites applications for the position of Business Systems Analyst Senior/Business Systems Analyst Intermediate to manage business systems supporting Medical School Facilities with a primary role in access control and other security related software and hardware. The position reports to the Facility Safety Services Lead, Medical School Facilities (MSF). The ideal candidate will possess exceptional customer service and technical skills and the ability to communicate clearly across all levels of the organization. The ideal candidate must be able to work independently and as a critical member of a team. This position will service customers across the Medical School located in nearly 4 million square feet of space. As a member of the Operations team, you will participate in the response to customer needs on weekends and evenings. Mission Statement The University of Michigan Medical School mission is to transform health through bold and innovative education, discovery, and service. Our community of faculty, staff and learners throughout 20 clinical and nine basic science departments, is committed to this single mission. Responsibilities* Responsible for all activities and technical guidance for planning, supervising, monitoring, and maintaining systems operations for Medical School Facilities. Function as the department liaison for standards implementation. Function as the point of contact and business owner for Health Information Technology & Services (HITS) relating to infrastructure planning, system conditions, and Network Admission Control (NAC) portal registration for Medical School Facilities equipment. Coordinate corrective and preventative maintenance of systems with stakeholders and maintenance vendors. Manage the inventory and asset life cycle of equipment deployed within Medical School buildings including procurement and disposal. Manage key boxes including installations, moves, updates, access, and audits. Coordinate 800mhz radio services with campus service providers for Medical School Facilities radios. Manage access profiles for the Medical School across two access systems and audit access profiles on a periodic basis. Troubleshoot access situations and advise MCard offices on Medical School access philosophies. Coordinate keying strategies with service providers related to master and space key allocation. Participate in emergency response related to Medical School Facilities systems and operations activity as needed after hours and on weekends. Any other duties as assigned. Required Qualifications* Senior level: 5 Years of direct experience managing and troubleshooting business applications, access control, and/or surveillance systems. A cover letter as first page of resume explaining qualifications and interest in the position Working knowledge of workflow management tools and ticketing systems. Experience with access control software and associated hardware. Experience in a customer service position demonstrating positive customer outcomes. Proficiency in Microsoft Suite of software including Teams, Word, Excel, Outlook, and associated keyboarding skills. Intermediate level: All of the above with LESS than 5 Years of direct experience managing and troubleshooting business applications, access control, and/or surveillance systems. Desired Qualifications* Experience working with the U-M Division of Public Safety and Security to develop solutions related to access and security issues. Knowledge of Michigan Medicine and Medical school policies/procedures and organizational structures. Experience with internet protocol, analog, and/or digital surveillance systems. Experience with C-Cure 9000 access software and associated hardware. Experience with University of Michigan systems (Business Objects, M-Pathways, Service Now, etc.). Familiarity with an academic medical center operation and associated business. Experience managing and planning budgets related to business systems, access control, surveillance, and operations systems. Excellent organizational skills, including time management, project management and attention to detail. Ability to assess competing priorities, manage workflow, and meet operational deadlines in a complex matrixed environment. Ability to work and communicate within a team environment, as well as independently with limited direction or oversight. Work Locations This position supports operations in all buildings the medical school occupies across nearly four million square feet. There is an expectation that a significant amount of time on campus will be required to manage the job requirements and for onsite meetings, planning efforts, and other activities. There will be times that it will be appropriate to work from home. The position may require working during non-business hours and on weekends. Underfill Statement This position may be underfilled at a lower classification depending on the qualifications of the selected candidate. Candidates with less than 5 years experience will qualify for a Business Systems Analyst Intermediate level. Additional Information We offer a benefits package that includes comprehensive training and career development opportunities, generous retirement savings plans, ample paid time off, and a wealth of family care support: https://careers.umich.edu/benefits Background Screening Michigan Medicine conducts background screening and pre-employment drug testing on job candidates upon acceptance of a contingent job offer and may use a third party administrator to conduct background screenings. Background screenings are performed in compliance with the Fair Credit Report Act. Pre-employment drug testing applies to all selected candidates, including new or additional faculty and staff appointments, as well as transfers from other U-M campuses. Application Deadline Job openings are posted for a minimum of seven calendar days. The review and selection process may begin as early as the eighth day after posting. This opening may be removed from posting boards and filled anytime after the minimum posting period has ended. U-M EEO/AA Statement The University of Michigan is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer.
summary: The University of Michigan Medical School is seeking a Business Systems Analyst Senior/Intermediate to manage business systems supporting Medical School Facilities with a primary role in access control and other security related software and hardware. This position requires exceptional customer service and technical skills, the ability to work independently and as part of a team, and the willingness to respond to customer needs on weekends and evenings. The position reports to the Facility Safety Services Lead, Medical School Facilities (MSF).
benefits: Comprehensive training and career development opportunities

title: Programmer Analyst 4
description: Role : Programmer Analyst 4 Duration: 1 year; Extension likely Location: 7285 Parsons Dr. Dimondale, MI (Onsite) Interviews: MS TEAMS/Video with camera on and integrated audio used. Must be able to come onsite 2x a week to Dimondale location from day 1 Local and Non Local may apply During the interview, a demonstration of writing a basic PSQL query will be required. Skills: Experience with querying databases such as Oracle and SQL Server required 5 years Ability to create reports, display in visual manner for easy consumption required 5 years Software testing in SAP required 2 years Create mocked up data files 3 years Effective communication skills to coordinate with team about status and issues required 5 years Requirements: Supporting the Department of Treasury, the elected person will need to be fingerprinted in addition to the State of Michigan background check. Role Description: This position is responsible for special duties on Treasury's project to replace the legacy mainframe with SAP. Duties include loading data into SAP and modifying data for testing in an interface application. The analyst will validate data scrambling in the test databases, write scripts that will create data in interface applications, create mock files for interface data loads, and query Oracle databases to profile current data. A strong foundational understanding of querying data, creating programs to create and validate data, and database structure is required. This person should possess strong attention to detail, follow processes exactly, and precisely follow security guidelines. These activities will be done in a fast-paced environment with quick turnaround and high pressure. During the interview, a demonstration of writing a basic PSQL query will be required. Skills: Experience with querying databases such as Oracle and SQL Server required 5 years Ability to create reports, display in visual manner for easy consumption required 5years Software testing in SAP required 2 years Create mocked up data files 3 years Effective communication skills to coordinate with team about status and issues required 5 Responsibilities: Create data files. Create and modify test data. Validate data has been scrambled using SQL. Consistently provide high quality queries with results in various formats (spreadsheets, visual tables). Create queries for data analysis and profiling. summary: This role is a Programmer Analyst 4 for a 1-year contract with potential extension. It involves supporting Treasury's project to replace a legacy mainframe with SAP. The analyst will be responsible for loading and modifying data in SAP, validating data scrambling in test databases, writing scripts to create data in interface applications, creating mock files for data loads, and querying Oracle databases for data profiling. Strong database querying, data manipulation, and database structure knowledge are required. The role emphasizes detail, process adherence, and security awareness, and requires working in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

title: LIMS Data Manager or LIMS Admin
description: Key Responsibilities Drive requirement gathering sessions to define and develop project milestones Document requirements both process diagram workflows and data flow documentation Collaboration with the business to understand the business value of the new projects requested for delivery Configure master data and provide data governance for the existing solutions Required Skills Bachelor of Science Minimum Of 3 Years Of Relevant IT Experience Highly skilled in the creation of business process maps from a user interface and data flow perspective Strong written and verbal communication skills Demonstration of building strong business relationships and influencing capabilities at all levels of an organization Ability to see the connections/opportunities in business areas (ambiguous areas) Strong analytical skills Experience in the use of database (data analysis leveraging SQL) LIMS application configuration experience Domain knowledge in lab work/processes Desired Skills Knowledge in Lab Information Systems Work experience in scientific discipline (Biology, Biochemistry, or related) Work experience in Supply Chain (Logistics, Planning, or related) Experience with VB/VBA, .Net, Java Exposure to agile software development 3+ years of experience working as a Functional, Data or Business Analyst 3+ years of experience in Access, Excel(Advanced), and Visio, 3+ years of customer interfacing experience project oversight, customer presentation.

The candidate will work with stakeholders to define project requirements, document workflows, and configure master data. Strong analytical skills, database experience, and communication skills are essential.

title: Business Analyst III
description: Great Lakes Energy is looking for a Business Analyst who can determine project and business process requirements implementing technology solutions where processes, systems or workflows can be enhanced or streamlined to improve efficiency, productivity, and quality. Who We Are For over 85 years, we have powered rural communities across 26 counties in western and northern Michigan. We serve over 128,000 meters as the third-largest Michigan-based electric utility and the state's largest member-owned power company. We prioritize enriching the lives of our community members. We not only provide electric service, but we also provide reliable and robust fiber technology through Truestream, a communication solutions subsidiary of Great Lakes Energy. We have over 300 employees who are more than just colleagues - we're a close-knit family of diverse professionals united by a shared vision. Our collaborative environment encourages creativity, empowers growth, and fosters a sense of purpose in everything we do. A Day in The Life of a Business Analyst Your day is a mix of offering assistance and collaboration on open support items, analyzing business processes, and implementing business process enhancements. You will work to design solutions that meet business needs while adhering to technical constraints and best practices. You will also manage projects from initiation to closure by developing project plans, tracking progress against milestones, and communicating status updates. You won't always being working as a team of one, collaborating with your colleagues and other departments is critical. Through collaboration and business process integration you'll lead the development of test plans and scenario planning to ensure that technology solutions and business processes are in alignment. You'll also champion the use of technology in business processes through continuous improvement techniques. This means you'll provide ongoing support, troubleshoot issues, and coordinate resolutions through documentation and training of business systems. Who You Are You're the kind of person who thrives in a fast-paced environment and likes to troubleshoot and solve complex problems. You enjoy determining business process requirements, and how technology systems can be implemented to increase efficiency. You use logic and reasoning to identify alternative solutions to problems you encounter and are continuously monitoring to make improvements. You love to dig into the who, what, when, where, and WHY's in order to streamline processes and gain efficiency. You consider your ability to influence others' perspectives or decisions through effective communication among one of your top strengths to help foster collaboration and drive impactful change. You enjoy interacting with others through managing projects, providing support and knowledge sharing, teaching, and generally looking for ways to help others any way you can - but you have no problem spending some alone time tackling day-to-day tasks and projects either. You've got some impressive credentials too. A bachelor's degree in information systems management or computer science and at least five years related experience (relational databases, various operating systems, reporting development tools including Crystal Reports, and competent with Microsoft Office including Visio)? This is the kind of stuff that makes you stand out. But hey, if you think you have equivalent education or experience, that you think are pretty impressive, we would love to hear about that too! What's in It for You? Benefits You are valuable to us, and our benefits are here to show it. That's why we put employees first-your health, your family, and your development. We have a number of benefits, both traditional and progressive, to support you and your family through life's various stages. Here's just a taste of what we have to offer: The Essentials We foot the bill for comprehensive health insurance benefits. You'll be hard-pressed to find better for you and your family...seriously! Time to Spend Generous paid time off (PTO) puts you in the driver's seat for how you'll use your time. Better Health Through Better Living We believe healthy employees are happy employees.We have a diverse wellness program that provides support and resources for financial and mental wellbeing, as well as reimbursement for wellness related products such as gym memberships, tennis shoes, and much more! When Life Hands You Lemons GLE knows that sometimes life doesn't go as planned. We offer benefit plans to help soften the blow of the unexpected. Life insurance and short- and long-term disability insurance packages are paid for by GLE. More Time with Your Baby New parents get time off to bond with their new bundle of joy. Parental leave benefits provide two weeks of family-friendly paid leave for moms and dads to bond and care for their growing families. Growing your family through adoption? You're awesome! We may be able to help you with related expenses up to $2,000. Never Stop Learning We hire our employees for a reason, and we want to keep them around. We also want to be an industry leader, so we will train you while you work. If you want to further your career, education or job shadow a different position, we do that too. Keep it Casual When you work for us, you work in comfort. Blue jeans are the norm in our office. Remote Work Few silver linings come from a pandemic, but we count our Remote Work Program among them. The Business Analyst position offers hybrid flexibility with up to two days per week working from home as desired. Riding Off Into the Sunset Your future is important to us and we have the numbers to prove it. We have two retirement savings plans for eligible employees, with participation rates off the chart! A traditional pension and a 401k option? Yes please! How To Apply This is more than a job; it's a journey of innovation and collaboration. So, if you're ready to dive into a day filled with challenges, solutions, and making a real impact, come join us. Your expertise will shape the way we power the future. We know your time is valuable and that's why our application is short. Grab your resume and answer a few short questions at the link below. Great Lakes Energy is an equal opportunity provider and employer. Salary: $82700 - $103000 per year Job Posted by ApplicantPro
summary: Great Lakes Energy is seeking a Business Analyst to analyze business processes, design and implement technology solutions for enhanced efficiency, productivity, and quality. Responsibilities include determining project requirements, managing projects, collaborating with teams, developing test plans, providing ongoing support, troubleshooting issues, and championing technology integration. The ideal candidate will have a bachelor's degree in Information Systems Management or Computer Science and at least 5 years of related experience with relational databases, various operating systems, reporting development tools, and Microsoft Office.

title: Business Application Analyst
description: Summary The Business Applications Analyst (BAA) is an expert problem solver and has a demonstrated problem solving skill set. The BAA is the primary technical resource for assigned applications. The BAA establishes and maintains a consultative partnership with business area/users, provides day-to-day support for business applications, and provides administration and vendor relations for assign applications. Supports and works with development, test and production environments. Develop and maintains partnerships with supported vendors. Serves as primary contact and resource between end users and the technical staff and works with both groups to understand business needs, problem solve, and troubleshoot issues identified. Strong communication skills are required to effectively interface with technical and non-technical users and vendors. Responsibilities (30%)*Performs problem solving duties and is able to write and communicate business reports using common problem solving tools. Monitors databases for business applications to optimize performance, resource use, and physical implementations of databases/systems. Maintains development, test, and production environments. Performs quality control and auditing of databases and system data to ensure appropriate use and accuracy of data. (20%)* Responsible for problem management, including troubleshooting, resolution of reported problems, and performance and documentation of root cause analysis. (20%)*Leads and works with end users on appropriate access, upgrades, maintenance, data conflicts, data extracts, and data integration with applications. Liaises with vendor support on all issues. (20%)*Tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs. This includes development of test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. (10%)*Other associated application management, maintenance, and administrative responsibilities as assigned. Other Duties And Responsibilities Provide excellent customer service to all customers while performing duties. Understands and demonstrates ability to perform business problem solving tools and processes. Other duties as assigned. Certifications and Licensures No certifications or licensure required for this position. Required Education Bachelors Degree required Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Business, Health Care or STEM related field required. A combination of education and experience may be considered. Other Information Experience, Training And Skills Minimum three (3) years of experience managing or supporting an application or series of applications, including configuration, release, upgrades and project management. Must demonstrate technical troubleshooting methodology and background. Knowledge and experience reviewing application logs and resolving technical problems without assistance strongly preferred. Familiarity with a server-based database system preferred. Managing business healthcare applications preferred. Strong communication skills with ability to collaborate at multiple organization levels across the health system as required. Demonstrated abilities to lead projects, work effectively and carefully under pressure, meet project deadlines, learn independently, work effectively in a team, communicate effectively with a variety of people and write well are required. Excellent Troubleshooting And Problem Solving Skills Are Required. PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND TYPICAL WORKING CONDITIONS Exposure to stressful situations, including those involving public contact, as well as, trauma, grief and death. Able to wear personal protective equipment that includes latex materials or appropriate substitute if required for your position. Is able to move freely about facility with or without an assisted device and must be able to perform the functions of the job as outlined in the job description. Overall vision and hearing is necessary with or without assisted device(s). Frequently required to sit/stand/walk for long periods of time. May require frequent postural changes such as stooping, kneeling or crouching. Some exposure to blood borne pathogens and other potentially infectious material. Must follow MyMichigan Health bloodborne pathogen and TB testing as required. Ability to handle multiple tasks, get along with others, work independently, regular and predictable attendance and ability to stay awake. Overall dexterity is required including handling, reaching, grasping, fingering and feeling. May require repetition of these movements on a regular to frequent basis. Physical Demand Level: Sedentary. Must be able to occasionally (0-33% of the workday) lift or carry 0-10 lbs.
summary: The Business Applications Analyst (BAA) is responsible for technical support and administration of assigned applications, working directly with business users and vendors. They troubleshoot problems, perform database maintenance, manage upgrades and releases, and ensure data integrity. Strong communication and problem-solving skills are essential.

title: Senior Cloud Spend Analyst
description: Job Requisition ID # 24WD78821 Position Overview We are seeking a talented and motivated Senior Cloud Spend Analyst to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing our cloud spending, ensuring we are getting the most value from our cloud investments. You will work closely with other teams, including finance, engineering, and product, to identify areas for cost savings and implement effective strategies for optimization. This position is remote in the US, with a preference for Michigan. Responsibilities Analyze cloud usage data to identify trends and anomalies Develop and implement cost optimization strategies, including rightsizing instances, utilizing reserved instances, and negotiating better pricing with cloud providers Create and maintain reports and dashboards to track cloud spending and progress towards goals Identify and implement opportunities to automate cloud cost management tasks Analyze and report on cloud spend trends across all cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) Work with stakeholders across various departments to understand their cloud usage and optimize their costs Contribute to the development and implementation of cloud governance policies Proactively identify and address potential cloud spending risks Forecast cloud spending and track progress against budget Contribute to the development and implementation of FinOps best practices within the organization Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field 3-5 years of experience in cloud cost management or a related field Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Looker, Power BI, or similar Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts and technologies Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) Strong understanding of cloud billing and pricing models Preferred Qualifications Experience with cloud cost management tools Microsoft Azure Fundamental Certification AWS Cloud Practitioner Certification Learn More About Autodesk Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made. We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers. When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us! Benefits From health and financial benefits to time away and everyday wellness, we give Autodeskers the best, so they can do their best work. Learn more about our benefits in the U.S. by visiting https://benefits.autodesk.com/ Salary transparency Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. For U.S.-based roles, we expect a starting base salary between $112,200 and $181,610. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location, and may exceed this range. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package. Equal Employment Opportunity At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. Diversity & Belonging We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).
summary: Autodesk is seeking a Senior Cloud Spend Analyst to analyze and optimize cloud spending, identify cost savings, and implement strategies for optimization across various cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP). The role involves working with teams like finance, engineering, and product to achieve cost management goals.

title: Systems Engineer
description: Job Title - Systems Engineer Location - Troy, MI (Hybrid) Phone + Skype Job Description: The Systems Engineer is a challenging role wherein you can gain expertise in the system by interacting with a multi-disciplinary project team to understand the system better and by finding ways to optimize processes and improve efficiency. As a Systems Engineer, you will work as part of a technical team focused on developing solutions for our clients. This position is a strong fit for someone looking to experience diversity in their career and who wants to learn while becoming a multi-faceted developer. Requirements Each Candidate MUST HAVE: At least 2 years of Automotive experience 4+ years of experienced in system engineering principles. They are flexible to 2 years if you have someone who is strong. Experienced in Requirement analysis tool either with Polarion/Doors/MKS-RM Experienced in System architecture tools SysML/IBM rhapsody Some sort of experience with ASPICE process Job Description: Understand the customer requirements Identify gaps in the platform requirements and customer requirements Support System Architect in the feasibility analysis of the requirements and system architecture documentation Create the project specific system requirement document Create project specific system architecture Create compliance metrics (Sys.2 and Sys.3) Collaborate with relevant stakeholders for system engineering activities Additional Skills & Qualifications: Education and Experience Requirements: BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and a minimum of 5-10 years of experience in the Software Engineering field Automotive experience Experienced in system engineering principles Experienced in Requirement analysis tool like Polarion/Doors/MKS-RM Experienced in System architecture tools SysML/IBM rhapsody ASPICE process 8+(senior) 4+(junior) Automotive experience 4+(senior) 2+(Junior) Experienced in system engineering principles A software engineer moved into a systems role would be a nice to have.
