That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career. About The Team Our GTM (Go-To-Market) Analytics team is on the mission to maximize revenue by providing actionable insights and reporting to our partners across Sales, Marketing, and Growth. GTM Analytics is situated within the broader Data Science organization at Stripe, which is home to a diverse team of data analysts and scientists, product managers, and engineers that span their focus across sales, marketing, and product-led growth. GTM Analytics leverages sales, marketing, and product data to build and provide a wide variety of tools that are utilized across the company to drive business decisions. What you’ll do As a senior member of the GTM Analytics team, you will lead analytical projects that shed light on our self-service business. You will increase our understanding of growth drivers and influence business outcomes by recommending solutions rooted in analyses and your deep understanding of Stripe’s users. You will partner closely with cross-functional Growth pods of product managers, marketers, engineers, and data analysts and scientists that obsess over the experience Stripe users have on their journey to become customers – from initial signup through onboarding and retention. Responsibilities Collaborate with Growth stakeholders to ideate, scope, and develop data products that shed light on Stripe’s self-service business. Influence Stripe’s Growth roadmap by proactively identifying opportunities and emerging trends in Stripe’s Growth business in ongoing forums. Develop frameworks that allow for analysis at scale across Stripe’s self-service experience. Build and maintain data pipelines and dashboards that provide consistent and timely data and insights. Work with finance partners on forecasting and planning models that provide visibility into the future of Stripe’s self-service business. Define key Growth metrics, gain consensus around their definitions, and drive adoption of their usage. Who you are We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement. Minimum Requirements 8+ years of experience in analytical roles working with large datasets Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences or a related quantitative field Proficiency in SQL and Python Experience building self-serve dashboards or other scalable analytical tools for partner teams Strong knowledge of statistics Expertise in data storytelling and visualization, using data-driven insights to deliver actionable recommendations and drive business goals Demonstrated ability to lead and deliver on multiple projects with a high attention to detail Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, Sciences or a related quantitative field and/or experience in working on data analytics in the tech field Experience developing data-informed narratives and visualizations for external publication Experience working with institutions that are respected by policymakers and the wider public for their economic insight Experience building and maintaining data pipelines using a distributed data framework (e.g. Hadoop, Spark) Hybrid work at Stripe This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office). Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live. Pay and benefits The annual US base salary range for this role is $179,000 - $268,400. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings ("OTE") range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the US may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process. Additional benefits for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; 401(k) plan; medical, dental, and vision benefits; and wellness stipends.
summary: Stripe is seeking a Senior GTM Analyst to lead analytical projects for its self-service business. This role involves collaborating with Growth stakeholders, influencing the Growth roadmap, developing analytical frameworks, building data pipelines and dashboards, working with finance on forecasting, defining key Growth metrics, and driving their adoption. The ideal candidate will have 8+ years of experience in analytical roles, a bachelor's degree in a quantitative field, proficiency in SQL and Python, experience with self-serve dashboards, strong knowledge of statistics, expertise in data storytelling and visualization, and the ability to lead multiple projects. Preferred qualifications include a Master's degree, experience developing data-informed narratives, experience with institutions respected for economic insights, and experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop or Spark.

title: Data Analyst, Institutional Data and Analytics
description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web3 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us. There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world. Ready to ? Who you are: You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow. You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job. You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission. You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. Institutional Operations Solutions are responsible for the day to day operations and support of Coinbase’s suite of Institutional Products and Services. We are focused on managing risk and building scale in operations processes as well as providing exceptional customer service to our Institutional clients. As a Data Analyst on our team, you will help drive business impact through data. You will have the opportunity to transform data into valuable business insights and help shape our strategy by establishing critical metrics, building visualizations, and automating reporting. What You’ll Be Doing (ie. Job Duties) Improve operational efficiency and risk management by developing metrics, self-service tools, and deep analyses that drive actionable insights. Proactively identify opportunity areas for improvement including reporting automation, deep dive investigations, and new analytical partnerships. Collaborate in a tight-knit team environment to foster efficient execution, innovation, and continuous improvement. Develop and support the analytical technologies that empower our team to have timely, flexible, and structured access to our data. Collaborate with multiple operations teams to manage an analytic roadmap. Drive the vision, building, and adoption of self-service analytic capabilities; develop these capabilities at scale. Understand data resources and know when, how, and which best to use for each project. Work cross-functionally with other data owners to to maximize consistency and establish best practices. Frame and break down complex business problems into key components and recommend practical solutions. Monitor key performance metrics and use data to identify actionable opportunities to minimize risk and increase efficiency. What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) 3+ years of experience working with data in a relevant function (e.g. operations, finance, business analytics, etc.). Advanced SQL and data modeling skills, Python experience a plus. Motivated by Coinbase’s mission, crypto and delivering an exceptional Institutional product to our customers. Proficient using at least one data visualization product (Looker, Tableau, QuickSight, SuperSet, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communication skills are required, including experience meeting with and communicating information to senior leadership. Highly collaborative, with an ability to gather and balance inputs from many cross-functional partner teams. Ability to think strategically, formulate appropriate analytical solutions, and execute in order to solve business needs. Highly flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth, fast paced organization. Nice To Haves Report automation experience (e.g. using Apache Airflow, Python, etc.). Deep subject matter expertise and experience in crypto and financial services, including risk management. Experience with financial industry regulations. Experience with descriptive and inferential statistics. Experience with customer support metrics/data. Job #: P57441 Pay Transparency Notice: Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below. Full time offers from Coinbase also include target bonus + target equity + benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Pay Range $131,325—$154,500 USD Commitment to Equal Opportunity Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view the Know Your Rights notice here. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please contact us at accommodations[at]coinbase.com to let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. title: Data Analyst IV -locals
description: Data Analyst IV Location: Chicago IL Duration: 6 Months Update 4/11 Manager is looking for someone with strong PowerBI experience who is also capable with communicating and collaborating directly with product and business teams independently. Need someone who is comfortable with ambiguity and able to navigate through that to get to the answers needed. Highly analytical and excel at ambiguity Have experience with large and complex datasets – we have 400-500K of customers a day and our operation is complex PowerBI Independent with minimal supervision – self starter We do not get requirements from our users – so this individual will need to be a thought leader and present ideas. title: Data Analyst - 99% Remote
description: Data Analyst 99% Remote with occasional days onsite in Chicago Summary: This person will be working on a team of data engineers, BI Developers and other data enthusiasts, assisting with a variety of functions as it relates to the end goal of powering data driven decisions for the business. This includes structuring data, working heavily with SQL, moving data, building data pipelines, working with data quality and if there's time developing dashboards and reports yourself (although we have plenty of strong folks on the team that can do this as well). We also are looking for someone who enjoys interacting with the business and other teams to understand requirements and can provide solutions based on the goals of the business. Responsibilities: Synthesize and interpret data into a narrative of business performance and actionable insights in deliverables of various formats. Just the data. Design, build, prototype, and deploy data analysis frameworks Translate business needs into technical specifications Conduct and support whiteboarding sessions, workshops, design sessions, and project meetings as needed Researches and develops new algorithms and statistical techniques based on customer needs Work in partnership with business analysts, application architect, application developers to build data transactions and warehousing systems Structure large data sets to find usable information Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information Work with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement Make effective and decisive decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project Requirements: 2+ years of experience with Data Analysis Strong SQL experience Table structures, stored procedures, functions, views, select/insert/update Data mining, data transformation, data cleansing Ideally Azure SQL experience as well Experience working with business users and other IT team members to gather requirements regarding data projects, and documenting these requirements Nice to have experience Azure experience (the more Azure data services you've worked with the better) Experience building data pipelines - any Python or Spark experience to help move data would be great Experience with BI or Reporting - we use Power BI so any of this experience would be great

title: Sustainability Data Analyst
description: Are you passionate about sustainability and data? We are seeking a full-time candidate to join our Advisory team. Your focus will be on providing large-scale data analysis and strategic advisory services across public and private sectors, specifically related to energy and carbon emissions calculations and management. The ability to manage data projects, visualize and communicate data findings creatively and effectively, provide analytical expertise, and create evidence-based recommendations for implementation will be critical to help our clients assess, plan, and ultimately achieve their decarbonization and wider sustainability goals. Responsibilities: As a key part of the team, your responsibilities will be varied, but likely to include: Provide data analysis and extract actionable insights for multiple clients/projects at a time. Analyze large-scale datasets related to energy, carbon, and water to identify trends and insights that drive strategic decisions in sustainability. Develop forecast models that incorporate projected grid emissions factors and other relevant parameters to aid clients in making informed decarbonization decisions. Develop and refine data collection systems and databases to ensure high-quality data for analysis and decision-making. Support and lead the technical components of Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas inventory projects. Create dynamic data visualization tools and dashboards using Power BI, Tableau, and Excel to effectively communicate insights. Craft detailed technical reports, presentations, and memos tailored for a diverse range of clients, including public sector agencies, private enterprises, and academic institutions, ensuring that data-driven recommendations are clearly and effectively communicated. As an experienced Sustainability Data Analyst, it is expected that you can demonstrate the following: Strong familiarity with various aspects of the built environment and possess the necessary analytical skills to support client and design decision-making processes, especially concerning decarbonization strategies Solid understanding of Scope 1, 2, and 3 greenhouse gas accounting methodologies Ability to effectively work with a wide array of databases that range in quality, size, and type, while organizing data workflows from the outset to ensure consistency and integrity Ability to manage multiple simultaneous and overlapping tasks and projects successfully Comfort interfacing with clients and leading client meetings Excellent technical communication skills, including storytelling capabilities related to written, oral, presentation, and visual design Ability to think analytically and strategically, derive insights from data, and synthesize into client-ready deliverables (e.g., presentations, reports, discrete analysis, etc.) Ability to quickly identify issues, assimilate information and develop solutions. Organized, self-motivated, proactive, and collaborative in team environments. Strong graphics and visual story-telling capabilities preferred. Knowledge of policies and funding mechanism to support sustainability and ESG program implementation a plus. Knowledge of cost modelling, commissioning, and/or GHG accounting a plus. Qualifications: Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in related field (examples include but are not limited to Data Science, Sustainability or Environmental Science, Engineering, Economics, Urban Planning, Public Policy, etc.) Minimum 4-6 years’ experience in sustainability in roles that involved analyzing and visualizing data. Advanced Excel experience with the ability to develop dynamic tools in Excel and other data visualization tools including PowerBI and Tableau Data analytics experience using Python a plus Software and Frameworks: Demonstrated knowledge of Microsoft Excel and PowerBI or Tableau Experience in using GHG Protocol for calculations preferred Proficiency in Python a plus What we offer: Salary range of $80,000 to $115,000. This will be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experience. Generous benefits package Annual discretionary bonus Generous PTO (4 weeks) in addition to 10 paid holidays 401k with company match Student Loan Repayment Assistance Hybrid working & summer hours Reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees Global network of experts Learning and development opportunities
summary: We are seeking a Sustainability Data Analyst to join our Advisory team, providing data analysis and strategic advisory services for public and private sectors, focusing on energy and carbon emissions. You will analyze large-scale datasets, develop forecast models, create visualizations, and craft reports for clients aiming to achieve decarbonization and sustainability goals.
benefits: Reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees

title: Data Analyst
description: Overview We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team! As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture. We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more! Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team! Responsibilities P&C Analytics is seeking to hire a data analyst in the Financial Operations - P&C Analytics Claims Function. As a data analyst in this role, you will extract, transform, load and analyze data for new and existing asks, and provide actionable insights and analysis to Claims executive, department leadership and business partners to enable better decision-making and improve operational performance. The key work efforts will include: Performing timely and accurate analysis to answer business questions in a fast-paced environment. Synthesizing and transforming available data into concise verbal, written and visual presentations. Developing data requirements, identifying data sources, and validating data and analysis. Extract, transform, and load data for reports and analytics solutions. Effectively analyzing data, creating appropriate visualizations, and communicating results of analyses to various levels of leadership in a relevant manner. Proactively sharing insights with business partners to enable timely and informed decision making. Collaborating with key business partners to understand and communicate trends. Serving as a trusted advisor and strategic thought partner to Executive leadership, collaborating broadly with others across State Farm to enable execution of key enterprise priorities and contributing to strategic, high-impact work. Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity***** Qualifications Required skills: Preferred- minimum of 3 years of related professional experience and bachelor's degree in relevant field. Preferred- understanding of the Claims operations environment, and effective application of that knowledge in the work through collaboration with peers, leadership, and business partners. Demonstrated learning agility to quickly learn and immediately apply new technical skills and business acumen. Strong analytical, critical thinking, and resourcefulness skills. Strong communication, presentation, and data visualization skills. Comprehensive decision-making and judgment exercised when diagnosing and resolving complex problems and issues. Ability to effectively utilize business intelligence data systems, models, financial/statistical resources, and analytical software applications in the creation of reports, charts, and visuals. Proficient in SAS and SQL with an understanding of relational databases. Proficient in BI Tooling (i.e., Power BI, Qlik, QuickSight). Advanced skills within the Microsoft suite, especially Excel, Word, PowerPoint. Fluency in AWS cloud-based tools and services and statistical analysis skills are preferred. May apply specialized knowledge of research/statistical techniques. Ability to work in a high paced environment. Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity*****
summary: State Farm is seeking a data analyst for their Financial Operations - P&C Analytics Claims Function. The role involves extracting, transforming, loading, and analyzing data, providing actionable insights to Claims executives, department leadership, and business partners to improve decision-making and operational performance. Responsibilities include performing timely analysis, synthesizing data into presentations, developing data requirements, validating data, extracting and transforming data for reports and analytics solutions, analyzing data, creating visualizations, and communicating results to leadership. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills, proficiency in SAS, SQL, BI tooling, and Microsoft Suite, and fluency in AWS cloud-based tools.

title: Analyst, Master Data
description: Job Location: Chicago This role is based out of our corporate HQ located in downtown Chicago and will be a hybrid in-person/remote role. Want to make an impact? Master Data Analyst is responsible for creation, management, and governance of master data. This role ensures data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all systems and processes, supporting our supply chain and cross functional team. This position will work with other SAP Analysts, IT Leadership and business representatives to keep abreast of operational issues and business initiatives where SAP may be an integral part. Ways you will make a difference Create, update, and maintain master data records in ERP and PLM Process Develop and enforce data governance policies and procedures t ensure quality data and compliance within the industry standards! Conduct regular audits and data cleansing activities to identify data discrepancies. Identify opportunities for process improvements in data management and recommend solutions to enhance data accuracy. Work closely with cross functional teams to ensure data alignment and support business processes. Skills that will make you successful Experience: Minimum of 3-5yrs of experience data management within the CPG industry Proficiency in SAP, HANA, MDG, BOBJ and Microsoft Office Suite Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to interact with cross functional team at all levels. Analytic Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to details Experiences that will support your success BA/BS in Business or a related field is preferred. Minimum of 1 year experience in data management within the CPG industry Strong SAP technical expertise and experience
summary: Master Data Analyst responsible for creating, managing, and governing master data within a CPG company. This role ensures data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all systems and processes, working with cross-functional teams to implement data governance policies and procedures.

title: Data Analyst, SQL, Reporting
description: Title: Data Analyst, SQL, Report Writing, Manufacturing Location: O'Hare Airport area of Chicago Salary: $100-125K + bonus No sponsorship We are seeking a Data Analyst with solid SQL script writing, ability to write reports and come from a manufacturing/distribution or company that carries inventories. This role will be responsible for ensuring the stability, integrity, and efficient operation of the data system that supports core organizational functions and manufacturing processes. They will also be responsible for helping users maximize the system functionality, analyzing business processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, managing the configuration and maintenance of our data system, utilizing SQL skills for data analysis, and managing system enhancements. They will have a deep understanding of manufacturing operations and processes, and expertise in SQL and Crystal Reports. Responsibilities: System Administration and Support: Manage the environment, including setup, configuration, and routine maintenance. Provide technical support to resolve user issues as they occur. Process Optimization: Work closely with operational teams to understand process requirements and challenges. Develop and implement solutions to streamline operations, improve productivity, and support business growth. Data Management and Integrity: Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data within the system. Implement data controls, validation rules, and routine audits to maintain data quality. Utilize SQL for advanced data management and analysis tasks. Customization and Integration: Customize and configure the system to meet specific operational needs. Integrate with other business systems and applications to enhance functionality and data flow. Use SQL and Crystal Reports for custom reporting and data visualization needs. Project Management: Lead and manage projects, including upgrades, migrations, and new feature deployments. Coordinate with internal teams and external vendors to ensure projects are delivered on time and within budget. Reporting and Analytics: Develop and maintain operational reports and dashboards within, utilizing Crystal Reports and SQL to provide insights and analytics to support decision-making and performance monitoring. Required Qualifications: Proven experience as a Administrator, with a strong focus on manufacturing operations. Expertise in SQL, Crystal Reports, and SSRS for data management, reporting, and analytics. Experience writing SQL Queries, Triggers, Functions, and Procedures. Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Proven analytical, technical, & problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical team members. Preferred Qualifications: 5+ years of manufacturing industry experience Scripting/programming experience using: PowerShell, VB Scripting, Windows Batch Files, or Python
summary: Data Analyst role focusing on system administration, process optimization, data management, and reporting for a manufacturing/distribution company. Requires strong SQL skills, Crystal Reports experience, and familiarity with manufacturing processes.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
description: Barilla is an Italian family-owned food company . Established in 1877, it’s now an international Group present in more than 100 countries. A world leader in the markets of pasta and ready–to–use sauces in continental Europe, bakery products in Italy and crispbread in Scandinavia, the Barilla Group is recognized worldwide as a symbol of Italian know–how. “The joy of food for a better life” is Barilla’s purpose. Bringing people closer to the joy of good food and making quality the choice for a better life, from each individual to the planet. Because this is how we are nurturing the future, today. It's a commitment from field to fork, to bring to the world tasty, joyful and wholesome products, made with selected raw materials from responsible supply chains. Because what we eat today can change our tomorrow. Because good food is a joy for the present and a choice for a better future. Introduction – Organizational Details: Barilla America, Inc. wants to recruit a Supply Chain Data Analyst - within Supply Chain in Northbrook, IL . The individual will report to the Production & Distribution Planning Sr. Manager. Job Purpose: The Supply Chain Data Analyst will problem solve and begin to predict for improved efficiencies in the data integrity throughout Supply Chain interfaces for Planning, Customer Orders, SAP, and Transportation (APO, SAP, EDI, E2Open) working in conjunction with IT and in alignment with global processes. Key Accountabilities: Confirm orders flow through without error from customers on a daily basis to ensure proper order-to-cash (OTC) data flows using internal customer (EDI) system. Communicate with customers and partners in identifying EDI data issues and ensuring the cleaning of any bad records. Ensure proper data flows for weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual planning cycles in APO tool and identify if trends occur for improvements. Partner with IT on continuous improvement data projects to eliminate manual work, find efficiencies, and begin to use predictive models for data analysis. Provide S.C. user support on Barilla America’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems and interfaces. (technical super-user). Support the implementation of upcoming software changes for Forecasting, Planning, and Order Book Management (e.g. SAP/APO, Manugistics, etc.). Provide user support for other Supply Chain tools and systems. Develop relationships with the category business teams and manage expectations through deep knowledge of business processes, strategies, and goals. Maintain excellent working relationships and healthy partnerships with business partners and external vendors. Proactively monitor interfaces between business systems and resolve any issues. Facilitate periodic meetings with business partners for project updates and issue resolution. Proactively identify, escalate, and help resolve issues as they arise. Document Business Processes and SOP. Assist in developing process improvements that can be translated by IT to be put into system improvements. Work with the Business Units to define initiatives and guidelines for business process innovation as a fundamental step towards business change. Education/Work Experience: Bachelor’s degree (Supply Chain Management, BBA in Business Analytics or BBA in logistics and supply chain management) or specialized training Minimum 3 years of experience supporting Supply Chain data analysis, data flows and systems 3 years of SAP (ERP) support experience, APO preferred Attention to detail and ability to troubleshoot data integrity issues on business processes Experience using APO, EDI (Gentran preferred), and SAP (at least 1, multiple a plus) E2Open or Transportation software experience preferred Strong communication, interpersonal, and influencing skills Ability to prioritize multiple tasks to ensure end-user satisfaction Ability to be able to identify end-to-end processes and understand the effect of errors and changes on the overall downstream processes Technical/functional experience a plus Super user experience in supply chain and ERP systems Experience working for a CPG or manufacturing company a plus. Ability to travel domestically and internationally if needed, less than 5% travel Barilla is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of Barilla to prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and to afford equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to characteristics including, but not limited to, age, race, color, culture, ethnicity, nationality, faith, religion, gender, pregnancy, family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, veteran or protected veteran status, political opinions, health, or disability.
summary: Barilla America is seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst to improve data integrity across its supply chain interfaces, including planning, customer orders, SAP, and transportation systems. The analyst will work with IT to identify data issues, ensure proper data flow, and implement continuous improvement projects. They will also provide user support for Barilla's ERP systems and interfaces, support software changes, and maintain relationships with business partners.

title: Data Analyst I
description: Job Title: Data Analyst I Location: Lake Forest, IL – Onsite – Local candidates only Period: 07/29/2024 to 10/31/2024 – Potential for extension Hours/Week: 40 hours (hours over 40 will be paid at time and a half) Rate: $23 – $26/hour Contract Type: W2 only Scope Of Services The Data Analyst I will support the organization by conducting detailed research and analysis of customer records and data. The ideal candidate should have experience with SAP, Salesforce, Power BI, and possess strong data analysis skills. This role requires the ability to resolve issues related to data accuracy and completeness, ensuring data integrity across multiple platforms. Role, Responsibilities, And Deliverables Research and match new customer records added to Data Foundation from Sales Tracing, SAP Instruments, Definitive Healthcare, and Salesforce contracts. Research and resolve issues submitted by Company Sales reps via the Data Governance System, including missing accounts, customer segments, and commissionable status. Research and reconcile missing data records across various sources, such as instrument tracking and contract alignment. Support special projects as defined by management. Assist in addressing and resolving ad-hoc issues submitted by sales reps. Utilize data analysis skills to interpret and analyze complex data sets to provide actionable insights. Maintain data integrity by performing regular audits and quality checks. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in a related field such as Data Science, Business Analytics, Information Systems, or equivalent. 0-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field. Experience with SAP, Salesforce, and Power BI. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Excellent problem-solving abilities and the ability to work independently. Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
summary: The Data Analyst I will conduct research and analysis of customer records and data, ensuring data integrity across multiple platforms. Responsibilities include matching new customer records, resolving data issues, reconciling missing records, and supporting special projects. The ideal candidate will have experience with SAP, Salesforce, Power BI and strong data analysis skills.

title: Data Analyst
description: Summary The data analyst will own the following: extract data from APIs, SQL databases, and other sources, manipulate and clean data, and turn data into insights. They will develop analysis and reporting capabilities, as well as monitor performance of our company to identify improvements. Requirements Advanced SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. Experience with reporting packages (BI tools, Excel, etc.), databases (SQL etc.), programming (Python, Java, Scala, ETL frameworks, etc.) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, RStudio, SAS etc.) Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings 2+ years of experience
summary: Data Analyst responsible for data extraction, manipulation, cleaning, and analysis to generate insights for company improvement. Develops reporting capabilities and monitors company performance to identify areas for optimization.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Senior Data Analyst Salary: $120k We are seeking a skilled Reporting and Project Management Lead to develop and maintain a comprehensive reporting framework and manage complex projects. This role is essential in understanding key drivers of customer behavior, synthesizing data into actionable strategies, and optimizing business performance across sales, marketing, and customer engagement (B2B and B2C). The ideal candidate will have experience managing cross-functional teams, excellent communication skills, and a strong analytical background. What You’ll Be Doing: Develop and maintain a comprehensive reporting framework that meets the needs of stakeholders across the organization. Understand key drivers of customer behavior and the relationship with marketing levers. Synthesize first-, second-, and third-party data into actionable strategy and measurement objectives. Identify areas of optimization and incremental growth for the business related to sales, marketing, and customer performance. Ensure that reports are accurate, timely, and meet stakeholder requirements. Work with stakeholders to conduct intake and identify new reporting requirements and implement solutions to meet those needs. Present reports and analysis to key stakeholders. Develop and maintain project plans and timelines. Ensure that projects are delivered on time and to the satisfaction of stakeholders. Manage project risks and issues, and take appropriate action to mitigate them. Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders on a regular basis. Prioritize projects based on strategic objectives, resource availability, and other factors. Manage team responsibilities including hiring, coaching, training, and conducting performance evaluations. What You Bring to the Table: Experience managing complex reporting projects, including the ability to analyze data and provide insights to stakeholders. Experience managing cross-functional teams to deliver projects. Excellent communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels. Strong analytical skills, including the ability to analyze data and identify trends and patterns. Proficiency with BI tools such as PowerBI or similar. Experience with Snowflake data warehouse. Familiarity with reporting and project management software/tools. Knowledge of process improvement methodologies. Skilled in SQL and Excel. Basic Qualifications: 5+ years of experience in reporting and project management. 5+ years of data and analysis experience. 3+ years of experience managing direct reports. Preferred Qualifications: PMP Certification. Master’s degree in Business, Analytics, or a related field. Advanced SQL skills. Experience with Python or R for data analysis. What We Offer: Inclusive culture with associate-led Business Resource Groups. Flexible PTO (22 days) and Holiday Schedule. Online and retail discounts, company match 401(k), physical and mental health wellness programs, and more!
summary: A Senior Data Analyst role is available for a skilled Reporting and Project Management Lead to develop and maintain a comprehensive reporting framework, manage complex projects, and optimize business performance across sales, marketing, and customer engagement. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience managing cross-functional teams, proficiency with BI tools like PowerBI, experience with Snowflake data warehouse, and knowledge of project management methodologies.
benefits: Physical and mental health wellness programs

title: Data Operations Analyst
description: Curinos is the leading provider of data, technologies and insights that enable financial institutions to make better, and more profitable, data-driven decisions faster. Born out of the combination of two familiar industry powerhouses, Novantas and Informa’s FBX business, Curinos brings to market a new level of industry expertise across deposits, lending and digital experience solutions and technologies. Curinos operates under a hybrid modality . This individual may work from the New York City, Boston, or Chicago offices. Job Description The Data Operations team handles the day-to-day processes of the entire suite of Curinos data products. The team collects data using various formats and methods, ingests the data, quality checks the data, and prepares the data for client consumption. Clients use the data to deliver the right product for the right price to the right customer at the right time via the right channel. We are seeking a Data Analyst for our Retail Lending Data Team. The ideal candidate is motivated and thrives in a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative environment. They will bring a blend of analytical thinking and creativity to the team, ultimately playing a substantial role in our team’s execution and operations. They will: Have strong hands-on analytics experience, drive, and curiosity Communicate directly with clients (verbal & written) to understand and process their pricing model and data Configure client’s data in Curinos proprietary system Thoroughly document configuration for each client’s data Collaborate with team members to maintain overall accuracy and timeliness of client report deliverables Assist team members in other departments as needed to fulfill company goals Desired Skills & Expertise: Bachelor’s degree 2+ years of professional work experience in an analytical and data-driven environment, financial and lending experience is a plus Proficiency in MS Excel (e.g. formula writing, pivot tables, comparison tools, etc.) Proficiency in relational databases (e.g. SQL) Excellent written and oral communication skills with an ability to explain data trends and patterns to internal and external stakeholders Ability to work both independently and own the problem and solution from start to finish Base Salary Range: $65,000 - $75,000 Why work at Curinos? Competitive benefits, including a range of Financial, Health and Lifestyle benefits to choose from Flexible working options, including home working, flexible hours and part time options, depending on the role requirements – please ask! Competitive annual leave, floating holidays, volunteering days and a day off for your birthday! Learning and development tools to assist with your career development Work with industry leading Subject Matter Experts and specialist products Regular social events and networking opportunities Collaborative, supportive culture, including an active DE&I program Employee Assistance Program which provides expert third-party advice on wellbeing, relationships, legal and financial matters, as well as access to counselling services Applying: We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't meet all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have relevant skills or experience, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats, special requirements to access our buildings or adjusted interview formats please contact us at careers@curinos.com and we’ll do everything we can to help. Inclusivity at Curinos: We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Curinos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, colour, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.
summary: Curinos is seeking a Data Analyst for their Retail Lending Data Team. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in a data-driven environment, with financial and lending experience preferred. They will be proficient in MS Excel, SQL, and have excellent communication skills. The role involves data collection, ingestion, quality checks, and preparation for client consumption. They will work on data configuration in Curinos' proprietary system and collaborate with team members to ensure accuracy and timeliness of client reports.
