title: Data Analyst/BI Developer
description: Data Analyst/BI Developer NYC (midtown) or Chicago (Loop) - (WFH 3-4 days/week) Summary We focus on data-driven questions that matter to our business and can be solved through the application of data analysis, statistics, and computer programming. We develop insights through alternative datasets and analytical methods to help fill in gaps in our understanding of specific assets, markets, and macroeconomic themes. We leverage geospatial, demographic, and economic data, as well as advanced analytics to evaluate live real estate deals across sectors and geographies. In other words, we sit at the intersection of quantitative and investment analysis. You will have the opportunity to work with directly with our fellow portfolio companies and Blackstone. If you enjoy fast-paced, stimulating, quantitative work with a tangible business impact, we may be a good fit for you. The ideal candidate is a data practitioner, who has experience working with diverse sets of structured and unstructured datasets. The individual needs to be passionate about the application of data science to drive business impact, and intellectually curious about solving real-world questions using data. Working for one of the world's largest owners of real estate, you will have the opportunity to raise the bar for physical asset investing. What you'll be doing Develop dashboards with BI tools (you can choose what you want to use) to help business leaders make more informed decisions Identify opportunities that you see in the data, and provide recommendations to business leaders based on your analysis Proactively take initiative to recommend projects that would better support the business Perform due diligence and contribute to targeted research projects. Build strong relationships with all teams across the business. Develop a deep understanding of Multifamily investment, finance, and operations. Expand our technology platform and data analysis processes Skills we're seeking 1-5 years of professional experience with BI development using Power BI Proficient with SQL and relational databases Excellent communication skills ﻿Nice to have experience ﻿﻿ Experience working in financial services or real estate Experience with R, PyData stack or other advanced analytics tools Experience with Snowflake or other cloud-based DWs Statistics or quantitative analysis background (education or professionally ﻿
summary: This role involves using data analysis, statistics, and computer programming to solve business problems, with a focus on real estate investment. The ideal candidate is a data practitioner with experience working with diverse datasets and a passion for using data science to drive business impact. They will develop dashboards, identify opportunities in data, make recommendations, perform due diligence, build relationships, and develop a deep understanding of multifamily investment, finance, and operations.

title: Human Resources Data Analyst
description: HR Data Analyst As an HR Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing and interpreting data, and providing insights to support strategic decision making and help improve business performance and processes. You will work with datasets from various sources to identify trends and patterns and communicate findings to drive organizational effectiveness and employee engagement. Key Responsibilities: Generate regular reports, dashboards and ad-hoc analyses to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide actionable insights to HR leadership and business stakeholders. Develop automated reporting solutions to streamline the reporting process and customized reports to support ad-hoc requests and strategic initiatives. Analyze HR data in Workday and other HR platforms to identify trends, patterns, and relationships related to recruitment, retention, employee engagement, performance, diversity, workforce management and other HR metrics. Apply statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to extract insights and make predictions. Support workforce planning and forecasting initiatives by analyzing historical data and predicting future trends in areas such as headcount, turnover, and talent acquisition. Create clear and compelling visualizations (e.g., charts, graphs, dashboards) to communicate data findings in an actionable format. Collaborate with cross-functional teams including business analysts, data engineers and department heads to align HR data analytics with business objectives and priorities. Provide analytical support for HR initiatives and projects. Identify opportunities to streamline HR processes and improve efficiency through data analysis. Collaborate with HR business partners to develop data-driven solutions that enhance employee experience and organizational effectiveness. Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization. Identify opportunities for process improvement and contribute to the development of data analytics capabilities within the organization. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Statistics, Business Administration, Information Systems, or related field is preferred. Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in HR or related field, with strong analytical and quantitative skills. Strong Excel, analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large datasets and multiple systems. Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI is preferred. Knowledge of statistical methods and machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders. Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity.
summary: This position involves analyzing HR data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and relationships related to recruitment, retention, employee engagement, performance, diversity, and workforce management. The HR Data Analyst will generate reports, dashboards, and ad-hoc analyses to support strategic decision making and improve business performance and processes.

title: Data Analyst
description: Position Number 8150669 Job Category University Staff Job Type Full-Time FLSA Status Exempt Campus Maywood-Health Sciences Campus Department Name HEALTH INFORMATICS & DATA SCI Location Code HEALTH INFORMATICS & DATA SCI Is this split and/or fully grant funded? Yes Duties And Responsibilities The Urban Malaria Project is dedicated to comprehending the burden and determinants of malaria transmission in urban areas within countries where malaria is endemic. Our ultimate objective is to leverage this understanding to contribute valuable insights to national malaria strategic planning. The Chicago Team at Loyola University seeks a Research Data Analyst to support development of analytical pipelines and products for our research projects. The ideal candidate will support our Postdoctoral Research Associates and Principal Investigator in data quality assessment, data cleaning and analysis. Responsibilities Collates, cleans, and analyzes data to support development of manuscripts, and oversight of field work. Conducts quality assurance of existing analysis and identifies areas for further investigations. Develop new analytical techniques to improve existing methods and/or research techniques. Conducts literature reviews to facilitate manuscript development. Develops systems for improved data management and extraction of geospatial data. Minimum Education And/or Work Experience Experience: Master’s degree or doctorate in related field; 1-3 years’ experience in advanced quantitative data analysis required or a combination of Education and work experience. Qualifications Minimum Qualifications Solid illustration skills or interest in learning. Ability to communicate technical results in a non-technical manner to reach a broader audience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience working in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment. Positive attitude and cheerful disposition. Proactive and capable of working independently. Quick learner with the ability to acquire new skills efficiently. Certificates/Credentials/Licenses Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Statistics, Geography, or related disciplines. Computer Skills Basic troubleshooting skills, use of web browsers and internet, intermediate Microsoft Office knowledge, file maintenance and organization, email etiquette, digital safety and security. Strong scripting skills in R or Python. Supervisory Responsibilities No Required operation of university owned vehicles No Does this position require direct animal or patient contact? No Physical Demands None Working Conditions None Open Date 12/13/2023 Close Date Special Instructions to Applicants Diversity and Inclusion Statement Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion As one of the nation’s largest Jesuit, Catholic universities, Loyola University Chicago fosters a transformative cultural experience that honors diversity, equity, and inclusion . We are committed to not only recruiting, but also retaining a diverse, mission driven workforce and enabling a culture of inclusiveness in an environment that values service excellence, stewardship, personal well-being, and professional development for all of our employees. Loyola University Chicago supports its staff and faculty with a wide array of affordable, comprehensive and competitive benefits centered on health and wellness, financial security, equity, and work-life balance. We actively seek those who wish to join our faculty, staff, and students in a community of diverse opinions, perspectives, and backgrounds supporting our Jesuit mission and striving toward the same goal of being persons for and with others. Quick Link for Posting https://www.careers.luc.edu/postings/27086
summary: Loyola University Chicago is seeking a Research Data Analyst to support the Urban Malaria Project. The ideal candidate will possess a Master's degree or doctorate in a related field, along with 1-3 years of experience in advanced quantitative data analysis. The responsibilities include data cleaning, analysis, quality assurance, developing new analytical techniques, and contributing to manuscript development.  Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for improving data management systems and extracting geospatial data.

title: Data Analyst
description: About Us HirexHire (pronounced hire by hire) is a Chicago-based recruiting and talent consultancy that integrates with companies short-term to provide long-term talent solutions. We take a seat in our client’s everyday operations to understand their people's goals, gaps, and challenges. We then develop and implement the processes and technologies to execute a sustainable and scalable talent plan. We partner with companies expecting or experiencing high growth who need to hire at scale or fill a critical role rapidly. Our clients are not looking for quick-fix placements but are thoughtfully building a hiring strategy to scale their businesses. OUR CLIENT Location: Chicago, IL HQ (remote) Industry:Healthcare Technology (SaaS) Company Size: 50+ What They Do: Our client is a cloud-based software platform and patient engagement technology that automates the collection of patient reported outcomes. It also offers procedure-specific education modules to help prepare patients for treatments and proactively monitors their recovery. Contact HirexHire for more client information THE ROLE As a core member of our client’s Data Engineering team, the Data Analyst will work on a broad array of problems that rely on data to derive insights for the client's business and customers. You will collaborate cross-functionally with members of the Engineering, Product, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to make impactful contributions to the client’s data platform solutions. An ideal candidate will be diligent, curious, and self-motivated to unlock the power of data to transform the patient experience and drive positive healthcare outcomes. This role is 100% remote within the U.S. What You Will Do Develop analytic solutions for internal teams and external customers on topics such as business development, patient engagement, patient-reported outcomes, and performance intelligence. Collect, clean, and organize large datasets from a variety of sources. Develop and implement statistical models to uncover trends and patterns in the data; and communicate findings and insights to stakeholders through clear and compelling visualizations and reports using tools such as Metabase. Contribute to existing data pipelines directly or through feedback to ensure accuracy and reliability. What You Will Need A deep understanding of SQL and Python. Experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Metabase, Tableau, or PowerBI. Experience with CRM data (HubSpot or Salesforce). Strong analytical problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to prioritize tasks, regularly communicate progress, and meet established deadlines. What Our Client Offers Competitive Salary Flexible, Unlimited PTO Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance Performance Bonuses Company 401K Professional Development Opportunities Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. HirexHire is dedicated to building diverse and inclusive teams for our clients, so if you are excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly align, we encourage you to still apply! We may have another fit for you!
summary: This role is for a Data Analyst who will work on a broad array of problems that rely on data to derive insights for the client's business and customers. You will collaborate cross-functionally with members of the Engineering, Product, Customer Success, and Marketing teams to make impactful contributions to the client’s data platform solutions.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: *No C2C Available* *Applicants must NOT require sponsorship now or in the future* Job Summary: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, extract and analyze data, create reports, and design visualizations. Work with end users and software vendors to administer and support assigned business applications. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 1. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, define important metrics, recommend best solutions, identify trends and anomalies, and update reports based on feedback. 2. Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources, including SQL Server Data Warehouse, data lakes, and other data repositories. 3. Develop and maintain reports and interactive dashboards using SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and Power BI to provide stakeholders with relevant information. 4. Implement data virtualization techniques to efficiently access and integrate data from disparate sources. 5. Work with the data engineering team to design and optimize data pipelines. 6. Collaborate with data architects to ensure data quality, consistency, and accuracy. 7. Assist in data modeling and create tabular data models using SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS). 8. Monitor data performance and troubleshoot any issues related to data processing or reporting. 9. Performs other duties as assigned. Requirements: 1. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or related discipline 2. 4 to 6 years of experience as a Data Analyst or related role. (Certification in Power BI or SQL Server and familiarity with cloud-based data platforms is preferred) 3. Strong knowledge, skills, and abilities in the following areas: a. Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and analyzing data. b. Experience with ETL processes, including data cleansing and transformation Knowledge of data virtualization concepts and tools. d. Understanding of data lake and data fabric architectures. e. Familiar with creating dashboard reports, status reports, infographics, and other data visualizations. f. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. g. Strong communication and analytical skills with a focus on meeting customers’ needs.
summary: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, extract and analyze data, create reports, and design visualizations. Work with end users and software vendors to administer and support assigned business applications.

title: Data Analyst
description: JBA International is seeking the services of an experienced Data Analyst for a 6+ month Contract engagement. This is a remote position to be based in Pacific Standard Time Zone. The project will be led by our clients Project Manager and will work closely with Business Systems Analysts. What You Will Doing Develop innovative data analytic solutions that utilize modeling and optimization with business practicality for multiple business domains for ODS Products. Identify, define, and evaluate key metrics and underlying drivers of positive user experience and member engagement. Capable to take an abstract problem, and break it down into concrete, manageable pieces, that lend themselves to an analytical approach. Build ranking and recommendation algorithms to recommend best next business action. Analyze complex structured and possibly unstructured data to develop predictive models, forecasting, optimization, and recommendation rules. Work closely with business stakeholders across multiple departments to identify data analytic opportunities and develop effective solutions. Challenge conventional practices and use creativity and information to lead, innovate, problem solve, and implement ideas to contribute to the growth of the organization. Collaborates with co-workers to achieve common goals. What Qualifications You Should Have Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Statistics, Econometrics, Operations Research, etc.). 3+ years of work experience in Data Analytics and Predictive Analytics, preferably in healthcare and/or financial services industries. Demonstrated work experience rapidly applying industry-specific on the job business learning to practical solutions with no or little prior industry context. Advanced knowledge of SQL. Experience with big data platforms (AWS, Spark, Hadoop), experience with Python is a plus. www.jba.com
summary: JBA International is seeking a Data Analyst with 3+ years of experience for a 6+ month remote contract. The role involves developing data analytic solutions, identifying key metrics, building ranking and recommendation algorithms, analyzing complex data, and collaborating with stakeholders across multiple departments.

title: Claims Data Analyst
description: Job Description Chubb North America Claims seeks a Claims Data Analyst to assist with, and manage the day-to-day recurring weekly, annually, and monthly data projects related to the following lines of business: Personal, Property, Casualty, Automobile, Marine, Professional Liability, Workers’ Compensation and Accident & Health. This position will focus on the collection, cleansing and evaluation/interpretation of data sets for the larger claim organization. Responsibilities Evaluate independently Chubb NA claim systems, processes, controls, and procedures to improve efficiency in reporting, along with ways to streamline the existing process. Look to utilize existing data sources, along with development of new data sources over time. Perform data analysis for the claim organization, utilizing a blend of technical claims handling skills and other technical skills such as data cleansing and statistical analysis. Leverage soft skills such as critical thinking and the ability to effectively communicate with IT professionals and claims professionals of various levels. Communicate with colleagues and manager on any matters of significance related to changes or enhancements to existing data elements. Develop and provide recommendations and strategies for resolution. Collaborate with colleagues to ensure that regulatory changes that may impact the respective data being managed for various lines of business are contemplated in reporting needs. Identify and evaluate gaps, weaknesses, and deficiencies, and elevate issues to management when warranted. Engage with variable offshore resources, and dissect complex data sets, as well as work with external and internal teams to data and text mine the required information to meet data quality standards. Assist in the development and maintenance of various dashboards utilized by State regulators, inclusive of New York, Florida, Utah, among others. Manage data utilizing excel and Qliq. Qualifications Strong analytical and technical skills to identify “root causes” of compliance deficiencies and respond effectively and efficiently with necessary short and long-term recommendations, solutions and controls. Experience with data collection and reporting software. Skilled use of Microsoft Office products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, Teams). Strong proficiency with excel functions. Ability to easily filter and efficiently format large data sets quickly. Ability to manage multiple projects and consistently execute and deliver in a dynamic and developing environment. Strong ability to prioritize and consistently deliver results. Strong interpersonal skills, ability to communicate and manage at all levels of the organization. Able to work independently, as well as in groups. Qliq experience preferred. Travel required (15%). Educational And Professional Requirements Entry Level Position, college degree preferred, but not required. About Us Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance, and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally. At Chubb, we are committed to equal employment opportunity and compliance with all laws and regulations pertaining to it. Our policy is to provide employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other conditions or opportunities of employment, without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, ancestry, mental and physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, age, and pregnancy or any other characteristic protected by law. Performance and qualifications are the only basis upon which we hire, assign, promote, compensate, develop and retain employees. Chubb prohibits all unlawful discrimination, harassment and retaliation against any individual who reports discrimination or harassment.
summary: Chubb North America Claims is looking for a Claims Data Analyst to manage data projects related to various lines of business. The role involves data collection, cleansing, analysis, and reporting, as well as identifying and resolving data-related issues. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical and technical skills, experience with data collection and reporting software, and proficiency with Excel.  This is an entry-level position, college degree is preferred but not required.

title: Infrastructure Data Analyst
description: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One. Job Description Responsible for developing big data/analytics/cloud projects which gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis. Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action. Interprets data and analyze results using various statistical techniques and tools. Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions. Collaborate with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship. Responsibilities Develop, design, and maintain Power BI dashboards, reports, and visualizations to meet business requirements. Work closely with stakeholders to gather requirements, understand data sources, and ensure accuracy and relevance of insights. Create efficient data models, DAX calculations, and queries to optimize performance and usability of Power BI solutions. Implement best practices in data visualization, ensuring intuitive and actionable insights for end-users. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources and maintain data integrity. Conduct performance tuning and troubleshooting of Power BI solutions as needed. Stay updated with the latest Power BI & Alteryx features, tools, and trends, and recommend improvements or enhancements. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent work experience. Six to eight years of statistical and/or data analytics experience. Preferred Skills/Experience Proven experience as a Power BI Developer or similar role, with expertise in developing complex Power BI solutions. Proficiency in data modeling, DAX, M, and SQL with the ability to optimize queries and data transformation processes. Proficiency in SQL is a must, utilizing MS SQL. ETL tools such as Alteryx is a must Strong analytical skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. Certification in Power BI or related technologies is a must The role offers a hybrid/flexible schedule, which means there's an in-office expectation of 3 or more days per week and the flexibility to work outside the office location for the other days. If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants. Benefits: Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours): Healthcare (medical, dental, vision) Basic term and optional term life insurance Short-term and long-term disability Pregnancy disability and parental leave 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure) Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities Adoption assistance Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law EEO is the Law U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal KNOW YOUR RIGHTS EEO poster. E-Verify U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program. The salary range reflects figures based on the primary location, which is listed first. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, U.S. Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401(k) contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $116,280.00 - $136,800.00 - $150,480.00 Job postings typically remain open for approximately 20 days of the posting date listed above, however the job posting may be closed earlier should it be determined the position is no longer required due to business need. Job postings in areas with a high volume of applicants, such as customer service, contact center, and Financial Crimes investigations, remain open for approximately 5 days of the posting listed date.
summary: This role at U.S. Bank involves developing big data/analytics/cloud projects, gathering and integrating large volumes of data, performing analysis, interpreting results, and developing actionable insights for company-wide use.  The position requires proficiency in Power BI, Alteryx, SQL, data modeling, and DAX for building dashboards, reports, and visualizations. It also involves collaborating with stakeholders and cross-functional teams.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data Analyst Chicago or Dallas - WFH 2 days/week (onsite 3 days/week) Summary As a Data Analyst, you'll focus on managing data, both from a technical standpoint and also functional standpoint to ensure the data solutions that are being built align with business goals. As such, part of your job will focus around working with stakeholders to understand what they are looking to get from data solutions. And then the other part of your job will focus around writing complex SQL queries to extract data from various databases, DWs and other data sources, and aggregate data into DWs or other data stores. We are big on automating data movement, so you'll also have an opportunity to work with Python or other tools to build data pipelines. What you'll be doing Mine data from primary and secondary sources, organize data in a format that can be easily read by humans or machines Interpret data sets, identifying trends, patterns relevant for diagnostics and predictive analytics efforts Conduct requirements gathering and capture findings for development teams Collaborate with business analysts, engineers, and other team members to deliver overall team outcomes Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of data analysis process and replicate the analysis if necessary Skills we're seeking 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, or working in similar capacities Must have strong experience writing SQL queries Must have strong experience working with SQL databases Nice to have experience: Experience working as a Business Analyst, or gathering requirements for projects Experience using Python, or similar languages, for automation Experience working in cloud-based environments, ideally with Azure or AWS Experience with cloud-based DWs, such as Snowflake Experience working in Agile environments
summary: As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for managing data from both a technical and functional perspective. You will work with stakeholders to understand their data needs and then extract data from various sources using complex SQL queries. You will also be involved in automating data movement using Python or other tools.  You will interpret data sets to identify trends and patterns for predictive analytics. The role involves collaboration with business analysts, engineers, and other team members.

title: Senior Associate, Data & Technology, Data Strategy Analyst (Remote)
description: Ankura is a team of excellence founded on innovation and growth. Practice Overview Ankura’s Data & Technology Practice includes client services in the areas of Analytics & Data Strategy, eDiscovery & Cyber Security. Our Data & Technology team helps our internal and external customers design, execute and test cutting edge solutions in each of our respective areas. Role Overview As a Senior Associate, Data Strategy Analyst in the Data Analytics & AI practice you will have the opportunity to work closely with our diverse clientele, assisting them in leveraging data to make informed strategic decisions. You will play a vital role in conducting in-depth analyses, generating actionable insights, and providing strategic recommendations that leverage data and drive value for our clients to support their mission. This role offers the chance to work on challenging projects, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to the success of leading organizations across industries. This role is remote, located in the United States. Responsibilities Collaborate with client stakeholders to understand strategic objectives Develop strategies for collecting, transforming, cleaning, and modeling data with the goal of identifying meaningful trends and supporting decision-making Conduct competitive analyses, market research, and industry benchmarking to identify growth opportunities and inform recommendations to clients Drive large-scale business and process decisions through data insights Support the implementation of strategic initiatives by tracking progress, measuring performance against objectives, and recommending adjustments as needed Stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data analytics and consulting to enhance service offerings and deliver innovative solutions to clients Qualifications Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future BA/BS in Computer Science, Business Analytics, MIS or another analytical area 3+ years of experience with data analysis, data science, or data analytics in a consulting or similar environment Experience with analytics and data visualization to recognize complex data to support decision-making Experience with using data methodologies to generate cross-functional solutions through collection, interpretation, evaluation, and analysis of large data sets Experience using Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Project Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data and insights to non-technical audiences. Team player who is comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment Ability to travel 25%+ or as needed, dependent upon engagement(s) For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in California, Colorado, or New York, Ankura is required to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to the said markets and considers a broad range of factors including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. The range does not include additional benefits outside of salary. At Ankura, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each role. A reasonable estimate of the current base pay range is between $65, 000 to $155,000; this range is not a promise of a particular wage. Ankura is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against based on disability. Equal Employment Opportunity Posters, if you have a disability and believe you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, submit an online application, or participate in an interview/assessment, please email accommodations@ankura.com or call toll-free +1.312-583-2122. This email and phone number are created exclusively to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be returned. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues unrelated to a disability, will not receive a response.
summary: Ankura is seeking a Senior Associate, Data Strategy Analyst to join their Data Analytics & AI practice. This role will involve collaborating with clients to develop data-driven strategies, conducting in-depth analyses, generating actionable insights, and providing strategic recommendations. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, experience with data analysis and visualization, and excellent communication skills.

title: Data Analyst
description: Title: Data Analyst Location: 4822 N. Broadway Schedule: Hybrid, Monday to Friday (8:30am-5:00pm) Summary Are you passionate about using data to drive organizational performance and program quality? We are seeking a dedicated Data Analyst to join our team and contribute to the success of Heartland Human Care Services (HHCS)! As the Data Analyst, you will work under the direction of the Director, Data Management and Performance Improvement, to meet HHCS's data strategy objectives related to organization performance management and program quality. You will lead administration, reporting, training development, and analysis related to organization performance data collection and quality in the performance management system (ESM+Strategy), applicable survey platforms (Microsoft Forms, Survey Monkey, Alchemer), and select program funder compliance requirements. Collaborating with the CMS Salesforce Analyst, you will improve timely participant data collection through data quality monitoring processes and development of learning resources. Additionally, you will be responsible for internal requests related to participant data in the centralized data system, Salesforce. Your individual accountabilities and work volume will be established through the development of annual Success Objectives, providing a clear framework to guide your efforts. Leveraging industry knowledge and best practices, you will promote the mission and vision of Heartland Human Care Services, while also supporting culture development and management efforts. Apply Now and Help Us Make Informed Decisions Through Data! Why Join Us Make a Difference: Be a part of an organization that is deeply committed to creating positive change in the lives of individuals and communities. Professional Growth: Take on a leadership role where you can develop and implement asset management systems, supervise a dedicated team, and contribute to ongoing education initiatives. Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy a range of benefits, including medical, dental, vision insurance, 401(k) match, paid maternity and paternity leave, commuter benefits, student loan assistance, and more. Our Benefits Medical insurance. Dental insurance. Vision insurance. 401(k) match. Paid maternity leave. Paid paternity leave. Commuter benefits. Student loan assistance. Tuition assistance. Disability insurance Essential Functions Duties & Responsibilities Creates reports and conducts analyses from organization’s data collection systems, including the centralized CRM database (Salesforce), the organization’s strategic performance management system (ESM+Strategy), and survey applications (Microsoft Forms, Survey Monkey, Alchemer) to support the Operations Department in meeting HHCS’ data quality and performance improvement goals and applicable funder compliance requirements. Runs queries in data collection systems to gather needed data, connect data sets, and utilize methods to analyze, compile, and present data in understandable formats for internal management and organization use. Leads the development and maintenance of dashboards, program and department performance tracking, and reporting related to progress and insights to inform quality improvement. Monitors data quality and works with the Director, Data Management and Performance Improvement to develop and implement strategies and processes to improve data quality as needed. Collaborates on development and facilitation of trainings and meetings related to data collection systems, data quality monitoring, program performance, and outcomes analysis. Works in collaboration with the CMS Salesforce Analyst to develop and maintain data collection system learning resources, lead learning sessions, and document procedures related to data collection, management, and reporting processes. Coordinates administration of and conducts analyses of the HHCS Annual Participant Survey in conjunction with the Quality Improvement Committee Coordinates and communicates reporting timelines to internal stakeholders to ensure timely reporting for HHCS. Reviews Operations Department reporting processes to identify efficiencies that will streamline reporting efforts. Provides executive summaries of key data points to leaders as needed. Conducts user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure proper functioning of data systems when changes are implemented. Troubleshoots basic technical problems related to data entry and reporting within database systems used by the Operations Department. Performs other duties as assigned. Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Management, or related discipline Two years of relevant experience independently conducting data management, data analysis, or data science initiatives Two years of experience independently managing data cleaning, quality monitoring, data visualization, program evaluation, data system training facilitation, project management, and technical writing preferred. Demonstrated project management skills and confidence presenting data summaries to various audiences and tiers across the organization. Previous human services, NPO, or case management experience a plus. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Technical Skills: Intermediate to advanced level of proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required; experience managing and manipulating large sets of data using Excel preferred; experience with Salesforce, ESM+Strategy, Adobe; and other software routinely used by Heartland Human Care Services a plus. Comfortable with remote meeting applications, such as Microsoft Teams and Zoom. Meticulous attention to detail. Analytical Skills: Incorporates the fullest range of information available into analysis and decision making; uses appropriate technical processes/systems to develop and evaluate options in an effective and time-efficient manner; assimilates data to draw out relevant insights and findings from analyses; Identifies opportunities and risks to feed into decision making; presents analyses in an appropriate format providing clear and concise recommendations. Business Awareness: Understands and works towards the mission and the aims of the HHCS organization; seeks to learn and understand HHCS programs and business processes; is user centric – seeks to understand, listen and respond to user needs. Collaborative: Approachable, credible and willing whenever to engage with colleagues; actively and appropriately seeks input from others; focuses on interacting with colleagues in an positive and open manner; listens to what colleagues are saying and considers from different perspectives and tailor’s responses accordingly. Communication: Writes succinctly and clearly tailors’ level of detail to the requirements of colleagues as needed; communicates clearly and precisely and able to convey thinking comprehensively; provides regular, clear and concise communications to manager, colleagues or other relevant people to keep updated on activities; structures and prepares well-written, logical outputs with limited guidance and editing. Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business documents and technical procedures. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and operating procedures. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from internal stakeholders and all levels of staff and management. Relationship Management: Communicates purposes, goals, timelines, and strategies clearly; Ability to work independently in a diverse workplace and within a dynamic environment; Ability to plan and execute training for users in all positions. Excellent interpersonal skills (collaboration, communication, receptiveness). Experience working autonomously and in-group settings. This position will be a great fit for those interested in learning and adopting best practices for business operations, quality improvement, and/or data management. Project Management: Develops project plans and realistic action plans based on data-driven analysis; Prior experience in positions which demonstrated the ability to proactively look for and implement strategies, prioritize work, able to multi-task and handle multiple responsibilities; Completes projects on time; Manages activities through timetables, metrics reporting, and visual presentation; Strong attention to detail, accuracy and presentation; Excellent analytical and evaluative skills. Adaptability: Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events; Able to multi-task and lead in a fast-paced environment. Dependability – Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with alternative plan. Reasoning Ability—Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of instructions. Ability to synthesize written and verbal information. Work Arrangement Must have a remote space to work from home, and able to participate and engage in virtual meetings. Laptop and access to Teams environment will be provided by Heartland. Required to attend appointments and meetings in person as requested. Work Environment The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Program sites are located throughout the Chicago area, including the North and South sides of Chicago, as well as the suburbs. Employees may be required to report to any one of our locations on a temporary or permanent basis. Physical Demands While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk. The employee is regularly required to use hands to key, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to sit. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Equal Opportunity Employer Statement Heartland Human Care Services makes all hiring and employment decisions, and operates all programs, services, and functions without regard to race, receipt of an order of protection, creed, color, age, gender, gender identity, marital or parental status, religion, ancestry, national origin, amnesty, physical or mental disability, protected veterans status, genetic information, sexual orientation, immigrant status, political affiliation or belief, use of FMLA, VESSA, military, and family military rights, ex-offender status (depending on the offense and position to be filled), unfavorable military discharge, membership in an organization whose primary purpose is the protection of civil rights or improvement of living conditions and human relations, height, weight, or HIV infection, in accord with the organization's AIDS Policy Statement of September 1987.
summary: Heartland Human Care Services is searching for a Data Analyst to manage and analyze data from multiple sources, including Salesforce, ESM+Strategy, and survey applications, to inform organizational performance management and program quality improvement.  The Data Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining dashboards, reports, and training resources related to data collection, quality monitoring, and outcomes analysis.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Chervon is one of the world’s largest power tool and lawn and garden equipment manufacturers with a rich history of innovation. Chervon’s commitment to build a better world by building better tools is evident in the products we manufacture and our green approach to manufacturing. We focus on hand-held portable power tools, stationary bench tools, laser and electronic equipment and outdoor power equipment. With world-class R&D, manufacturing, design, marketing, sales, and service teams throughout the world, we do it all. Summary of Responsibilities: As the Senior Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to serve as a key resource for resolving complex technical issues related to application support, integration, and development. You will lead initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and ensure data reliability and availability. Key Responsibilities: Serve as a primary resource for resolving complex technical issues related to data infrastructure and processes. Collaborate closely with the Global IT team to address escalated technical issues, ensuring timely resolution and minimal impact on operations. Support SAP Concur system. Utilize your deep understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing solutions to enhance data analysis capabilities and drive informed decision-making. Facilitate training sessions for team members, equipping them with knowledge of DataOps principles and best practices. Develop, maintain, and update comprehensive documentation, including troubleshooting guides, Knowledge Base articles, and best practices. Lead the design and implementation of DataOps practices, overseeing data integration, automation, and monitoring processes to streamline operations and enhance data reliability and availability. Provide systems integration support, including API coding capabilities. Write integration code to support applications in OMS, EDI, SQL, Python, and SAP Concur. Required Skills and Qualifications: Proven experience in data management, database administration, and IT support, specifically with Oracle ERP and MySQL databases. Proven experience in SAP Concur setup. Strong proficiency in troubleshooting, configuring, and managing data infrastructure, with experience in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing solutions. Familiarity with data integration tools and techniques, including experience with workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, AWS Step Functions) and version control systems (e.g., Git). Expertise in designing and building DataOps capabilities to automate data processing tasks and streamline data operations. Experience with AWS cloud services, including but not limited to AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon S3. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to diagnose complex technical issues and implement effective solutions. Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve business objectives. Expertise in Power BI, Java, and SQL. Expertise in scripting languages (Python, Java, and Bash). Knowledge of API development. Working Conditions: This role may entail shift work, including evenings, weekends, and on-call support, to ensure continuous system availability and support coverage. The position offers flexibility with remote and in-office work arrangements based on organizational policies and project needs. Travel to warehouses in the U.S. may be required. Competencies: Leadership Teamwork Strategic thinking Business acumen Personal effectiveness/credibility Communication proficiency Presentation skills Project management Knowledge of the tool industry Work Environment: Chervon North America operates in a casual and fun environment. We offer a very competitive benefits package including health, dental, vision, short/long-term disability, life insurance, 401(k) and a competitive time off program. We think Chervon is a great place to work! Be part of our new future! Better Tools. Better World.
summary: Senior Data Analyst responsible for resolving complex technical issues related to application support, integration, and development. Lead initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and ensure data reliability and availability. Key responsibilities include data infrastructure troubleshooting, SAP Concur support, data modeling, ETL processes, data warehousing, DataOps implementation, systems integration support, API coding, and documentation.

title: Associate Consultant, Business Data Analyst
description: Our consultancy is looking for highly motivated and talented Business Data Analysts. We are looking for peak performers who have a passion for business, a joy in solving problems and a work ethic that doesn't rest until the job is done. Business Data Analysts assist in the deployment of our new services, working hand in hand with the technical counterparts in government agencies. As clients launch and move into steady state, the role also serves to maintain any integration with systems of record, and works closely with implementation managers, client success managers, and client services team members to ensure smooth onboarding and operations for our clients. We are seeking Business Data Analysts who have experience with MuleSoft and GraphQL. Ideal candidates will also have previous experience working with REST or SOAP APIs. We are looking for motivated and self-driven individuals with the ability to work independently. Candidates must have 3-4 years of solid experience in a similar role. We are looking for candidates to have high integrity, drive, grit, high aptitude and team orientation. We are collaborative and passionate about the work we do to improve the lives of our clients and the end users they serve. We have ambitious scaling goals, and we look for team members who are ready to roll up their sleeves, solve problems and find new opportunities to win with our clients. Job Responsibilities Work closely with implementation managers to assess project scope and ensure configuration will meet specifications based on the client's use case Lead discussions during implementation to ensure necessary integrations with various systems, and applicable reporting capabilities for each use case are accurate Build MuleSoft integrations with client data to connect to PayIt’s Platform - either via flat files or REST or SOAP APIs Work cross-functionally to ensure delivery of configuration meets both client and PayIt product specifications Proactively identify potential configuration issues, user experience issues and work with client to ensure they are resolved prior to go live. Support clients in maintaining good platform hygiene (customer friendly workflows, naming conventions, data set organization, etc.). Document and analyze current business processes and underlying systems/applications Monitor, troubleshoot, and resolve problems with MuleSoft live integrations Collaborate with the engineering organization to architect efficient and stable integrations Provide guidance on the monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolution of support issues in collaboration with the appropriate stakeholders Communicate and collaborate effectively with technical peers and business users Minimum Requirements Experience completing integrations of systems via flat files or APIs with a strong understanding of integration architecture options such as APIs Experience writing SQL with the ability to modify existing queries on at least one of the common database platforms, such as SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, and/or DB2 Experience with GraphQL Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Desire to problem-solve Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word Common knowledge of JIRA, Confluence, and other project management based tools Functional experience with various back-office systems (i.e. Oracle, SAP, IBM) a plus LOCATION Kansas City area is preferred, but virtual will be considered for strong candidates. The position is full time and will include a base salary and full benefits, including health, dental, vision, life, disability, vacation, and 401(k) with company match. We are also open to 1099 contract arrangements. Powered by JazzHR BBvFF6sLjn
summary: Business Data Analyst role focused on deploying and maintaining new services for government agencies. Requires experience with MuleSoft, GraphQL, and REST/SOAP APIs. The role involves building integrations, troubleshooting issues, and collaborating with various stakeholders to ensure smooth onboarding and operations for clients.

title: Data Analyst
description: For further inquiries regarding the following opportunity, please contact our Talent Specialists Rashi | 630-847-1027 Title: Data Analyst Location: Abbott Park, IL Duration: 9 Months Description Projection analyst for forecasting and other business needs CMDB Administration support 100% Seek an individual to learn and support the CMDB data updates while grasping how the CMDB is used on a day-by-day basis at Client. The CMDB is highly complex with different uses depending on the organization and or the devices. Work as liaison to the CMDB customers and Data Stewards ensuring data updates provided are accurate, complete and follow best practices used in the Configuration Management's Center of Excellence Requires good communication skills and ability to communicate back-n-forth with the customer until the data is proper. Realize new/update data requests routinely have bad data, the CMDB Admin must work directly with the customer to assure they understand exactly what we need to know and why it matters. Single point of contact for all CMDB users globally Answer questions regarding data or the ITSM/CMDB system. Contact tier 2/3 support when unable to answer question Collaborate with customers to support and assist IT initiatives involving CMDB data Collaborate with Application Portfolio team ensure Application Health and IT lifecycle is managed. Be able to identify gaps and remediation steps. CMDB Data updates Can be 1 up to 500+ devices per request Entry is via Incident or Service Requests Review audit reports and CMDB Health Dashboards. Based on findings reach out to device owners or respective CoE Data Stewards for data remediation. Perform updating and removing Application to Infrastructure relationships Review, collaborate data corrections and execute mass updates to the CMDB Will be the only authorized user allowed to the mass import data to the CMDB Maintain an in-depth knowledge of the different Configuration (CI) Classes and Attributes per class Learn to know the attribute default values to ensure imports and updates maintain CI data accuracy. Provide urgent updates to the CMDB data to ensure IT tools are working as expected. Gain an understanding of external CMDB data sources. The desired resource won't necessarily support the integration, but needs an understanding of the external data sources Be able to provide "plain language" explanations to business customers when data is sourced from one of these other systems. Education: High school degree Experience: 3 to 5 years working with system and data Skills:Understanding data base, good communication, willing to collaborate with business independently. The role involves maintaining, updating, and ensuring the accuracy of CMDB data, acting as a liaison between CMDB users and Data Stewards, and collaborating with various teams to support IT initiatives and manage the application portfolio.

title: Business Data Analyst
description: Job Title Business Data Analyst Job Description Summary Responsible for developing tools, automating reports and quality data analytics, leading to improved delivery of services for the Account Client Procurement team Job Description Responsibilities (specific to the role): The successful candidate will collaborate with procurement leadership and account technology team to define innovative BI dashboard solutions and data analytics to support business objectives. Specific responsibilities will include: Analyze and reconcile client portfolio data consistency and identify data-gaps. Monitor, analyze and report market characteristics, conditions, trends, and forecasts. Portfolio and Benchmarking analysis – understanding and presenting through dynamic dashboards a client’s portfolio performance. Partner closely with procurement leadership to assist with special projects. Develop and document workflows and processes within infrastructure/software as required to support client and team business needs. Support the business leaders with status reports, directing escalations, etc. Act as an internal resource for other C&W teams on best practices, how-to’s, and solutioning for supported technologies. Escalate risks, issues, and roadblocks to the Facilities team. Collect and analyze data to organize spend, supplier geographic service territory, labor rates benchmarking, and other supplier performance data. Design and create reports, dashboards, and scorecards to communicate performance metrics to relevant stakeholders. Establish or improve governance routines for reporting to internal stakeholders. Provide insights to guide decision-making and strategic planning. Effective communication with cross-functional teams is essential. Collaborate with procurement, vendor management, operations teams and finance. Align supplier performance goals with organizational objectives. Qualifications: Good technical or business foundation to include an undergraduate degree in Business, Information Systems, or related field experience 5+ years of business analyst experience Critical thinker/problem solver with logical thought process. Strong communication skills, including presentation development and delivery. Strong cross-team collaboration skills. Strong attention to detail. Stakeholder communication and expectation management. Self-starter with a proactive, innovative mindset Skills & Personal Qualities: A strong service and delivery mentality are required. Candidate must actively seek to understand internal customers’ needs and perceptions and show a “can do” attitude. The successful candidate must have strong business acumen and intellectual curiosity. An ability to translate client needs into procurement strategy is critical. Excellent collaboration skills are important. The successful candidate must be able to offer new ideas and help build support for making significant changes. Fostering an environment for open exchange, asking good questions, and listening to gain input and insight is expected. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are integral for success. Candidate must be a clear and concise communicator and must effectively communicate at Managerial levels and cross-functionally. The successful candidate must be a self-starter and able to work in ambiguous situations. Given minimal requirements or direction, the candidate must be able to define a path forward and work with the team to make progress, without waiting for specific directions.
