Certifications such as CompTIA Security+, CISSP, CISM, CEH, and GSEC are valuable.

title: Jump Capital, Data & Portfolio Operations Analyst
description: Jump is a multi-stage technology investor focused primarily on leading Series A rounds; we are currently investing out of our 7th fund, which we raised ($350mm) in the summer of 2021. We are a team of thesis-led investors with a deep conviction that you must have a depth of understanding within microsegments of sectors to be effective, good partners to founders. Our portfolio is global and diversified across a broad set of thematic areas - Fintech, RegTech, Vertical SaaS, EdTech, Cybersecurity, and eCommerce to name a few. As the Data & Portfolio Operations Analyst, you’ll oversee, streamline, and systematize all aspects of Jump Capital’s portfolio and fund management needs, including portfolio data collection, fund reporting, and related analytics. The analyst will also assist the investment team in deal-sourcing, primarily by integrating various tools to enhance our data-driven sourcing efforts. Though you will collaborate with the investment team, this is not an investing role. This role is based out of our Chicago office with an expectation to work in the office a portion of each week. Key Responsibilities Implement a systematic process to organize, clean, import, and restructure data, enabling data-driven insights across each of the firm’s core activities: deal sourcing and diligence process, portfolio company monitoring, founder support, & administering the fund. Deal Sourcing & Diligence: Enhance investors’ sourcing by optimizing the data-gathering process to provide better visibility of deal opportunities from founders, VC peers, executives, and advisors. Integrate and systematize external data providers and systems into Jump’s sourcing and investment process to enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Assist in developing data-driven dashboards to help the team assess progress toward sourcing goals. Portfolio Monitoring: Monitor portfolio company performance via the development and tracking of portfolio benchmarks, other investment-level metrics, and input from investment team. Administer Jump’s portfolio company data and systems, including Affinity, Notion, and Aumni, ensuring the maintenance and regular updates of internal records. Founder support: Support the team in managing a network of advisor and network connections by establishing a centralized database and enriching data with relevant context. Implement a tracking system to monitor the timing and nature of engagements within the network, ensuring effective management of interactions. Fund Administration: Compile comprehensive portfolio views and collect essential data to aid in valuation and the annual reporting process. Prepare ad-hoc financial models and analyses on fund performance and portfolio performance. Continuously seek to improve internal systems and processes by building tools and implementing automation wherever possible. Ultimately, aim to integrate and synchronize the core activities outlined above. Other duties as assigned or needed. The Ideal Candidate Profile Includes A passion for helping startups scale, experience working in quickly evolving environments, and exceptional attention to detail. Proficiency in analytical and data analysis methodologies. Hands-on experience in managing APIs and data workflows between applications Proactive approach to project management, keeping communication flowing and fostering collaboration to get things done. Eagerness to explore the potential of GenAI and the adoption of new tools to improve productivity and insights for the Jump Capital team. Desire to build, test, and operationalize tools/products and the curiosity to ensure they work effectively within the Jump environment. Qualifications B.S. in a STEM-related field, such as Engineering, Computer Science, or Data Science. Alternatively, a B.S. in business, economics, finance, accounting, or a related area with a demonstrated ability to understand technical systems and companies 2+ years’ experience in banking, consulting, finance, accounting, or investor relations Strong grasp of financial principles Exceptional analytical and project management skills Excited to dive into messy, complex datasets, with experience in data visualization and analysis a plus Proven ability to define, implement and maintain collaborative processes with colleagues and partners Exceptional attention to detail, alongside strong organizational and time management skills Diligent, organized, scrappy, and creative Armed with intellectual curiosity, investigative rigor, and a “no task too small” mindset Reliable and predictable availability If you’re someone who thrives in an environment where collaboration and curiosity are encouraged, and everyone is willing to roll up their sleeves to get work done - then you’re exactly who we’re looking for. We’re a small, close-knit team driven by our commitment to supporting our founders and startups as they scale. We don’t take ourselves too seriously but take the work we do very seriously. If you’re eager to grow your skillset, dive into messy datasets, and play a crucial role in our and our portfolio companies’ success stories – we want to hear from you. Benefits Discretionary bonus eligibility Medical, dental, and vision insurance HSA, FSA, and Dependent Care options Employer Paid Group Term Life and AD&D Insurance Voluntary Life & AD&D insurance Paid vacation plus paid holidays Retirement plan with employer match Paid parental leave Wellness Programs Annual Base Salary Range $90,000—$130,000 USD
summary: Jump Capital, a multi-stage technology investor, is seeking a Data & Portfolio Operations Analyst to oversee portfolio management tasks, including data collection, reporting, and analytics. The analyst will also assist the investment team in deal sourcing by leveraging data-driven approaches. This role involves managing portfolio data in systems like Affinity, Notion, and Aumni, developing data-driven dashboards, and supporting founder outreach efforts. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, experience with data workflows and APIs, and a proactive approach to project management. This is a hands-on role requiring proficiency in financial principles and a passion for working with messy datasets.

title: Data Support Analyst - Investment Management
description: Solutions for Today’s Challenges. Vision for Tomorrow’s Opportunities. Join William Blair, the Premier Global Boutique. William Blair has delivered trusted advice for nearly nine decades, and we continue to deepen our expertise and relationships across regions, asset classes, and markets throughout North America, Europe, Asia, and Australia. We are committed to our people and culture, values, clients, and local communities. What sets us apart is that we are an independent partnership, with employees who have unique experiences, perspectives, and backgrounds. We provide advisory services, strategies, and solutions to meet clients’ evolving needs amid dynamic market conditions and varying industries. We strive to attract the most qualified, passionate candidates who specialize in investment banking, investment management, private wealth management, and a variety of other business functions. We work tirelessly to create an inclusive culture and take pride in fostering employees’ professional and personal growth. We empower our people to bring their best thinking each day so we can deliver the tailored, thoughtful work and problem-solving abilities that our clients expect. Equally, we are proud of our long-term partnerships with the communities in which we live and work, a legacy we inherited from our founder. We invite you to learn about how we are seeking excellence in everything we do and empowering our clients’ success with passion, creativity, and rigor. For more information, visit williamblair.com. Deliver high quality, effective technical support for the Investment Management department’s data management software system(s), ensuring exceptional client service to end users. title: Database Analyst (DBA)
description: Job Description As a Database Analyst (DBA), you will play a crucial role in supporting the Unified Data Infrastructure project and ensuring the availability, accessibility, and accuracy of our data environment. Your primary responsibility will be to design, implement, and maintain database solutions that support the organization's reporting and analytics needs. Key responsibilities include: Database Management: Manage and optimize databases to ensure efficient data storage, retrieval, and security. Data Infrastructure Support: Support the design and implementation of the Unified Data Infrastructure project to address current infrastructure limitations and improve reporting capabilities. Performance Tuning: Monitor database performance, conduct performance tuning, and implement optimizations to enhance system efficiency. Data Integration: Collaborate with Data Engineers and other team members to integrate raw data sources into the data environment, potentially utilizing platforms like Databricks. Backup and Recovery: Implement and maintain backup and recovery procedures to ensure data integrity and availability. Security and Compliance: Implement and enforce data security protocols and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA). Documentation: Maintain documentation of database schemas, configurations, and procedures to facilitate knowledge sharing and ensure operational continuity. Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including non-BI and senior team members, to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet business needs. Qualifications Experience: 4-6 years of experience as a Database Analyst (DBA) or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of database management principles, data warehousing, and ETL processes. Technical Skills: Proficiency in database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL), SQL querying, performance tuning, and database security best practices. Problem-Solving Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities to troubleshoot database issues and optimize database performance. Team Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Project Management: Ability to manage database-related projects, prioritize tasks, and deliver solutions on time and within budget. **We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, ethnic origin, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.**
summary: Database Analyst (DBA) responsible for supporting the Unified Data Infrastructure project, managing and optimizing databases, performance tuning, data integration, backup and recovery, security and compliance, documentation, and collaboration with cross-functional teams.

title: Crime Data Analyst
description: SalarySalary $65,852.80 Annually Location Bloomington, IL Job Type Full-Time Job Number 00667 Department Police Division Support Services Opening Date 06/21/2024 Closing Date 7/19/2024 11:59 PM Central FLSA Non-Exempt Hours/Shift Mon-Fri 11am-7pm Description The Crime Data Analyst identifies crime patterns and trends by evaluating and analyzing police incident reports and data submitted by law enforcement officers to prepare reports for use in all divisions of the department. The position is responsible for dissemination of crime data to internal and external law enforcement personnel. Work involves extensive reading, report writing, data analyses and development of maps indicating incidents of crime. Various types of reports and charts are analyzed while conducting criminal justice research. This position is responsible for the design and maintenance of various state mandated incident data systems and reporting formats to meet periodic reporting requirements. The Crime Data Analyst performs both routine and advanced analytical evaluation of the effectiveness of programs and enforcement strategies. Work involves research, analysis, and findings on crime trends both local and national in scope. The analyst also collects data needed to conduct complex research projects and performs sophisticated analysis of specific crimes to aid in instituting strategic and tactical suppression and prevention activities. The Crime Data Analyst is responsible for strategic and tactical planning assistance for internal and external law enforcement purposes. Examples of Duties This list may not include all tasks and/or knowledge which may be expected of the employee, nor does it cover all specific duties which may be required. Other duties may be assigned. Responsible for developing, maintaining, and analyzing a data collection system to monitor traffic stops and pedestrian contacts in compliance with State legislation. Perform criminal justice related research by reviewing current literature on specific topics, conducting limited field research, and analyzing data. Read and analyze all police incident reports, calls for service and other related enforcement data through use of specialized analytical software. Report findings of criminal justice research to police administrators and to other law enforcement agencies as directed. Maintaining a system to download crime data from the departmental records management system (RMS). Process this data into custom made applications to meet the department’s needs. Provide in-progress assistance in high priority call types and monitor Public Safety Cameras (PSCs), Automatic License Plate Readers (ALPRs), and other electronic sensors during their workday. Communicate with officers/dispatchers on movement of suspect(s). Produce and preserve digital evidence in accordance with State law and departmental policy to include resulting court testimony. Prepare known offender bulletins, crime series bulletins and crime pattern bulletins for distribution to internal and external law enforcement partners. Develop data sampling techniques and select samples. Determine accuracy of existing reporting systems. Maintain and update crime data sets and make corrections to improve system. Conduct daily camera and sensor performance and respond to malfunctions as necessary. Responsible for reporting monthly NIBRS and other data to the Illinois State Police, FBI, and or other agencies. Prepare crime data reports and studies using complex analysis techniques combined with specialized software. Work jointly with the Criminal Intelligence Analyst on case assignments and specials projects. Participate in the training of new analysts/officers/dispatchers regarding specialized functions of the unit. Typical Qualifications General Skills Levels: Knowledge of and proficiency in advanced statistical analytic techniques. Knowledge of and proficiency in research methodology. Knowledge of the field of crime data analysis. Knowledge and proficiency in the use databases, spreadsheets, word-processing, internet-based research and the ability to learn a variety of current law enforcement technology platforms. Knowledge of methods and techniques used for compliance, storage, retrieval, and disposition of related record keeping systems. Ability to use database, spreadsheet, word-processing, and graphics packages on the computer for storing and retrieving data, gathering information, use of the Internet, generating reports, and all other related computing functions. Ability to effectively analyze, summarize and communicate technical data orally and in writing. Ability to manage functions, resolve conflict and work harmoniously with Department Heads, public officials, employees, outside professionals, and the general public. Ability to handle highly confidential material on a routine basis in an atmosphere of loyalty and trust. Ability to understand and follow oral and written instruction of a complex nature. Education/Experience: Required: Bachelor’s degree supplemented by course work in criminal justice, social sciences, computer science or a related field; or two or more years’ experience in criminal intelligence gathering and computer operation. Any combination of training and experience to provide the above knowledge, skills and abilities. Certificates/Licenses: Required: Valid Illinois Driver’s License. Physical Requirements / Working Conditions: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position. Work is primarily performed in an office environment. There are no extraordinary physical demands of this position.
summary: The Crime Data Analyst analyzes police incident reports and data to identify crime patterns and trends, preparing reports for various divisions of the department. Responsibilities include dissemination of crime data to internal and external law enforcement, conducting research, analyzing crime trends, and assisting with strategic and tactical planning. The analyst uses specialized software for data analysis, prepares reports and studies, and works jointly with the Criminal Intelligence Analyst on case assignments and special projects. The position requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in research methodology, and knowledge of crime data analysis techniques. The candidate should also be proficient in database, spreadsheet, and word-processing software, as well as various law enforcement technology platforms.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: SUMMARY The Data Governance Analyst performs analytical tasks necessary to develop recommendations to refine methodologies, procedures, processes and controls necessary to minimize the liability, risk and cost of retaining hardcopy and electronic data. Assists with the development of practice area and administrative department work practices to promote greater utilization and efficient management of electronic records. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide assistance to professional staff with the reviewing, organizing and processing of email, documents, files and other information, including incoming file and data transfers, file releases, document access requests, and document/records disposition. Draft process controls, test plans and assessment criteria to measure compliance with established processes. Provide support to professional staff with a variety of data, file, document and email projects. Major components of these functions include document review and data migration into the correct repositories as directed by department manager. Document, analyze, and assess current records, email and file management processes. Identify issues and potential risks. Analyze potential benefits and risks of alternatives; measure the impact of planned changes; and provide justification for the recommended solution. Conduct analysis in response to requests to evaluate document security. Take necessary action to update document security as appropriate. Prepare recommendations for the design or reengineering of processes and procedures to facilitate compliance with records and information management program requirements. Move, tag, and set the appropriate security settings on electronic documents. Conduct initial investigation into alerts triggered by potentially inappropriate document exports. Assist with the review of output from periodic scans of documents in the document management system. Support the process for document entitlement reviews in accordance with client requirements. Assist with file release, destruction, and electronic workspace organization projects in accordance with department policies and procedures. Contribute to presentations or written reports describing recommendations to process or system owners. Assist with development of change management programs and implementation plans needed to comply with records and information management program requirements. Stay abreast of leading practices for the creation, use, maintenance and disposition of records. Prepare status reports and compile statistics on projects. Create or update spreadsheets, pivot-tables and other relevant report metrics. Occasional travel may be needed between offices. REQUIREMENTS 2+ years of experience in a Data Governance, Information Governance or other relevant IT Governance/Risk/Compliance (GRC) type of role Associate degree, but preferably a Bachelor's Degree is preferred NICE TO HAVES Experience working with Document Management Systems Experience working for a professional services firm
summary: The Data Governance Analyst assists with analyzing data and developing recommendations to improve data management processes, minimize risk, and optimize efficiency in handling hardcopy and electronic data. This role supports the implementation of electronic records management practices and ensures compliance with established regulations.

title: Junior Data Engineer
description: About CHEST The American College of Chest Physicians (CHEST) is the leading professional association for more than 20,000 pulmonary, critical care, and sleep medicine professionals seeking the best in clinical education and a connection to the worldwide chest medicine community. We advance the best health outcomes for patients through education, advocacy, research, and philanthropy. Our mission is to champion the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of chest diseases through education, communication, and research. Our vision is to be the global leader in advancing the best patient outcomes through innovative chest medicine education, clinical research, and team-based care. Junior Data Engineer Location: United States, Glenview, Flexible Hybrid Schedule Team: Strategy Reports to: Director, Data Operations and Strategy Exempt/Full-time/Grade: 6 Primary Purpose The Junior Data Engineer (JDE) is primarily responsible for supporting the design, testing, and maintenance of data pipelines, database architecture, and production data sources. As a part of the CHEST Data Team, the JDE will work closely with the Senior Data Engineer as well as act as a data SME in collaboration with the Data Analytics team to provide expertise in data blending and reporting data source creation. The JDE ensures the stability, reliability, and performance of our databases and SQL stored procedures. This position requires a passion for crushing lung disease and embody CHEST values: honor the team, lead with integrity, leverage passion, cultivate innovation, and have serious fun. Essential Functions/Responsibilities Demonstrate a passion for crushing lung disease and embody CHEST values: honor the team, lead with integrity, leverage passion, cultivate innovation, and have serious fun. Engineer large, complex data sets that meet business requirements while maintaining an optimal data pipeline. Design and develop Snowflake and MS SQL Server database objects and procedural code supporting various custom and 3rd party applications, including writing stored procedures, functions, and triggers. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using ETL Tools and SQL scripting. Optimize and tune MS SQL databases and queries and perform database normalization. Collaborate with application developers and data analysts to provide data services and support for existing and new applications. Support and troubleshoot application issues and document solutions. Monitor logs, keep our data secured, and backup processes on production systems. Identify, design, and implement process improvements. Perform deployment activities to test and production environments. Ensure quality and stability of the databases, while implementing efficiencies to reduce application and database support costs. Maintain data processes including (but not limited to) Snowflake Transformation processes, SSIS Packages and Python scripts. Required Qualifications And Competencies 2 + years working with Snowflake, MS SQL Server 2 + years of SQL and database maintenance knowledge required including Stored Procedures and SSIS packages. 2 + years of experience in database design including referential integrity, with strong understanding of key data elements, table indexing, and database tuning required. Experience working with CRM systems and data integrations Demonstrated experience working with scripting languages (Python, Javascript, R, etc...) Degree in Computer Science, Analytics, or a related field required Additional Information The annual base salary range for this position is USD $80,000 - $85,000. This pay range represents base pay only and excludes any additional items such as incentives, bonuses, or other items. CHEST considers factors such as, but not limited to, the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, and market and organizational considerations when extending an offer. CHEST is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, parental status, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable laws. At CHEST, our employees come from different backgrounds with various lived experiences and dynamic strengths. We strive to continuously improve our way of working to reflect our commitment to inclusion and equity and build a workforce that reflects the communities that we serve. And that means we need you! Your experiences may only perfectly align with some qualifications listed in the job description. But if you are excited by this position, we highly encourage you to consider still applying. You may be just the right candidate to help us with our mission to improve patient care! This description was designed as a convenience to acquaint employees and managers with the essential elements of the position. It is solely to summarize basic duties, and it is not intended to be a contract or guarantee of employment or any specific terms or conditions of employment. Participation is voluntary
summary: The Junior Data Engineer (JDE) at CHEST will support the design, testing, and maintenance of data pipelines, database architecture, and production data sources. The JDE will work closely with the Senior Data Engineer and collaborate with the Data Analytics team to provide expertise in data blending and reporting data source creation. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL, database design, and ETL tools, along with experience working with scripting languages and CRM systems.

title: Data Engineer (Airflow)
description: Apache Airflow/Python Engineer (*W2 Only, In-Person Role in Chicago, IL*) We are seeking a skilled Apache Airflow/Python Engineer to join our team at Daltics. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in building and maintaining data pipelines and ETLs in cloud environments (AWS/Azure), utilizing Apache Airflow as the orchestration tool. This role involves working with risk data at a large financial institution, ensuring the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of our data workflows. The candidate should be proficient in Python for developing Airflow tasks/workflows and possess strong debugging skills. Collaboration within a team environment is essential. Responsibilities Design, Develop, and Maintain Data Pipelines: Create and manage ETL processes to handle large volumes of risk data, ensuring data integrity and quality. Airflow Orchestration: Utilize Apache Airflow to orchestrate and automate data workflows, ensuring seamless data integration and processing. Python Development: Write and maintain Python scripts to support Airflow tasks and workflows, ensuring they are efficient and scalable. Cloud Integration: Implement and manage data pipelines in cloud environments such as AWS and Azure, leveraging cloud services and tools for optimal performance. Debugging and Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve issues within Airflow and Python scripts, ensuring minimal downtime and robust data processing. Collaborate with Team Members: Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs. Documentation: Maintain clear and comprehensive documentation for data pipelines, workflows, and processes to facilitate knowledge sharing and onboarding of new team members. Qualifications: ﻿ Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Experience Minimum 3-5 years of experience in building and maintaining data pipelines and ETLs. Minimum 2-3 years of proven experience with Apache Airflow as an orchestration tool. Minimum 3-5 years of strong Python programming skills, specifically in developing Airflow tasks and workflows. Minimum 2-3 years of experience with AWS and/or Azure, including relevant data services (e.g., S3, Redshift, Glue for AWS; Blob Storage, Data Factory for Azure). Technical Skills Minimum 2-3 years of proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases. Minimum 2 years of familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git). Understanding of data warehousing concepts and practices. Soft Skills Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills. Strong communication and teamwork abilities. Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively. Preferred Qualifications Experience in the financial industry, particularly with risk data. Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
summary: We are seeking an experienced Apache Airflow/Python Engineer to build and maintain data pipelines and ETLs for risk data at a financial institution. The role requires proficiency in Apache Airflow, Python, AWS/Azure, and SQL. Strong debugging skills, teamwork, and communication are essential.

title: Intelligence Analyst
description: We are Secure Community Network (SCN), a nonprofit 501(c)(3) serving as the official safety and security organization of the Jewish community in North America. Here at SCN, we deeply value the team of people that work diligently to commit their lives to action for a better tomorrow and we are excited to add an Intelligence Analyst to our organization. If you consider yourself to be an ambitious and self-motivated Intelligence professional with a desire to identify and mitigate threats this role may be for you! Intelligence Analysts perform a variety of tasks, including research, writing, evaluating, analyzing, and disseminating intelligence information on various issues. The Intelligence Analyst will support efforts to prevent, protect against, mitigate the effects of, respond to, and recover from all hazards, whether man-made or natural. What You Will Do Capture, assess, interpret, corroborate, and distribute intelligence using databases, software platforms, and online portals Summarize information from various sources into concise, analytical assessments and disseminate them to fill priority collection requirements and intelligence gaps Monitor and report raw intelligence in a timely manner through various media forms and documentation tools Provide general information sharing to identify key patterns Identify intelligence collection gaps and recommend mitigation strategies Extract essential information from intelligence products and investigations Apply advanced analytic methods to identify and analyze raw information, synthesizing it into intelligence products for dissemination Convey a clear understanding of present and future threats Apply inductive reasoning skills to proactively mitigate potential threats Establish and maintain professional working relationships inside and outside the organization Analyze homeland security, law enforcement, and non-law enforcement data and trends Produce original intelligence products such as verbal briefings, intelligence bulletins, and situation reports Qualifications Bachelor's Degree with one to two years' experience in a similar environment Experience in conducting OSINT research/investigations Knowledge of the intelligence cycle, including analytic methodologies and techniques Experience drafting intelligence briefs, threat assessments, and other intelligence products Experience receiving and processing SARs Ability to quickly and effectively synthesize and summarize information from multiple sources into concise, analytic assessments Ability to manage multiple and competing priorities in an operational environment and to work well under strict deadlines and pressure Ability to understand and summarize large amounts of information, as well as the ability to communicate these to internal and external stakeholders Ability to identify and develop sources of information, including, but not limited to, the Internet, databases, and public records Proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite, records management software, mass alert systems, mapping software (ArcGIS, Google Earth, etc.), Accurint, HSIN, automated monitoring systems, and software - including internet and social media - to provide all-source research, analysis, monitoring, and accurate report production Proficient knowledge of alternative social media platforms Ability to accurately input detailed information into databases, adhering to established data integrity policies and procedures Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking to diverse information sets Demonstrated ability to maintain accurate and complete files Effective oral and written communications skills Meticulous attention to detail Ability to demonstrate sound judgment under pressure Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a diverse group of professionals Understanding public safety, national security, and current geo-political considerations are required Previous experience as an analyst working in a GIOC or RTCC environment and a demonstrated interest in security, counterterrorism, international relations, and political science is preferred as is experience in analytical and research roles in an office environment Proficiency in multiple languages is preferred About Scn The Secure Community Network (SCN), a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, is the official homeland safety and security organization of the Jewish community in North America. Founded in 2004 under the auspices of The Jewish Federations of North America and the Conference of Presidents of Major American Jewish Organizations, SCN serves as the central organization dedicated exclusively to the safety and security of the American Jewish community, working across 146 federations, 50 partner organizations, over 300 independent communities, and other partners in the public, private, nonprofit, and academic sectors. SCN is dedicated to ensuring that Jewish organizations, communities, life, and culture can not only exist safely and securely but flourish. Learn more at securecommunitynetwork.org. Secure Community Network is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of religion, race, color, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. SCN has long been a committed leader in adopting, modeling, and encouraging adherence to Jewish values, including advocating for approaches that address issues related to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility (DEIA). Please review our DEIA statement here .
summary: Secure Community Network (SCN), a nonprofit organization, seeks an Intelligence Analyst to support their efforts in preventing, protecting against, mitigating, responding to, and recovering from all hazards. The Analyst will conduct research, write reports, analyze intelligence information, and disseminate findings to stakeholders. Key responsibilities include intelligence collection, assessment, analysis, and dissemination, as well as identification of intelligence gaps and mitigation strategies. title: Analytics Engineer
description: We are looking to hire an Analytics Engineer to help build out and run the data and analytics function at LaSalle Network. After years of operating with a lean, scrappy mentality, LaSalle partnered with an outside consulting team to help us identify the right tools and people to invest in, in order to build the foundation for a scalable, sustainable and trusted data and analytics practice. Tech stack for this position includes Snowflake, SQL and Tableau. The Analytics Engineer role will play a key role in "carrying the torch" and continuing to build out and maintain our analytics hub while engaging with internal stakeholders. As the "go to" subject matter expert, you will set the tone and direction for how this group engages with users and the executive leadership team to help us make better, more informed decisions at every level of the company. This position will have 1 direct report. Successful candidates will feel comfortable navigating between being heads down in the data and talking regularly with all levels of the business to ensure our analytics solutions are helping drive business decisions. This individual should also be interested in working a hybrid schedule, four days in office. Analytics Engineer Responsibilities: Collaborate with outside consulting team to create a compelling BI vision by engaging with senior leaders across the organization, understanding their reporting needs and developing a business intelligence roadmap Create dashboards and reports in Tableau that display insights from LaSalle's data Be able to translate analytics to narrative stories for business decision-making and innovation Create plans for how best to continuously measure progress against business goals Monitor, troubleshoot and resolve any data-related issues that arise, tracing the incorrect metrics in the dashboards and reports back to the enterprise data warehouse (EDW) in Snowflake Define processes for continuously monitoring data quality and build mechanisms to proactively resolve issues before they arise Maintain and add to existing dashboards Monitor and improve database and dashboard performance Answer business user questions about dashboard metrics and functionality Create ad-hoc reports/dashboards as requests come in Extend the data model as needed to support new dashboards and associated metrics Enforce data governance by pointing business users to existing dashboards that can answer their questions (instead of creating new ones each time) Maintain documentation for the EDW, dashboards and enterprise-wide KPIs Work successfully and effectively with executive leadership team, management team and end users Opportunity to own the entire ETL process from the source systems in the future if desired, not required Requirements: 3+ years of demonstrated quantitative and qualitative data and BI experience, with a strong understanding of data visualization and analytics tools Technical experience with Tableau, SQL, Excel and Snowflake, or similar cloud-database Detail-oriented with a focus on data quality and integrity Comfortable talking to internal stakeholders to understand their business needs and communicating technical concepts to non-technical end users Ability to document detailed BI concepts in the context of user needs, business impacts and technical requirements for data and analytics Strong analytical skills in order to apply business acumen when handing reporting requests Curious problem solver who is eager to "roll up their sleeves" to deliver results Desire to work a hybrid schedule, 3 days in-office, in a hardworking, fun and team-oriented culture Bachelor's degree, certification or related experience in Information Systems, Data Science, Analytics, Business Intelligence or related field If you are interested in this role and meet the qualifications, please apply today! title: Data Analytic Specialist
description: Department BSD MED - Center for Health and the Social Sciences - Methods Core About The Department The Center for Health and the Social Sciences (CHeSS) provides the infrastructure to advance interdisciplinary research and training in health and social sciences at the University of Chicago. Housed under the Dean of the Biological Sciences Division's office, the Center supports and promotes innovation and collaboration as well as excellence in research, scholarship and training. CHeSS serves as an incubator of ideas and supporter of research in health and the social sciences, sponsors seminars and workshops on campus, invites nationally-known scholars and policymakers to speak on a variety of topics, supports the writing and submission of grant applications and fundraising proposals, coordinates new research initiatives and projects, manages several training programs and provides expert research methods consultation during formative and operational phases of investigations. Within the Center, the Program in Oral Health conducts research and training related to oral health and associated systemic health conditions. The Program in Oral Health has designed a 5-year randomized controlled study to study the effects of no-fee basic dental care on overall quality of life and systemic health of older adults. The Program works with other University of Chicago and external investigators on oral health projects. The Program works closely with CHeSS’ Methods Core team, which provides analytical training and support to oral health projects. CHeSS’ Methods Core also works on various other health and social science related projects across the University and outside. Job Summary The Center for Health and the Social Sciences (CHeSS) is seeking an experienced Data Analytic Specialist to join the Center Methods Core team and lead research initiatives within the Program in Oral Health. The Data Analytic Specialist will manage research projects related to healthcare economics, healthcare delivery science, health services research, biomedicine and clinical research. The Data Analytic Specialist will work closely with faculty and CHeSS Program Directors to design and conduct quantitative aspects of research activities within the Program in Oral Health. The Data Analytic Specialist will provide in-depth knowledge and expertise in the application of research and quantitative methods to initiate and develop research initiatives within the Program. Candidates must be able to work with multiple leaders and investigators across all aspects of project development and execution in order to produce meaningful analyses and results. We seek candidates who are adept in providing support and guidance to team members of varying technical proficiency and that work independently, acting as a resource to support users in the practical application of data to advance health and clinical research. Responsibilities Conduct analysis and evaluation of internally and externally funded health research projects including observational studies and randomized control trials. Other sources of data include Medicare and Medicaid claims, the IBM MarketScan® Research Databases, PCORnet, CAPriCORN, National Death Index (NDI), NIH National COVID Cohort Collaborative (NC3) and Epic Systems, among others. Design and develop statistical models and analyses using relevant software such as SAS, Stata, R, Python and SQL. Advise research collaborators on statistics or biostatistics and the appropriate selection and application of analytic methods and algorithms. This includes advising collaborators in the selection of appropriate research methods and sample size calculation. Prepare statistics and measures for teams and produce reports and presentations as needed for funders and diverse audiences. Create meaningful data visualizations including charts, infographics, and other visual data elements to effectively highlight findings. Work with faculty members in the production of research manuscripts and publications. Develop and write methods sections of project reports, grant applications and papers. Develop expertise in independent grant applications as CO-Investigator. Communicate findings and share knowledge of advanced study design, methodologies, best practices and programming with other investigators and data users as appropriate. Work closely with fellows and students undergoing analytical training within the Program in Oral Health. Lead and manage individual projects, including data governance (Data Use Agreements) and IRB policy compliance of research projects. Prepare and present key measures designed to assess results and progress of these projects. Develop proposals as well as post-award reports and metrics. Oversee junior research staff, research assistants and students in the performance of student projects, data management and data analyses. Analyzes data and prepares data tables, charts, and graphs for reports. Writes grant proposals for faculty throughout the unit. Helps develop and implements new innovative procedures in the areas of data collection, quality control, presentation of results, and statistical analysis. Performs other related work as needed. Education: Minimum Qualifications Minimum requirements include a college or university degree in related field. Work Experience: Minimum requirements include knowledge and skills developed through 2-5 years of work experience in a related job discipline. Certifications: Preferred Qualifications Education: Advanced degree or higher in statistics, biostatics, computer science, mathematics, economics, sociology, epidemiology, operations research, or related field. Experience: Prior experience with data modeling, data analysis and demonstrated ability to contribute to research papers or grant proposals required. Prior experience in oral health research. Prior experience working with large longitudinal data sets such as healthcare surveys, hospital administrative, billing and electronic health record data, Medicare or private claims data. Strong working knowledge with relational database tools and programming languages (R, Python, PySpark, SQL, Stata, SAS) and health-related analyses required. Note that not all software/tools are required but experience with more than one is strongly. Supervisory and project management experience. Preferred Competencies Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work independently and as part of a team and motivation to explore and apply new technologies and methods to solve complex research problems. Ability to work simultaneously with multiple investigators, prioritize competing objectives, and identify opportunities to more efficiently accomplish analytical tasks. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Application Documents Resume/CV (required) Cover Letter (required) When applying, the document(s) MUST be uploaded via the My Experience page, in the section titled Application Documents of the application. title: Data Engineer
description: Double Good's mission is to create joy. We create joy with our delectable and award-winning popcorn. We create joy with our easy-to-use fundraising platform that raises a meaningful amount of money for youth sports and activities, empowering kids to pursue their dreams. We create joy through our Kids Foundation which hosts Double Good Days events across the country to bring all-ability fun to children with special needs and their families. As featured on the Today Show, Double Good is not just about the product; we have a strong social mission. In recent years, Double Good has seen 40% year over year growth, and we're excited about our future! We're excited about the possibility of you joining our mission. Are you ready to be at the forefront of data-driven transformation? We are on a quest for a dynamic Data Engineer who excels in Snowflake and dbt to bring insight and innovation to our company. In this pivotal role, you will craft the foundational data structures that empower our business decisions. Innovate and extend our data infrastructure, integrating cutting-edge data management technologies and software engineering practices. Collaborate alongside data scientists and analysts to enrich our data ecosystem. Implement robust data testing frameworks to ensure utmost data quality. Strategically optimize data structures and streamline pipelines to boost performance and cost-efficiency. Experience & Skills we value: The ideal candidate will possess a strong work ethic and the capacity to independently define and manage projects after being provided with high-level objectives. Your skill set should reveal: A solid track record with at least 5 years in data engineering. Proven experience in taking initiative to identify needs, move projects forward and deliver results. Expertise in Snowflake, with a solid understanding of data modeling and performance optimization. Expertise in dbt, with deep experience in pipeline optimization, writing macros, and managing deployments. Proficiency in constructing and managing large-scale data architectures using AWS, Terraform, Github Actions, and Airflow. Excellent problem-solving capabilities with a flair for enhancing data systems. Exceptional communication skills that promote effective teamwork. Why Join Us: Join a rockstar team and use leading technologies to make a huge impact on critical company initiatives. Enjoy a stellar company culture, competitive salary and great benefits. We're on a mission to create more joy in people's lives, and that includes our internal employees. We create a place people love to be a part of, where people can discover and practice their unique skill sets, a place where they can contribute and do their best work. We do this by offering our employees: Benefits and Perks: Medical, Dental, Vision insurance Flexible Spending Account / Health Savings Account 401k with 4% Company Match Generous PTO 11 Holidays in the year Paid Parental Leave Comprehensive Employee Assistance Program (EAP) available to all employees 24/7 Company sponsored disability and life insurance Monthly Popcorn Allowance (yup, free popcorn) Volunteer opportunities with charity partners and the Double Good Kids Foundation Company events (Happy Hours, Ice Cream Trucks, Summer Shindig, Holiday Party) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We want our employees to reflect the diverse communities we serve. We embrace the uniqueness in everyone, and we encourage each person to be their true selves. Your age, skin color, beliefs, sexual orientation, nationality, disability, parental status, vet status, gender identity are valued here. We do not stand for discrimination or harassment of any kind. Come as you are.

title: Data Engineer
description: Position Overview The Data Engineer will design, build, and maintain data pipelines, semantic models, and notebooks for BradyPLUS Data Warehouses in the Azure Cloud as well as MS Fabric OneLake. The Data Engineer will also collaborate with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, and the Business Intelligence team to ensure data quality, reliability, and accessibility.Data will be both structured and unstructured in nature with structured data including output from multiple ERP platforms requiring the ability to create, edit and troubleshoot ETL design. Responsibilities Include Develop and optimize data pipelines using Azure Data Factory, SQL Server Integration Services, and other tools. Integrate data from various sources, including internal and external databases, APIs, files, and web services. Implement data quality checks, validation rules, and error handling mechanisms. Create and maintain data models using SQL Server and Azure Analysis Services. Support data warehouse users and applications by providing data access, query optimization, and performance tuning. Work with data analysts and data scientists to understand their data needs and provide solutions. Document data pipelines, data models, data dictionaries, and data standards. Ensure data security and compliance with data governance policies and best practices. The ideal candidate will have Azure SQL Server & Azure Data Factory SQL Server Integration Services (within Visual Studio) Data pipeline development and maintenance using ELT or ETL methodologies Data modeling using dimensional and relational techniques Data quality, validation, and testing skills Good communication and collaboration skills MS Fabric experience including OneLake build out and Power BI development Azure Blob Storage, Azure Key Vault, Azure Integration Runtime, and Azure Monitoring JIRA GIT and/or DevOps BradyPLUS (and its subsidiaries) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, marital status or civil union status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or any other characteristic protected by law. We also provide reasonable accommodations to our applicants and employees with disabilities in order to assist them in the performance of their essential job functions.

title: Senior Data Compliance Analyst
description: Job Title: Senior Data Compliance Analyst Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid – 3 days in office per week) Type: Direct Hire, FTE Our Client's Benefits & Perks: Competitive salary, health benefits including medical, dental and vision; Tuition Reimbursement to support your continued education; Student Loan Repayment Assistance; Generous PTO and Parental leave. 401K, and a highly collaborative and supportive environment developed to encourage work-life balance and employee wellness. Summary And Ideal Candidate Profile The Senior Data Compliance Analyst will report to the Manager of Compliance Monitoring and will provide technical solutions to support programs that ensure compliance with regulatory and internal controls. This role is crucial for facilitating the automation of control testing, quality assurance, monitoring, and generating reports for board reporting. The analyst will build automated workflows, configure data pipelines, develop dashboards, and assist in the design of automated reporting frameworks. What You Will Be Accountable For Design and build automated workflows for data extraction, processing, and conversion to standardized data models. Configure data pipelines to ensure end-to-end process automation for various aspects of the Compliance program. Develop dashboards for Create dashboards for monitoring control testing, identifying risks, and documenting findings. Design and develop automated reporting frameworks for various stakeholders, including management, the Chief Compliance Officer, the Board of Directors, and regulators. Follow best practices in code review, testing, documentation, and technical writing to support the compliance analytics framework. Evaluate existing technologies and data sets to drive meaningful analyses and inform compliance decision-making. Escalate compliance-related issues to the Manager of Compliance Monitoring as needed. What Qualifications You Need Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, or a related required. 2 yrs. experience Risk or Compliance, software development, data analytics, and in financial industries required, quantitative analysis is a plus. Understanding of statistics and quantitative analysis. Experience cleaning and analyzing large and complex datasets to derive meaningful insights. Skilled in building dashboards and reports using Tableau or Python/R data visualization. Skilled in SQL for data extraction and programming for relational databases, Splunk is a plus. Proficient in Python (Pandas/Numpy), MATLAB, or R. Knowledge of OOP languages like C++ or Java is a plus. Experience with workflow tools like Alteryx or Power BI and capable of scheduling automated jobs in Windows or Unix environments. Data Pipeline Development (end-to-end, testing), Agile Methodologies (Git, etc) , and API knowledge (API protocols, REST APIs). title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Perm Hybrid at our Chicago HQ near O'Hare Airport)

title: NCH IMG Senior Data Analyst
description: Position Highlights Sign on bonus: (if applicable) Position: Location: [City, IL] Full Time/Part Time: [Full Time / Part Time] Hours: Monday-Friday, [hours and flexible work schedules] Required Travel: A Brief Overview Provides analytics that support data-driven decision making and the development, tracking and reporting of access and quality metrics for Healthcare Transformation Program leaders in both clinical and administrative settings. Through the Healthcare Transformation Program, Swedish and NorthShore Medical Groups are embedding specialty care (cardiology, sports medicine/orthopedics, dermatology, endocrinology and gastroenterology) into Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) to increase health access and equity. The program will also connect patients with resources in the areas of social determinants of health (SDOH) such as food security, healthy relationships, housing for the homeless and transportation. The Data Analyst's role includes gathering, analyzing and reporting on various types of data and communicating results of analysis to program leaders and other stakeholders as well as developing tools that measure outcomes, recommend action and guide decision-making. This position interfaces with colleagues at all levels of the organization as well as liaise with community partners, FQHCs, and consultants. This position will require an understanding of how the application of analytical techniques correlate to business value and will necessitate being able to select the appropriate analytical techniques for the problem at hand. What You Will Do Knowledge and application of NorthShore policies and procedures that apply to job and area of responsibility. Create analytical tools that allow non-technical leaders to leverage complex data to make program decisions; design and program complex queries against NorthShore proprietary databases that span clinical and financial domains; Create reports for end-users that can either run on demand or automatically Support data-driven decision making and analysis; Interface with program leaders and stakeholders to translate operational goals into tools that support data driven decision making; Educate and consult with program leaders on how to leverage NorthShore's data warehouse to support the operational and analytics needs of the program; Translate abstract operational goals into specific datasets and analysis that answer questions related to the program; Liaises with external partners in order to provide data to measure the impact of the Healthcare Transformation as an innovative, equity-focused model that improves access and reduces costs Serve as data subject matter expert; Understand what data is available in the organization in the various systems supported by HIT; Answer questions from end-users and other analysts about the data in NorthShore's databases that relate to the program; Serve on and work with the program’s Quality Oversight Committee to create an access and quality dashboard for the program and each specialty using the IL Dept. of Healthcare and Family Services’ Pillars of Quality Strategy and existing Develop metrics and tracking systems related to the social determinant of health that the program will address, such as food security, healthy relationships, housing for the homeless and transportation. Prepare regular reports of access and quality metrics, patient volumes, demographics, payer mix, social determinants of health etc. for the Quality Oversight Committee and department chairs and hospital administrative leads and to be reported subsequently to the medical staff and Board of Directors. Engage with and receive support, training, mentoring and direction from the NorthShore Data Analytics team. Collaborate with Swedish/Northshore teams involved with health equity work to develop new tools for applying an equity lens to the metrics that the program tracks and relating them to other system and Swedish health equity metrics. What you will need: Bachelors Degree Mathematics Required Or Bachelors Degree Information Technology Required Or Bachelors Degree Statistics Required Or Bachelors Degree Computer and Information Science Required 2 Years of analytics, programming, statistics, or mathematics experience required. Previous healthcare experience preferred. And 1 Year Experience with relational databases, data warehousing, data mining, or related computing environments And 1 Year Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects) or statistical programs (i.e. SPSS, SAS, R) Exceptionally strong analytic abilities, with a proven track record of driving insightful findings from quantitative and qualitative data Benefits: Career Pathways to Promote Professional Growth and Development Various Medical, Dental, and Vision options, including Domestic Partner Coverage Tuition Reimbursement Free Parking at designated locations Wellness Program Savings Plan Health Savings Account Options Retirement Options with Company Match Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay Community Involvement Opportunities
summary: This role involves data analysis to support data-driven decision making and the development, tracking and reporting of access and quality metrics for the Healthcare Transformation Program, which aims to increase access to specialty care in underserved communities by embedding specialty care into Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs). The Data Analyst will gather, analyze, and report on various types of data, develop tools to measure outcomes, and communicate results to program leaders and stakeholders. This position requires strong analytical skills, experience with relational databases, data warehousing, and business intelligence tools.

title: Value Analysis Specialist
description: Value Analysis Specialist 12 months Contract Provides professional, technical and administrative skills in the operations of Clinical Value Analysis. Responsible for working and assessing within a defined structure to identify cost savings opportunities related to improved product, service, and related standardization and product utilization.Reviews and assesses applicable financial, clinical, operational, and evidence bases literature and appropriately assists in the selection, evaluation, monitoring, analysis and implementation of selected products and initiatives. Develops and maintains collaborative relationships with clinical and non clinical staff to ensure effective results oriented project outcomes. Responsibilities Serves as a liaison between Supply Chain and hospital clinical and non-clinical departments and staff to ensure cost-effective utilization of products, services, and processes including but not limited to medical/surgical supplies, Lab, Imaging, Cath Lab,Surgical Services, Pharmacy, and Food and Nutrition. Coordinates product evaluation processes related to value analysis projects, including but not limited to cost and contract proposals, trial product, literature, preliminary financial analysis current state vs. proposed state. Prepares and communicates agenda, meeting minutes, product and financial analysis,necessary to conduct the meetings in a professional, concise and timely manner. Communicates and assists in the coordination of product trials utilizing vendor representatives. Includes Nursing Professional Development in those processes when necessary. Assists in the development, criteria, and deployment of evaluation forms and the distribution of sample products for trial. Gathers results of trials and communicates with the committees. Manages the Value Analysis Process from the time of proposal to implementation and final results; beginning to end. Responsible for the documentation of ongoing initiatives, tracking of evaluations/trials,and data collection. Responsible for developing and maintaining a Savings Tracker and reporting that information to Materials/Supply Chain staff, Nursing/ Clinical Departments and senior leadership. Responsible for the ongoing review and management of supply backorders ; re-routes, substitute product for manufacturer and log term stock outages. Develops communication tools to provide the status of backordered product to end users and supply chain staff until a resolution is achieved. Develops and maintains a database for acceptable product substitutions to avoid continued research into acceptable product. Works closely with the Inventory Control Manager, Data Analyst, and Supply Chain IT Analyst to provide clinically acceptable product in the most efficient and timely manner possible to care for patients. Assists Purchasing Manager with product recalls; receipt, logging, deployment of recalls to end user departments, and the notification and return process to the vendor. Principal Accountabilities Standards of Performance: Respect, Integrity, Compassion, Collaboration, Stewardship, Accountability, Quality Education Bachelor’s Degree in business or healthcare management or a related clinical field preferred Associate’s Degree in business or healthcare management or a related clinical field required. Licenses and Certification RN license preferred. Experience And Skills Technical Experience: 2 years of product experience preferably in a clinical hospital environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Physical Activities Intermittent hand manipulation required Intermittent lifting and carrying of 20 pounds which can be modified #IND123
summary: This is a 12-month contract position for a Value Analysis Specialist responsible for identifying cost savings opportunities in healthcare by evaluating products, services, and processes. The role involves coordinating product evaluations, preparing reports, communicating with stakeholders, managing the Value Analysis process, tracking savings, and addressing supply backorders. The ideal candidate will have a background in business or healthcare management and clinical experience.

automation and data entry procedural training Monitors business perception of data quality Creates and implements techniques for data collection, accuracy, and management Reports findings and works for data and analytics that serve as the source material for regulatory reports Ensures that the data used for financial reporting and to support legal requirements is valid, reliable, traceable, timely, available, secure, and consistent NOTE: The list of essential duties is not intended to be inclusive; there may be other duties that are essential to particular positions within the class.
