summary: This role supports the North America Operations team by developing Power BI dashboards and reports to analyze operational performance. This position involves data analysis, trend identification, report development, process improvement, and collaboration with IT and subject matter experts. The ideal candidate will have experience with Power BI, BusinessObjects, SAP, and data visualization tools.

title: Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst - Remote
description: Job Description Join one of the nation’s most comprehensive academic medical centers, UChicago Medicine as a Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst in our Marketing Department . This is a remote, work from home opportunity and you may be based outside of the greater Chicagoland area. Job Summary The Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst will serve as the main subject matter expert of marketing audience segmentation and data connections and management. This role will report to the Executive Director, Performance Marketing, and have a key role in serving as the liaison between multiple internal and external stakeholders (marketing, agency, consultants, etc.). This role will need to have experience in working with digital media tagging and Customer Data Platforms. Essential Job Functions Lead audience activation management, processes, evolution, and oversee data taxonomy creation, set up and measurement Collaborate with media partners to configure, test, and validate destinations (social, display, rich media, targeting platforms) to send segments for audience activation Influence internal teams and take a leadership role to ensure that key audience segmentations are used appropriately and regularly Be the subject matter expert in audience data management and insights - build a learning agenda to evangelize audience management best practices and educate marketers Qualifications 8+ years of experience in a combination of marketing, digital marketing, digital platforms, or media Seasoned experience with Data Management Platforms, Customer Data Platforms, and Programmatic Platforms to create attributes, segments, push audiences live, and prepare audience analysis Strong familiarity with digital advertising ecosystems Strong familiarity with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud Strong familiarity with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Position Details Job Type/FTE: Full Time (1.0 FTE) Shift: Day Unit/Department: Marketing – Hyde Park CBA Code: Non-Union Must comply with UCMC’s COVID-19 Vaccination requirement as a condition of employment. If you have already received the vaccination, you must provide proof as part of the pre-employment process. This is in addition to your compliance with the Flu Vaccination requirement as well. Medical and religious exemptions will be considered consistent with applicable law. Lastly, a pre-employment physical, drug screening, and background check are also required for all employees prior to hire. Why Join Us We’ve been at the forefront of medicine since 1899. We provide superior healthcare with compassion, always mindful that each patient is a person, an individual. To accomplish this, we need employees with passion, talent and commitment… with patients and with each other. We’re in this together: working to advance medical innovation, serve the health needs of the community, and move our collective knowledge forward. If you’d like to add enriching human life to your profile, The University of Chicago Medicine is for you. Here at the forefront, we’re doing work that really matters. Join us. Bring your passion. ________ Bring your career to the next level at a hospital that is thriving; from patient satisfaction to employee engagement, we are at the Forefront of Medicine. Take advantage of all we have to offer and #BringYourPassiontotheForefront. University of Chicago Medicine is growing; discover how you can be a part of this pursuit of excellence at: www.uchospitals.edu/jobs The University of Chicago Medical Center is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, civil union status, parental status, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status and other legally protected characteristics.
summary: The Salesforce Data Cloud Analyst at UChicago Medicine will be responsible for audience segmentation, data management, and serving as a liaison between marketing, agencies, and consultants. This role requires experience with digital media tagging, Customer Data Platforms, and a strong understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem. The position is remote and requires 8+ years of experience in marketing, digital marketing, or related fields.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst Peoria
description: Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including TimberPro, Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton. Job Overview Provides the resource to assist with process improvement activities within PMO Procurement team and works to align cross functionally to ensure optimal organizational effectiveness. Assist the department managers to drive change within the organization. Defines required metrics for supporting internal effectiveness and individual accountability within the department. Assist the procurement managers with projects that impact the Electric Haulage Division. Manages the process to measure supplier performance and provides tools to assist managers to drive controls for supplier performance. This position is responsible for the periodic management and control of the planning processes and the development and maintenance of other material requirement points of control. The duties and responsibilities and accountabilities of this position impact the following - $600M inventory (combined inventory for manufacturing and service parts). Availability targets (95%+) Manages supplier performance management of over 400 suppliers. Key Job Responsibilities Support the development and on-going management of organizational controls and metrics that drive individual accountability within the department. To lead Procurement department improvements, including research, analysis, develop recommended actions, implement/track plans needed to support the Electric Haulage Division. Coordinate and control the integration between various systems inside and outside of the division to ensure optimal performance. Coordinate and prepare periodic analysis, reports and presentations that track performance to goal or provide information for action regarding, inventory, availability, supplier performance, backorder aging or any other procurement responsibility. Provides reports and analysis for decision making at all levels of the organization. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned by the Manager, Production Planning. The position occasionally requires working extended periods to meet time sensitive deadlines. Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor of Science degree required – MBA a plus. Minimum 2 years’ experience in Parts Operations, Logistics, Manufacturing, Distribution, or Materials Management – experience managing inventory control and MRP systems a plus. Analytical skills a must, including aptitude for various software systems; Power BI, SAP, Python. Advanced excel experience is a requirement including but not limited to writing VBA. Knowledge of SQL is required. Professional written and oral communication skills appropriate to all levels of the organization. Professional PC skills and working knowledge of operating systems, manufacturing processes, Proficient use of Microsoft Word and Power Point, are required. Experience with MRP system implementation or transition is a plus. Embraces personal accountability, self-motivation, and willingness to make decisions. Must be able to prioritize work. Strong customer service skills required for internal and external customers. Additional Information Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.
summary: This position supports the PMO Procurement team in process improvement activities, driving change within the organization, defining metrics for effectiveness, assisting with projects impacting the Electric Haulage Division, and managing supplier performance. The role involves managing inventory control, MRP systems, supplier performance management, and generating reports and analysis for decision making.

title: Quantitative Researcher
description: Quant Researcher - Options Market Making - $800k Hiring an experienced Quant Researcher to develop quantitative models for a high-performance options market-making desk. You will work closely with the technology teams to ensure that trading models and algorithms are seamlessly integrated into the trading infrastructure, with a focus on low-latency execution. Key Responsibilities: Quantitative Model Development: Develop and refine quantitative models for pricing, volatility forecasting, and the identification of short-term arbitrage opportunities. Market Data Analysis: Leverage your expertise in statistical analysis to parse vast datasets, applying machine learning algorithms where appropriate to enhance decision-making processes and identify new trading opportunities. Strategy Optimization: Optimize risk management and execution efficiency. Back-Testing and Performance Analysis: Conduct rigorous back-testing of strategies, and evaluate potential profitability and risk. Utilize post-trade analysis to iterate and refine strategies, ensuring continuous improvement and adaptation to market conditions. Required Skills and Qualifications: Expertise in options trading and market making, with a strong track record of developing successful quantitative strategies. A deep understanding of options pricing models, volatility surface dynamics, and the mechanics of options markets. Exceptional skills in Python & C++ programming. Advanced Degree (Ph.D.) in a Quantitative field. Desired: Experience in a high-frequency trading environment is highly valued. Experience with machine learning frameworks is preferred.
summary: Quant Researcher needed to develop quantitative models for an options market-making desk, focusing on pricing, volatility forecasting, arbitrage, and low-latency execution. You'll analyze market data, optimize trading strategies, and conduct back-testing to ensure profitability.

title: Quantitative Researcher
description: My client is one of the very top global HFT Prop trading firms and is looking for a Quantitative Trader / Researcher to join their trading team. This role involves using a cutting-edge trading system to develop and deploy algorithmic trading strategies based on market behavior patterns. Responsibilities: - Design, implement, and deploy trading algorithms - Research high to mid-frequency alphas - Analyze market data, market microstructure, and alternative data for patterns - Create tools to analyze data and develop data platforms - Contribute to analytical computation libraries for market data analysis and trading - Develop, augment, and calibrate exchange simulators Qualifications: - Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related STEM field - Experience in quantitative trading - Strong background in mathematics and statistics - Proficiency in back-testing, simulation, and statistical techniques (e.g., auto-regression, auto-correlation, PCA) - Solid data-mining and analysis skills, with experience in large datasets/tick data - Familiarity with signal generation and statistical models - Strong programming skills in Python or C++ Compensation: Annual base salary range: $120,000-220,000, plus eligibility for discretionary bonus. Hybrid working. Please do apply if this is something you would be interested in, with an up to date resume. Many thanks, Ed
summary: Quantitative Trader / Researcher role at a top global HFT Prop trading firm. Responsibilities include designing, implementing, and deploying algorithmic trading strategies based on market behavior patterns. This role requires experience in quantitative trading, strong mathematical and statistical background, proficiency in back-testing, simulation, and data analysis, and strong programming skills in Python or C++.

title: Data Engineer (with a focus on SSRS & PowerBI)
description: Thank you for stopping by to take a look at the Data Engineer with a focus on SSRS and PowerBI role I have posted here on LinkedIN, I appreciate it. If you have read my JD's in the past, you will know that I like to add humor to these things. So, if you see something in here that gives you a chuckle, that was the intent. If you are new to my JD's, welcome to the party. As with just about everything I work on, social fit is going to be almost as important as the technical fit. So, you might ask...what are some of these social fit pieces of this role: This is a role where you will be working with end users and that need to communicate in the same mindset of that great Steven Covey habit of 'first seek to understand...then to be understood' will be needed for success here. By the way, if you haven't read 7 Habits of Highly Effective People, oh man...you are really missing out. It just might change how you communicate with everyone about everything. Have you ever been in an environment with a lot of backstabbing passive aggressive types? That kinda stinks, doesn't it? Well, you wont have to deal with that here. The individuals you will be working with actually have a vested interest in your success and will cheer you on as opposed to drag you down. You will be working on things that actually have consequences to the overall business. This is a 100 year old law firm that is really using IT to drive decisions (I know, who would have thunk that). So, that ability to collaborate with others, drive into the details of what is really being asked, and then execute on that will be a real key to success here. This role is permanent and fully benefited This role is being done in a hybrid manner with 3 days onsite (311 West Monroe in Downtown Chicago) and 2 days remote. We are only able to work with candidates that already reside in the Chicago area for this role. I can only work with US Citizens or Green Card Holders for this role. Here is what we are looking for: The official Title of this role is 'Financial Applications Data Engineer'. However, under the covers, it is really a Data role focused on SSRS and PowerBI. If you have some really solid SSRS and PowerBI skills along with some SSIS skills, that is spot on with what we are seeking in this role. You will be responsible for the data analysis, dashboarding, and reporting for the finance & accounting departments. The ETL skill (SSIS) will be needed so that your reporting and PBI dashboards will actually reflect the right data as opposed to reporting off of stuff that doesn't make a ton of sense. You will be working within an existing team of data engineers that focus on the data layer as well as other aspects of the BI stack. I won't bore you to tears with a ton of essential duties...instead, I will share the highlights: Rapidly builds and maintains an understanding of the firm’s “data landscape” – the key systems and databases used across the firm, how they are used, their data, data models and data integrations, with a specific focus on Finance & Accounting data. Work with fun stuff like data cleansing efforts, creation of reliable data pipelines and ETL processes, join & relate data from disparate systems. Prepare data for modeling, reporting, visualization and analysis (you will be working with the backend data team for the preparation part...we really want to to want to participate, however). Generate a variety of reporting outputs, leveraging Microsoft Power BI and other tools. Works with our Enterprise Data Architect in the design and implementation of new data models that may pertain to Finance & Accounting. Design and build sSQL queries, views, functions and stored procedures. Develop and implements various Finance & Accounting and related dashboards. Provide technical assistance and guidance to others, both within and outside of IT, helping them to locate and access the data they need. Works with our Enterprise Data Architect and Data Engineers in other functions to build a strong community of expertise that supports the development and delivery of the firm’s data strategy Design, builds and tests data structures and reporting process/systems Participates in rotational 24 x 7 application support ensuring that the application portfolio uptime is maintained according to defined SLA’s Here is what we are seeking: At least 4 years of PowerBI and SSRS experience. I am more interested in breath and depth of that PBI & SSRS experience. So, we are looking for that ability to 'make sense of data'...not just build reports and dashboards. Experience working with organizational data warehouses, including the creation and management of the data residing within them. You will be focusing on the presentation layer (SSRS and PBI), but that experience with understanding what the data and ETL layer is telling you will be need in this role. So, yep, we are looking for at least some SSIS experience. Experience with both on prem Sql and Azure Sql. Data engineering certifications (e.g. Azure Certified Data Engineer) are a plus.
summary: This role is for a Data Engineer focused on SSRS and PowerBI, working with finance & accounting data at a 100 year old law firm.  Responsibilities include data analysis, dashboarding, reporting, and working with the ETL process (SSIS). The role requires collaboration, understanding the data landscape, data cleansing, pipeline creation, and technical guidance to others.

title: Senior Data Product Analyst
description: Overview: We are seeking a dynamic Senior Data Product Analyst to join our client's Decision Intelligence Group (DIG). This role is integral in bridging business needs with technical solutions, ensuring seamless data access and utilization to drive informed decision-making. As a key player, you will collaborate with business leaders, data engineers, and software developers to craft data-driven solutions that fuel company success. Key Responsibilities: - Data Product Expertise: Act as the subject matter expert on data products, working closely with business leaders and technical teams to deliver timely, relevant data. - Collaboration: Serve as the primary liaison within DIG, understanding data needs, gathering requirements, and translating business problems into actionable technical solutions. - Data Model Development: Create and implement data models, tables, and dashboards that enable the business to interpret data and derive insights quickly. - Dashboard Design: Design intuitive, flexible dashboards that answer business questions efficiently, reducing the need for multiple specific visualizations. - Data Solution Advocacy: Promote the use of data solutions across the organization through training, webinars, and hands-on sessions with business analysts. - Research and Recommendations: Conduct independent research to provide insights and recommendations on critical data for understanding customer experiences. - Third-party Data Integration: Explore and integrate new third-party data sources to enhance business performance. - Best Practices Adoption: Develop and promote best practices in data integrity, testing, analysis, validation, and documentation. - Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to team members, fostering skill development and creating business value. - Compliance: Ensure health and safety guidelines are followed and protect the company's reputation by maintaining confidentiality. - Continuous Learning: Stay updated with industry trends by attending workshops, reading professional publications, and networking. Minimum Qualifications: - Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or a related field. - Experience: 3+ years in Analytics/Business Intelligence, with a focus on leading projects and building data solutions in a cloud environment. - Technical Skills: - Advanced experience with data visualization platforms like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik. - Proficiency in SQL and intermediate-level experience with Python (Pandas, Polars, or Spark). - Experience with self-service analytics, preferably within Azure Cloud architecture, PowerBI, and/or Databricks. - Experience with large volumes of structured and unstructured data. - Soft Skills: Strong business acumen, excellent communication skills, and the ability to lead projects independently and collaboratively. Preferred Qualifications: - Education: Master's degree in a related field. - Certifications: Power BI Development and Design certification. - Experience: - Familiarity with Azure Synapse, Databricks, and ADLS Gen 2. - Experience with Google Analytics, Firebase, Big Query, Event Hubs, Kafka, Salesforce, SAP, and CDP platforms like Tealium. - Web-based data visualization skills. - Technical Skills: Proficiency with project management tools (Jira), source control (BitBucket), and working within a technology-driven organization. Why Join Us? Our client offers a collaborative and innovative environment where your expertise will directly impact the company's success. Join a team dedicated to harnessing the power of data to drive business growth and efficiency. Application Process: If you are a data-driven professional with a passion for translating complex data into actionable insights, we want to hear from you. Apply now to take the next step in your career with a leading organization in data analytics.
summary: This role involves working with data products, translating business needs into technical solutions, developing data models, designing dashboards, and advocating for data solutions within the company. The candidate will work closely with business leaders, data engineers, and software developers to create data-driven solutions that drive informed decision-making.

title: Data Steward II
description: Description: Role Overview: The selected candidate will be responsible for gathering and documenting information necessary to satisfy high-level business requirements related to healthcare providers, organizations, and affiliations to support Izervay requirements and processes. Proficient in traditional business analyst and data analyst skills, the individual will utilize strong SQL expertise for comprehensive data analysis, profiling data, and ensuring data accuracy within our Master Data Management platform. They will contribute to enhancing overall data management processes by providing recommendations for integration into our existing Master Data environment, ensuring seamless and efficient data integration. A background in testing will be valuable, as the candidate will participate in and oversee the testing processes to guarantee the reliability and accuracy of integrated data. Their curious nature will drive them to explore and understand data intricacies, leading to innovative solutions and continuous improvement in data management practices. Post project deployment, the candidate will serve as a key customer contact, working closely with customers to address questions or concerns related to data integration. Additional Responsibilities: Develop data stewardship processes for our Data Support Specialists. Willingness to perform data stewardship tasks when necessary to ensure the smooth functioning of data management processes. Qualifications: Proven experience in a hybrid role combining traditional business analyst and data analyst skills. Strong proficiency in SQL for data analysis, profiling, and manipulation. Familiarity with Master Data Management platforms and best practices. Ability to gather and document information necessary to satisfy high-level business requirements. Background in testing processes. A curious nature that fosters exploration and innovation in data management.
summary: This role combines business analyst and data analyst skills, focusing on gathering and documenting healthcare provider information for data management. The candidate will use SQL for data analysis, ensure data accuracy, and integrate data into the Master Data Management platform.  They will also participate in testing and provide post-deployment customer support.

title: SQL Developer - Remote | WFH
description: Job Title: SQL Developer Location: Remote (Anywhere in the US) Compensation: $53.00 per hour, Paid Time Off, Employer 401k Contributions, Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Total Annual Compensation including benefits is approximately $122,000.00 Company Overview We are seeking talented consultants to join our team and support clients across various Life Sciences industries. Precise Solutions offers competitive compensation packages, including great salaries, benefits, health insurance, paid time off, and employer-based 401k contributions. Job Description As a SQL Developer at Precise Solutions, you will play a crucial role in maintaining and executing our SQL-based trending platform. You will be responsible for reviewing and interpreting ongoing business report requirements, researching required data, and building reporting deliverables. Additionally, you will analyze and optimize existing SQL queries for improved performance and develop procedures and scripts for data mapping of new products. Responsibilities Maintain and execute our SQL-based trending platform. Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements. Research required data and build reporting deliverables. Analyze and optimize existing SQL queries. Develop procedures and scripts for data mapping of new products. Provide timely scheduled management reporting. Requirements Experience in SQL coding. BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Strong understanding of SQL Workbench. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel. Preferred: Strong knowledge of VBA macro development. Strong problem-solving skills and a critical thinker. Ability to work effectively in a team environment. Excellent time-management and interpersonal skills. 3-5+ years of relevant experience. Manager's Overview The ideal candidate should have experience with SQL coding, maintaining execution of trending platforms, and writing business requirements. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and developing written procedures is crucial. Manager Q&A Remote? Yes, this position is fully remote. Top Skills: Experience with SQL coding, trending platforms (TIBCO, Qlik), and handling customer business requirements. Pharma or Regulated Industry? No specific requirement. Team Size and Location: Mostly remote, within US time zones, requiring collaboration with a team. Coding Assessment? No coding assessment; skills are assessed through interviews. Additional Skills: Experience with SQL Workbench, RedShift, and trending platforms like TIBCO or QlikView are beneficial. Employment Type: Full-Time
summary: As a SQL Developer at Precise Solutions, you will maintain and execute the SQL-based trending platform. This involves reviewing and interpreting business report requirements, researching data, building reports, optimizing SQL queries, and developing data mapping scripts. You will also provide scheduled management reporting. This is a fully remote role with a team based in US time zones.

title: Senior Analyst Human Capital Data
description: Company Description AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Job Description Key Responsibilities Act as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, & recommending solutions to key business partners in collaboration with other members of the HCD team. Participate as a core member of the department, working closely with the team to provide data driven solutions & support to all HCD solution areas. Design databases by going through all phases like Conceptual design, Logical design, Physical design, & normalization techniques. Take a lead role in the creation of an advanced Oracle data warehouse focusing on maintaining existing data elements & exploring data from other data systems. Manage the tableau server &Identifying patterns and meaningful insights from data by analyzing it using tableau. Demonstrate exceptional judgment & discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data. Perform analysis & regular reporting for stakeholders across the business. Define design to meet business requirements in compliance with Oracle & Oracle ETL design methodologies. Build systems as designed by using PL/SQL, SQL Loader, Batch scripts, & Autosys Scheduler. Develop presentations on metrics, reports, & analysis. Manage multiple concurrent projects that require inputs from cross functional stakeholders while balancing impact on business needs. Utilize experience in PL/SQL, batch scripting language & job scheduler. Leverage tools, such as Oracle, Tableau & Excel to drive analytics & enable client self-service on routine queries. Responsible for continuous research & learning of new industry trends in Human Capital Analytics. Perform database architecture & routine maintenance in Tableau server. Qualifications Must possess a Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Computer Science or a highly related field of study with at least 3 years of related experience in the following: Designing databases by going through all phases like Conceptual design, Logical design, Physical design, & normalization techniques; Managing the tableau server and Identifying patterns & meaningful insights from data by analyzing it using tableau; Defining design to meet business requirements in compliance with Oracle & Oracle ETL design methodologies; Building systems as designed by using PL/SQL, SQL Loader, Batch scripts, & Autosys Scheduler. Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en. Refer to Req ID: REF25299K. Additional Information We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term and long-term incentive programs. AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
summary: AbbVie seeks a Data Analyst with 3+ years of experience in database design, Tableau, Oracle, and PL/SQL to provide data-driven solutions for their Human Capital Department. Responsibilities include database design, data analysis, reporting, and maintaining Tableau servers.

title: Senior Analyst, Data Engineering
description: A division of Publicis Groupe, Publicis Digital Experience is a network of top-tier agencies designed to develop capabilities and solutions to enable growth and provide scaled access to the digital capabilities of Publicis Groupe in service of our clients. Together, the Publicis Digital Experience portfolio endeavors to create value at the intersection of technology and experiences to connect brands and people. Our model to transform every brand experience will help clients navigate, develop, and activate commerce in a way that will provide them with a future-proof model for modern marketing. With our unique expertise in consumer engagement, CRM, and commerce, Publicis Digital Experience powers brands and empowers people in a new era of creativity. An ever-changing landscape and the need for fluid thinking is just part of our problem-solving nature. Which means we're untethered from any specific medium or method—we go where ideas will work best. We are an expanding network with more than 5,000 employees, with agency brands throughout our global offices. Publicis Digital Experience brands include Razorfish, Digitas, Arc Worldwide, Saatchi Saatchi X, Plowshare, 3Share, and the Publicis Commerce Exchange. Job Description As a Senior Analyst, Data Engineering you will support the design, development, and maintenance of business intelligence capabilities with special focus on SQL and Python as tools to create automated pipelines. You will apply knowledge of data structures and pipelines to contribute to the organization's data-driven decision making, play a key role in shaping and re-designing the data architecture, and drive insights that impact business outcomes. Your Responsibilities: Conceptualize, develop and document data pipeline architecture to support reporting tools. Support the creation of automated reporting backends with high levels of efficiency and accuracy in GCP and Teradata. Maintain a functional expertise of the client data, its nature, and documentation. Own existing processes in production, optimizing its code and creating additional documentation. Collaborate effectively with cross-functional team members to understand data needs and develop meaningful solutions. Contribute to the automation of quality assurance and data processes to ensure accuracy and efficiency. Qualifications 2+ Years of relevant experience in Google Cloud services such as BigQuery, GCS, Cloud SQL, ML, DataStudio, or similar Cloud services experience. Highly proficient in SQL and Python. Detail oriented while keeping sight of bigger picture. Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets. Experience analyzing data to identify issues and inconsistencies. Passionate about data and understanding consumer behavior. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Familiarity with version control software (Git) and writing technical documentation. Knowledge of data testing and DBT is a big plus. Additional Information The Power of One starts with our people! To do powerful things, we offer powerful resources. Our best-in-class wellness and benefits offerings include: Paid Family Care for parents and caregivers for 12 weeks or more Monetary assistance and support for Adoption, Surrogacy and Fertility Monetary assistance and support for pet adoption Employee Assistance Programs and Health/Wellness/Comfort reimbursements to help you invest in your future and work/life balance Tuition Assistance Paid time off that includes Flexible Time off Vacation, Annual Sick Days, Volunteer Days, Holiday and Identity days, and more Matching Gifts programs Flexible working arrangements 'Work Your World' Program encouraging employees to work from anywhere Publicis Groupe has an office for up to 6 weeks a year (based upon eligibility) Business Resource Groups that support multiple affinities and alliances The benefits offerings listed are available to eligible U.S. Based employees, are reviewed on an annual basis, and are governed by the terms of the applicable plan documents. Publicis Digital Experience is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to actual or perceived race, color, ethnicity, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability, medical condition as defined by applicable state law, genetic information, marital status, military service and veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you require accommodation or assistance with the application or onboarding process specifically, please contact USMSTACompliance@publicis.com. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. summary: Publicis Digital Experience seeks a Senior Analyst, Data Engineering to design, develop, and maintain business intelligence capabilities, focusing on SQL and Python for automated pipelines. This role involves building and optimizing data pipelines, analyzing data, and collaborating with cross-functional teams. Ideal candidates will have 2+ years of experience with Google Cloud services (BigQuery, GCS, Cloud SQL, ML, DataStudio) and proficiency in SQL and Python.

title: Risk & Insurance Data Analyst
description: Job Description Join our dynamic organization as a Risk and Insurance Data Analyst and take charge of a diverse set of responsibilities that will amplify your expertise. From coordinating Risk Management and Insurance databases to conducting insightful financial analyses for projects, you'll be at the forefront of strategic initiatives, including researching claim trends, benchmarking, and acquisitions. As our Risk and Insurance Data Analyst , you'll play a pivotal role in providing top-notch service across all levels of the company, making this an exceptional opportunity for growth and impact. Responsibilities Risk Management Information System Take primary responsibility on the management of Ventas’ Risk Management Information System (RMIS). Requires proficient use of RMIS to access data and develop various types of reports and provide to internal and external stakeholders, including the Corporate Risk Manager, Corporate Finance and Accounting teams, insurance brokers, outside consultants, and insurers. Data is analyzed often to ensure its credibility and accuracy. Have the aptitude to learn how to use new systems in the event systems, insurers or vendors are changed. Lease Audit and Compliance System Assist Corporate Risk Manager in ensuring tenants remain compliant with insurance requirements set forth in leases of Ventas’ NNN asset portfolio, including renewal, coverage, and limit requirements. Complete Projects assigned by the Corporate Risk Manager Examples of new projects include research and analysis of risk identification including acquisitions; cost of risk analysis; and assist in the preparation of databases and presentations. Other projects will be assigned as needed by the Corporate Risk Manager and VP of Corporate Risk. Maintenance of all Insurance Policies and Related Records Work with the insurance broker to ensure policies are accurate and complete as bound. Manage Ventas’ insurance policy and endorsement directory to ensure ready access for internal stakeholders. In collaboration with our outside broker, develop and manage a historical insurance schedule each year as policies renew. Obtain Exposure Information and Loss Experience for Insurance Renewals Work with the appropriate staff throughout the organization to obtain actual and projected payroll by classification, by state and/or by country; revenues; number of vehicles; employee headcount; and property values and business interruption values, including acquired and sold properties, and loss reports to submit this information to insurance brokers and insurers. Claims Management Work closely with the Corporate Risk Manager in monitoring Workers’ Compensation, Professional, General Liability, Auto Liability and Physical Damage, Property Insurance, Crime and Employment Practices Liability claims. Review property and casualty loss data to identify benchmarking and claim trends. Run reports and research individual claims from various insurance carriers and TPA systems, as well as the insurance broker’s extranet. Insurance Certificates Requests Respond to and manage annual and ad hoc requests for Certificates of Insurance, including requests from lenders, municipalities, vendors, and other third parties ensuring timeliness and accuracy of COIs. Monitor Corporate Insurance and Risk Management Payments Confirm the accuracy of invoices and recommend approval of payment to the Corporate Risk Manager while maintaining updated database of invoice payments made. Ensure premium payments are paid timely to preclude the cancellation of insurance policies. Experience Bachelor's degree in related field; ARM designation preferred 1-5 years of risk management experience in a corporate structure High degree of computer literacy and systems-oriented approach to problem solving, including strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills and experience. Ventas, Inc. offers a competitive compensation and benefits package to the successful candidate. Ventas, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Ventas, Inc. does not accept unsolicited resumes from staffing agencies, search firms or any third parties.
summary: Ventas, Inc. is seeking a Risk and Insurance Data Analyst to manage their Risk Management Information System (RMIS), ensure tenant compliance with insurance requirements, conduct risk analysis, maintain insurance policies and records, obtain exposure information, and manage claims. This role requires strong analytical and technical skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.

title: Analyst, Support
description: About Annalect Annalect is the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group Annalect’s 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter — whether that means fostering consumers’ trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it’s most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom’s unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients’ and partners’ data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes. Annalect’s unique approach to data and technology – one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability – allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients. Team Overview The Annalect Engineering team is an engaged and innovative group of technologists that includes backend, frontend, full-stack, and data engineers. It is comprised of both onsite and remote team members who are highly collaborative and committed to a culture of work/life balance and continual learning & development. Position Overview Annalect is seeking a motivated and dynamic client facing Application Support Analyst to join our technology team in NY or one of our other US offices. In this role, you will be working on supporting multiple applications developed by Annalect Technology team, as well as off-the-shelf tools that we integrated into our ecosystem. As a support SME you will be responsible for managing and resolving Level 2 and 3 incidents, coordinating any Production bugs resolutions or outages with Product and DevOps teams. This position would also be working closely with various internal and external stakeholders to identify gaps in the existing support model and engineer improvements to the existing processes to ensure highest level of customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities Learn the Annalect products and become a SME in product functionality with a deep understanding of the business logic of the tools Manage Atlassian based ticketing system and provide necessary reports for internal and external stakeholders Provide exceptional customer experience while resolving Level 2 and 3 incidents and troubleshooting/diagnosing customer issues Troubleshoot and escalate incidents that cannot be resolved by Support team to the appropriate Engineering/Product team Responsible for improving and expanding internal and external knowledgebase for the supported products Contribute to ongoing improvement of the team's processes, techniques, and solutions Provide technical guidance, training, and mentorship to the team Required Skills And Qualifications 3+ years of support experience, with at least 2 years working on supporting cloud-based applications in a client-facing environment Self-motivated and action-driven with the ability to take initiative, execute and follow-through Experience in owning and taking responsibility for complex technical/functional escalations Good troubleshooting skills, with ability to solve challenging technical problems using various debugging tools (Firebug, HTTPFox, Fiddler, Chrome Dev Console, etc.) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong attention to detail, extremely well-organized and able to deliver against multiple simultaneous tasks with excellence Comfortable working in a fast-paced, start-up like environment Would be a plus to have experience managing SSO platforms (Okta, Google IDP, Facebook etc.) Experience with databases and using SQL to query data Some background/understanding of web analytics tool basics: tag, cookies, data attributes, data layer, variables. Hands-on experience with online advertising technology and systems (Google, Amazon, Facebook, et.) Perks of working at Annalect Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative environment that encourages engagement and work/life balance Generous PTO that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Friday program and extended time off around the holiday season. As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a “startup” - we move fast, break things, and innovate. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits. Compensation Range $65,000—$75,000 USD Annalect, a division of Omnicom Media Group is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Review Our Recruitment Privacy Notice
summary: Annalect, the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group, is seeking a Client Facing Application Support Analyst to join their technology team in NY or other US offices. This role involves supporting multiple applications developed by Annalect's Technology team, as well as off-the-shelf tools integrated into their ecosystem. Responsibilities include managing and resolving Level 2 and 3 incidents, coordinating production bug resolutions and outages, improving support processes, and contributing to the team's knowledge base. Ideal candidates will have 3+ years of support experience, at least 2 years supporting cloud-based applications in a client-facing environment, strong troubleshooting skills, and excellent communication skills. Experience with SSO platforms, databases, SQL, web analytics tools, and online advertising technology is a plus.

title: Business System Analyst
description: IT Business Systems Analyst III TeamSoft IT Solution’s client is looking for a direct hire IT Business Systems Analyst III. This position is hybrid in Downers Grove, IL for a manufacturing company. IT Business Systems Analyst III Job Summary: Develops and maintains a working relationship and understanding of business operations and system interfaces throughout the company. Serves as the primary liaison between IT and assigned business functional areas. Facilitates requirements gathering, specification development, test plan development, and execution through interviews, workflow analysis, and/or discussions with others. Leads discussions in evaluating business needs, research and perform impact analysis of new requirements or changes. Gathers, analyzes, and reports on data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and architect business solutions that leverage ERP capabilities. Documents business processes and/or system functionality. Develops and maintains the corporate knowledge base for ERP and ancillary applications and associated environments. Serves as an expert on the functional configuration, capabilities, and usage of the company ERP system. IT Business Systems Analyst III Qualifications: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or related field. Equivalent experience will be considered. 6 years of professional working experience as a Business Systems Analyst. 5 years of experience supporting modern ERP and IT applications; defining and mapping business processes and understanding integration between various applications. Proven project management experience. Deacom ERP experience is preferred, but not required. Manufacturing experience is a plus.
summary: This position involves working with business operations, system interfaces, and IT applications to gather requirements, analyze data, and develop solutions leveraging ERP capabilities. The role requires strong communication, analytical, and project management skills, with a focus on understanding and configuring ERP systems.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Company Overview Informa is a leading international events, intelligence, and scholarly research group. We are the specialist’s specialist. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs, and take better informed decisions. Informa is listed on London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with over 10,000 colleagues working in more than 30 countries. Informa’s divisions include: Informa Connect , a specialist in content-driven events and digital communities that allow professionals to meet, connect, learn, and share knowledge. Informa Intelligence , providing digital intelligence and data-based products, consultancy and research services that help businesses in specialist markets make better informed decisions, spot opportunities, and gain competitive edge. Informa Markets , creating platforms for international markets to trade, innovate and grow.Through over 500 leading brands, our exhibitions, specialist digital content and data solutions allow customers operating in specialist markets to meet and trade, and for their businesses and markets to thrive. Informa Tech , a division bringing specialism in technology. They aim to inspire the global technology community to design, build and run a better digital world through research, media, training, and events that inform, educate, and connect businesses and professionals working in technology. Taylor & Francis, specialist in scholarly research and in helping academic and research communities make new breakthroughs. They commission, curate, produce and publish scholarly research and reference-led content in specialist subject areas, helping to advance research and enabling knowledge to be discovered and shared. Global Support is Informa's sixth division, with major service hubs in the United Kingdom, the United States, Hong Kong, and Singapore as well as several smaller locations. As the team behind the teams, Global Support colleagues provide shared, efficient business services and function-specific expertise to each of Informa's operating divisions, enabling our commercial teams to focus on their markets and customers. Group Technology Overview Group Technology (GT) is a central technology function sitting within Informa’s Global Support division. It manages, supports and delivers technology services for all Informa divisions. Responsibilities include Architecture, Product Platform Delivery, Programme and project delivery, Infrastructure, Application support and development, Security Operations and Service Management. Under a new Group Technology leadership team, we are looking to improve maturity across all technical capabilities to help grow and thrive into the future. At the heart of that goal is the need to embark on a transformational journey to deliver a step change across our systems, culture and ways of working to support the strategic aspirations of the Group - as we pivot from being a predominantly face to face business and leverage the strength of our brands in an omnichannel and digital environment. As such, Group Technology is embarking on a clear roadmap for the modernisation of legacy services whilst developing new platforms, solutions and techniques that transform the department into an enabler of reliable, scalable and secure services that support Informa’s digital agenda and diverse customer landscape. Job Description Key responsibilities: The Business Systems Analystwill be working as part of a multi-skilled team responsible for supporting, developing and delivering the Informa Naviga Global System. Naviga is a leading e-commerce system specializing in digital ad services. Naviga is a key strategic system to increase revenue for Informa by adding new and expanding existing product lines. The role is a great opportunity for a person to gain knowledge of advertising monetization programs as well as formal IT, data analytics, and financial processes. Informa is a progressive company therefore engaging with business stakeholders in driving improvements and enhancements is a keyrequirement.. This role reports to the Naviga product owner in the Oracle Practice Team. Key Areas of Responsibility/Accountability This role will assist the product owner support and develop the Naviga e-Commerce systems. You will maintain the Naviga system to ensure it is available to meet the business needs. Produce reports ad-hoc and month end. Monitor inbound and outbound interfaces. Assist with business users with data analysis. You will be a key person in assisting with support and project tasks relating to the Naviga System and associated processes. You will also be expected to follow the controls and governance practices within Informa. You will collaborate with functional, technical teams within Informa and with Naviga Global externally. You will also be a key point of contact for business stakeholders, ensuring the system and processes meetbusiness needs. Qualifications What we’re looking for Self-motivated, innovative, and excellent communication skills. Ability to manage own time and priorities to reach goals. Able to adapt to change at short notice. Creative problem solving and analysis skills with an ability to identify develop and implement solutions to gaps to meet the needs of the business. A self-starting individual with a strong work ethic capable of planning and managing own time effectively. Ability to perform under pressure and to work using own initiative as well as part of a team. Takes personal responsibility for making things happen and achieving results. Displays motivation, commitment, perseverance, and conscientiousness. Experience Experience with Report design, creation, and delivery Proficient at MSExcel – VbScript, Macros, Pivot tables, charts, Connecting to remote data sources Experience in one of the popular coding languages: SQL, Python, C#, VBscript, JavaScript, PowerShell, etc. Driven to maintain data quality and integrity. Ability to monitor and search large data sets to find and remedy anomalies and errors. Ability to deliver data and analysis on deadline as well as day to day requests for ad-hoc data sets Desirable Experience working with or supporting sales or financial organizations. Experience supporting mission critical software applications and business process Capable of working with end users to troubleshoot and isolate problems and develop solutions Salary range is 65-80k per year Additional Information Informa is a great place to work. Hybrid working with an inclusive culture where the people come first.
summary: Informa is looking for a Business Systems Analyst to support, develop and deliver the Informa Naviga Global System, a leading e-commerce system specializing in digital ad services.  This role requires strong analytical skills, experience with reporting and data analysis, and proficiency in MS Excel and SQL.  The ideal candidate will have experience supporting sales or financial organizations and mission critical software applications.  The salary range is 65-80k per year.

title: Lead Data Analyst
description: Your opportunity We are seeking a dedicated Lead Data Analyst to join our GTM Analytics team, focusing on delivering actionable intelligence to our GTM and Product leadership. You will enhance our sales organization's analytical capabilities by leveraging vast amounts of business, user, and customer data generated by New Relic. This role involves independently leading high-impact projects, designing key performance metrics aligned with our GTM strategy, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, applying advanced data science techniques and big data technologies to deliver robust analytical solutions. Success in this role requires a strategic mindset, the ability to challenge the status quo, and strong storytelling skills to distill complex findings into practical insights. You will deliver practical insights through data visualizations and ensure that time and resources are invested wisely. Additionally, you will communicate complex analytical results clearly and compellingly to executive leadership, influencing strategic decisions and driving business impact. What you'll do Partner with GTM leaders to develop comprehensive roadmaps that empower customer-facing teams and drive results, encompassing both operational and strategic projects supported by analytics. Independently lead and drive high-impact projects that meet the needs of executive leadership, ensuring timely delivery and meaningful outcomes. Identify opportunities where data science and data-driven insights can significantly impact GTM operations, taking ownership of prioritizing and delivering these projects. Design and implement key performance metrics aligned with the company's GTM strategy, ensuring these metrics provide actionable insights. Define scalable data model requirements and collaborate closely with Data Engineering for successful implementation and maintenance. Lead the agile delivery of analytical projects, ensuring clear definition, implementation, monitoring, and communication of progress and results. Work with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, product, and engineering, to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization. Utilize a consulting mindset to provide strategic insights and recommendations, leveraging analytics to inform and influence business strategies. Apply advanced data science techniques where applicable, to enhance the depth and breadth of analyses and insights. This role requires Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field and a minimum of 10 years of relevant work experience; or Master's degree with a minimum of 8 years of experience, or PhD with a minimum of 5 years of experience in a quantitative field. Extensive experience in Sales and GTM (Go-To-Market) analytics, demonstrating a robust business acumen Prior experience leading analytics teams and projects, with a proven track record of driving business impact through data Deep expertise in end-to-end analytics processes, including building data pipelines, data modeling, generating insights, and utilizing common data science techniques Advanced proficiency in SQL and Python Significant experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, or similar platforms In-depth understanding of data science methods, including regression, classification, tree-based methods, and time series analysis Strong business intuition and curiosity about GTM operations Proven ability to drive prioritization across multiple stakeholders and influence strategic decisions Demonstrated success in independently completing projects, including the development of self-service dashboards, data reports, and ad hoc analytics capabilities Excellent project management skills, with experience in implementing, documenting, and effectively communicating with collaborators and partners during requirement gathering, data modeling, and visualization Exceptional ability to distill complex findings into actionable and clear insights Strong storytelling skills to convey data-driven narratives to a variety of audiences Bonus points if you have Experience in a consulting role, particularly within analytics or data science domains, providing strategic insights and recommendations to clients. Proficiency with advanced data science techniques, such as neural networks, natural language processing (NLP), or unsupervised learning methods. Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies. Background in data science with a track record of deploying work for impactful business outcomes. Fostering a diverse, welcoming and inclusive environment is important to us. We work hard to make everyone feel comfortable bringing their best, most authentic selves to work every day. We celebrate our talented Relics’ different backgrounds and abilities, and recognize the different paths they took to reach us – including nontraditional ones. Their experiences and perspectives inspire us to make our products and company the best they can be. We’re looking for people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application or recruiting process, please visit https://newrelic.avature.net/accommodations to submit your request. We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a flexible workforce model. This model allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid. Our hiring process Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position. In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic. We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic. New Relic is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We foster a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment, free from all types of discrimination, so our Relics can thrive. We hire people with different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Candidates are evaluated based on qualifications, regardless of race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, age, disability, neurodiversity, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other legally protected characteristics. Review our Applicant Privacy Notice at https://newrelic.com/termsandconditions/applicant-privacy-policy. Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 136,000 - $ 170,000 The pay range above represents a reasonable estimate of the salary for the listed position. This role is eligible for a corporate bonus plan. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related factors such as an applicant’s skills, qualifications, and experience. New Relic provides a variety of benefits for this role, including healthcare, dental, vision, parental leave and planning, mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, flex time-off, 11 paid holidays, volunteer time off, and other competitive benefits designed to improve the lives of our employees.
summary: New Relic seeks a Lead Data Analyst to join its GTM Analytics team, focusing on delivering actionable insights to GTM and Product leadership. This role involves leading high-impact projects, designing key performance metrics aligned with the GTM strategy, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and communicating complex analytical results to executive leadership. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Sales and GTM analytics, extensive experience leading analytics teams and projects, deep expertise in end-to-end analytics processes, and advanced proficiency in SQL and Python.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Looking for a place where you, your skills, and your contribution are valued and recognized? Somewhere you can grow not just as a professional, but also as an individual? You've come to the right place. At IT Labs, we take care of our own - and we mean it. If you love to code, can easily prioritize and analyze work, and keep one eye on the bigger picture and business needs - then you're the Senior Data Engineer we're looking for. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of maximizing the value of extensive data. The API platform processes billions in payments monthly for millions of users. You'll play a key role in helping our client make well-informed decisions using this data. Your responsibilities will include crafting and executing a technical vision for state-of-the-art AWS-based data pipelines. You'll also support new product developments and data science initiatives while ensuring systems maintain optimal performance levels. Proficiency in infrastructure-as-code and CI/CD systems (such as Terraform, Troposphere, CloudFormation, Jenkins), along with experience in administering Microsoft SQL Server (especially in high-availability setups), is highly desirable for this position, as these are key aspects of the role. You will spend around 50% of your time building and enhancing data lakes and data pipelines, and about 20% on defining and implementing DataOps methodologies. Additionally, 20% of your time will be dedicated to writing and optimizing queries and reports. Finally, you'll spend roughly 10% of your time supporting and monitoring existing databases. Requirements At least 7 years in a Data Engineering position, Expert knowledge in .Python Proven experience with AWS technologies for building and managing data pipelines and performing ETL processes Proficient in using AWS warehousing and analysis tools like Redshift, Quicksight, and Athena Skilled in utilizing infrastructure-as-code practices, including CloudFormation, CDK, and Serverless frameworks Expertise in designing and reviewing complex Python programs, ensuring compliance with style and security standards Demonstrated ability to optimize SQL queries for maximum performance Hands-on experience with AWS RDS Ability to empathize with end-users to inform and guide decision-making processes Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities Superior written and verbal communication skills Practical Details: 1099 Contract is offered The position is 100% remote within the US 12 months duration US based is a must Benefits We are a collaborative, supportive, and diverse bunch of people, who enjoy working together and treat each other with the utmost respect. Here everyone has the opportunity to share their experience, learn, and grow. Our values We are a company that seeks the best for both our employees and clients, reaching beyond expectations in turning dreams into reality. Our way of working is rooted in our core values (Integrity, Excellence, Proactivity, Innovation, and People), with an expectation that our future colleagues will make these their second nature in their everyday work and life. We don't ask for perfection, but we do appreciate people motivated to better themselves in every conceivable aspect. About IT Labs Founded in 2005, IT Labs is an international software tech company, specializing in purpose and process-driven teams for high-performance, innovation, transformation, and efficiency. Our HQ is in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, and we have teams and offices around the world - the UK, the Netherlands, Belarus, Serbia, and North Macedonia. We are constantly growing, and we would love for you to become part of our team!
summary: Senior Data Engineer position at IT Labs, a software tech company, working remotely on a 12-month contract, building and enhancing data lakes and pipelines on AWS, utilizing technologies like Redshift, Quicksight, Athena, CloudFormation, CDK, and Serverless frameworks. The role involves defining and implementing DataOps methodologies, writing and optimizing queries and reports, and supporting existing databases. Requires at least 7 years of experience in data engineering, expertise in Python, and hands-on experience with AWS RDS.

title: Vendor Master Data Analyst
description: Company Description AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Job Description The Vendor Master Data Analyst, as part of the Finance Shared Services organization, is responsible for governance and maintenance of Vendor master data, globally, for the organization. The Analyst will work with business requestors and various process owners to maintain proper, up-to-date, information on vendor master per Abbvie data standards. This role will ensure compliance with the process within established SLA’s and adherence to established practices, procedures, and policies. Responsibilities: Collaborate with Procurement, Accounts Payable, Treasury and business users to ensure proper and authenticated vendors are onboarded and maintained. Verify documentation received for onboarding new vendors and updates to existing vendor master data. Prepare documentation and work instructions for any process improvements relating to any of the vendor maintenance systems like Ariba, DSP and SAP. Support additional functions within the Vendor master data team. Address any queries from business requestors in relation to vendor master data. Respond to escalation requests from business users. Provide strict adherence to Abbvie processes and established SLAs for the process. Knowledge/Experience of S4 SAP system with Vendor master and PTP processes required. Knowledge/Experience of SAP Ariba and DSP systems is preferred. Experience in Project management skills is required. Excellent teamwork, interpersonal, communication, organization, and decision-making skills. Good time management with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Should be flexible to work in multiple time zones as needed. Significant Work Activities -Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day) Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Required. (Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting preferred) 4+ years of experience within Master Data or Finance/Accounting experience. Strong communication skills and customer support. Proficient Excel skills required. Additional Information Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. Note: No amount of pay is a considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
summary: This role is for a Vendor Master Data Analyst who will be responsible for managing and maintaining vendor master data globally for AbbVie. The analyst will collaborate with various teams, including Procurement, Accounts Payable, Treasury, and business users, to ensure accurate and up-to-date vendor information. This position requires strong communication, organizational, and decision-making skills, along with experience in SAP S4, Ariba, and DSP systems. The analyst will work with business requestors to address queries and escalations related to vendor master data.

To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.” The actual salary an employee can expect to receive, plus bonus pursuant to the terms of any bonus plan if applicable, will depend on experience, seniority, geographic location, and other factors permitted by law. Experience using time management skills such as prioritizing/organizing and tracking details and meeting deadlines of multiple projects with varying completion dates. Master’s Degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Engineering, Economics, or Finance. Experience with project management (for example: planning, organizing, and managing resources to bring about the successful completion of specific project goals and objectives). Experience establishing and maintaining relationships with individuals in the organization, in the business community and with vendors. Knowledge of the link between analysis and business impact. Experience developing presentations for various audience levels within an organization.

title: Quantitative Researcher
description: Quant Researcher - Systematic Futures HFT - $750K to $1m Hiring an experienced Quant Researcher. This individual will be instrumental in developing and refining high-frequency trading algorithms, bringing experience and a deep understanding of quantitative modelling, data analysis, and the intricacies of futures markets. Core Responsibilities: Design and tune high-frequency trading algorithms for futures markets, focusing on nanosecond decision tick to trade. Identify new signals and implement rigorous back-testing protocols to evaluate strategy performance under a variety of market conditions. Continuously test and refine algorithms in production to fine-tune strategies, ensuring they are robust against market volatility Work closely with technology and engineering teams to improve the trading infrastructure, focusing on low-latency data processing and execution capabilities. Desired Expertise : Extensive experience in HFT, particularly within futures markets, evidenced by a track record of developing and implementing successful, innovative trading strategies. Exceptional programming skills in Python and C++ Expertise in using statistical analysis and machine learning to drive high-frequency trading decisions. Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science, with a Ph.D. highly preferred.
