Consults with business functional areas to develop understanding of the varied and complex business needs supported by the system(s). Responsible for determining how changing business needs will affect the system(s). Understands the role of the system in the big picture and provides ideas and recommendations regarding the evolution of the system(s). Responds to questions and influences the users regarding current and potential system inputs, processes, and outputs. Conducts research and analysis into evolutions of the systems supporting business processes. Develops detailed business user requirements, system documentation, workflow procedures, and data modeling. Negotiates plans, time frames and trade-offs while ensuring client understands the final results of the project. Reviews and routes requested system changes and develops detailed specifications for implementation. Ensures current and accurate system documentation, coordinates and or performs testing of system modifications, both validated and non-validated systems. Provides systems expertise and supports system training, educational tools and materials. Partners with appropriate support personnel related to data integrity checks and controls of the systems. Helps drive internal BTS processes related to demand/release management and SDLC. Systems implemented must meet projected timelines and customer expectations. Tools and skills you will use in this role: Microsoft Office Suite, including Visio or similar tool. Strong communication skills and ability to present on topics using Power Point or similar tools. Experience gathering business requirements and drafting business workflows. Qualifications Experiences that make you a strong fit for this role: Required Bachelor's degree and 2 years experience or Master's degree in Information Systems or related field is required. Excellent interpersonal skills and well-developed verbal and written communication skills. A passion for learning and personal growth. Must be deliverables focused and detail oriented. Must exhibit exceptional teamwork skills. Must have a strong customer focus. Beneficial: Experience in Good Clinical Practices (GCP) Software Lifecycle Development Cycle for developing, implementing and supporting multi-national information technology platforms is preferred but not required. Experience with Power BI, Qlik or other analytical tools Experience with SQL Why Business Technology Solutions For anyone who wants to use technology and data to make a difference in people’s lives, shape the digital transformation of a leading biopharmaceutical company, and secure sustainable career growth within a diverse, global team: we’re ready for you. Additional Information Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law: The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. Note: No amount of pay is a considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law. AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
summary: AbbVie seeks a Business System Analyst to develop, maintain, and enhance business applications for R&D Operations and Finance. This role involves collaborating with business teams to understand their needs, analyze processes, and implement system improvements for efficiency. Responsibilities include gathering requirements, creating documentation, testing system modifications, and providing training. Ideal candidates possess a Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or related field with 2 years of experience, strong communication skills, a passion for learning, and a focus on delivering high-quality results.

title: Technical Business Systems Analyst
description: Job Title: Technical Business Systems Analyst Location: Chicago, IL Hybrid Duration: 10+ Months Job Description The client is delighted to be making a significant investment in their Salesforce capabilities. We have an exciting and challenging opportunity for an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst. This Business Analyst will be assigned to work directly with Salesforce Product Owners and Business Partners to translate business requirements into technical requirements to maximize the value of the Salesforce product and bring business initiatives to life. You will be working directly with business stakeholders to develop solutions that have a direct impact on the business objectives. Typical Day The client is looking for a team member who is energized by learning about the business and business applications within the Salesforce platform. We need somebody who wants to jump in to get the job done and lead, when necessary. This role will have primary responsibility for creating, analyzing, and validating business requirements, translating them into detailed functional requirements and user stories, and defining acceptance criteria and test cases. The incumbent will be responsible for creating user stories, defining dependencies, impacts and acceptance criteria, and obtaining requirements sign-off from requesting business partners. Translate Business Requirements to Technical Requirements. Document and validate business requirements for an application or process. Work closely with business partners and other key stockholders for clarity on requirements, gather and understand technical problems to identify solutions. Proactively seek input from relevant areas of the business that should have inputs to this application or process. Influence Solution Design Solution discovery to provide technical guidance and assist in solution design options to Super Users, Product Owners and Business Owners. Develops solution for major system modules, programs or infrastructure released based on requirements gathered from the business. Configuration or customization expertise in Salesforce Validate solution design, including prototyping and configuration for an application or process Assist customers with usability in solution design. Establish security data classifications for the application or process. Establish and document business rules for the use of an application or process. Development Leadership Represent the customer and customer experience, interfacing and engaging with the customer Responsible for conveying the vision and goals at the beginning and throughout the sprint Lead developers and quality assurance resources throughout the build cycle, clearing any doubts about the solution, addressing ambiguity and providing direction. Create and groom user stories and communicate backlog priorities to the team Assists with the elaboration of epics, themes and features into user stories that are small enough, or granular enough, to be achieved in a single sprint Competent to perform programming, development, integration and system administration assignments Participate in sprint planning meetings, daily meetings, scrum reveals and retrospectives Inspect the product progress at the end of every sprint and accept or reject the work that has been done by the development team Provides Salesforce system administration leadership, guidance, and assistance to other team members. Testing and Training for Application Develop, review and approve test plans as required by new content releases or deployments for an application or process. Conducts customer acceptance testing, from both a technical and business perspective, and coordinates testing with additional business users Review and approve end user training materials and documentation for an application or process. Act as “Face” of the Application Represent the application or process with other areas of the business who use or integrate with this part of the business. Business escalations point for any conflicts or concerns with the application or process. Responsible for working on and driving complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift support calls. Position is remote (hybrid) in either Peoria or Chicago. Technical Skills Required (Required) 4+ years professional experience - Business Analyst 2+ years’ developing, supporting and managing Salesforce development requirements - for Sales and/or Service Cloud 1+ years of experience with the Agile methodology Experience in developing business processes, working in matrix organization, leading projects is highly beneficial. Preferred: Salesforce Certification(s) such as: * Certified Administrator * Certified Advanced Administrator * Certified Experience Cloud Consultant * Certified Sales Cloud Consultant * Certified Service Cloud Consultant Soft Skills Required Demonstrated ability to proactively lead and empower teams, communicating appropriately to ensure a team’s success Strong accountability, planning, organization Highly developed interpersonal skills to deal with sensitive, emotional or potentially controversial situations. Excellent oral and written communication skills Excellent communication and influential skills Experience working with onshore/offshore team model Works well/collaborates well with others Education Requirements This position requires an accredited, four-year Marketing, Business, or Technology degree, a closely related technical degree, or equivalent experience. plus 5+ overall years professional exp Master’s degree with 3+ years overall professional experience Associates degree/ No degree they will need at a minimum 7+ years of relevant experience. Thanks & Regards, Abdul Aziz – Sr Sales Executive Recruiter CENTSTONE SERVICES Email : abdul.aziz@centstone.com Phone: 332-456-5886 LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/abdul-aziz-70322/overlay/contact-info/ Address: 3400 State Route 35, Suite 9B, Hazlet, New Jersey, 07730 USA
summary: The client is seeking an experienced Salesforce Business Analyst with 4+ years of professional experience to translate business requirements into technical specifications and lead development efforts for their Salesforce platform. This role requires strong communication, collaboration, and leadership skills to work with stakeholders, developers, and quality assurance teams. The ideal candidate will have experience with Agile methodology, Salesforce development (Sales and/or Service Cloud), and preferably hold Salesforce certifications.

title: HR Data Analysis Specialist
description: Summary Are you an experienced HRIS Reporting Analyst with a strong background in Workday HRIS Administration? We are looking for a detail-oriented professional to join our team and provide valuable insights through data analysis and reporting. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in HR, IT, Business, or a related field. 3-5 years of experience in reporting, data analysis, and modeling with Workday or similar HCM platforms. 3+ years of Workday HRIS Administrator experience. Proficiency in Workday reporting and Tableau. Basic understanding of Workday security. Responsibilities Collect and compile HR metrics from various sources, including Workday, employee surveys, exit interviews, and government labor statistics. Generate report queries in Workday to address ad-hoc reporting requests. Provide recommendations based on data analysis to enhance HR policies and practices. Maintain HR Dashboard in PowerBi to track and present key HR metrics. Analyze recruitment trends, turnover rates, and compliance issues. Collaborate with HR and compensation teams to optimize job roles and compensation structures. Interpret survey results and propose initiatives for improvement. Conduct classification audits to ensure job classifications align with regulations. Uphold data privacy regulations and best practices. If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive HR initiatives and have a solid background in HR analytics, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in making a positive impact on our organization through valuable data insights. Employment Type: Full-Time
summary: We are seeking an experienced HRIS Reporting Analyst with a strong background in Workday HRIS Administration to join our team and provide valuable insights through data analysis and reporting. This role involves collecting and compiling HR metrics, generating reports, providing recommendations based on data analysis, maintaining HR dashboards, analyzing recruitment trends, and collaborating with HR and compensation teams.

title: Senior Associate Data Analytics
description: Publicis Client Level & Job Title : Senior Associate Data Analytics (depending on how this goes, team is open to reviewing Managers) Type of Job : New Contracting Role Req # to submit to : EnrichPlusP240301210045 Client : Pharmaceutical Openings : 3 Rate : $60 Project Overview : Our client is looking to standardize, scale, and better understand the connections of paid media and creatives to their digital properties. Furthermore, the client is looking for web analytics and insights that can help provide user behaviors to identify high-value actions and challenges in the web conversion path and provide recommendations that optimize user journeys to meet critical website KPIs Top Skills Required Relevant experience analyzing large data-sets using Adobe Analytics Validating cross-channel customer journeys & identifying opportunities in the data Drive actionable insights that adds lift to bottom line or HVA's Industry Experience : Experience working with Pharma datasets (it's not a mandate but preferred) Expected Start Date : ASAP End Date : 6 month contract from start date extension to 31-Dec-2024 Location : Candidates can work anywhere closest to PS officelocations attached. Onsite/Remote : Expected to be onsite at the Publicis Client office 2-3 days per week in 2024. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients' businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value. Your Impact You will function as part of a world class Data Analytics team working directly with retail clients in NA & Canada. The role will focus on supporting data collection, reporting and experimentation practices of the client to drive incremental project initiatives through thought leadership. Must Have Skills Leads initiatives focused on analytics implementation, customization, and automation of data collection processes. Develops cohesive measurement strategies and planning that ensures data collection aligns to client's priorities. Recommends processes for integrating platforms ensuring free flow data between systems. Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for big retail client's having complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.) Hands-on experience working with Adobe Data Collection and integration with AEP using WebSDK. Ability to troubleshoot scripting issues on the digital platforms using browser's console and other tools is a must Participate in clients' QA and deployment processes (Agile methodology, etc.). Hands-on experience with one or more web analytics tools such as Omniture SiteCatalyst and debugging tools like Charles, HTTPWatch or WASP Thorough knowledge of Analytics Workspace, reporting and admin console in Adobe Analytics. Must be comfortable with advanced segmentation capabilities within Adobe/Google Analytics. Good to Have Skills: Experience with implementing AEP (Adobe Experience Platform) Experience with implementing CJA (Customer Journey Analytics) Experience with implementing GA4 (Google Analytics 4) Develop, design, and implement scripting for A/B optimization/experimentation (Adobe Target, Monetate, Optimizely) Configuring and setting up BI dashboards (Tableau / Looker / Power BI) Experience with Google Big Query and creating data ingestion pipelines from multiple online and offline sources Experience working with Adobe IO (using APIs to connect to Adobe suite of products programmatically like Adobe Analytics 2.0) through Web UI's (like Swagger) or API clients like Postman Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related course of study required or equivalent work experience. Related Master's Degree a plus 5+ years working in analytics, including experience working with tag management systems implementing advertising and tracking pixels, 3+ years digital analytics development experience, 1+ year managing a team of analysts / developers Excellent understanding of JavaScript, HTML, jQuery, JSON, and DOM manipulation, strong tag management skills, excellent understanding of cloud-based information systems, solid debugging and troubleshooting skills, strong understanding of marketing technology (Martech) landscape, experience leveraging APIs for reporting automation. Foundational Knowledge of Google Big Query, Node.js, CSS, Python, Domo, machine learning concepts.
summary: This role is for a Senior Associate Data Analytics at Publicis, focusing on standardizing, scaling, and understanding paid media and creative connections to digital properties for a pharmaceutical client. The position involves analyzing large datasets, validating cross-channel customer journeys, driving actionable insights, and optimizing user journeys to meet website KPIs. This is a 6-month contract with the potential for extension to December 2024, requiring 2-3 days per week onsite at a Publicis office location.

You'll play a pivotal role in guiding our BI team, a group of experts who partner with clients as consultants, data specialists, and trusted advisors. In This High-impact, Remote Position, You'll Be Responsible For Leading a high-performing team: Foster a collaborative and data-driven culture, manage talent development, and ensure client satisfaction through exceptional service. Driving strategic initiatives: Develop and implement a roadmap for BI transformation, aligning data efforts with the organization's overall strategy. Empowering data-driven decision making: Translate complex data sets into actionable insights that fuel business growth and profitability. You'll Be a Great Fit If You Have Extensive BI experience: 10+ years in BI leadership roles, with a proven track record of success. Strategic mindset: The ability to translate data insights into actionable strategies that drive growth. Leadership expertise: Experience building, motivating, and inspiring high-performing teams. Technical proficiency: Solid understanding of data governance, management, analysis, and visualization. We Offer a Work Environment That Fosters Flexibility: Remote work with the ability to manage your schedule. Learning & Development: Access to comprehensive learning and development resources. Requires 10+ years of BI leadership experience, strategic mindset, leadership expertise, technical proficiency in data governance, management, analysis, and visualization, and exceptional communication skills.

title: Business Intelligence Technical Analyst- AITS (Hybrid/Remote)
description: AITS Admin Job Summary The purpose of the Business Intelligence Technical Analyst is to provide support for the business intelligence (BI) architecture of Decision Support including the technical infrastructure of the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), BI applications, and related systems environment. This position maintains BI systems, operational reliability, capacity planning, disaster recovery mechanisms, and plans for future BI delivery. Duties & Responsibilities Administer applications providing Business Intelligence (BI) services, Data Movement services, Data Science services and Data Virtualization services. This responsibility involves design and configuration of the software, overall management of the application and working with staff involved in daily operations with the software. This also includes supporting research and evaluation activities related to new technologies to support data storage, analytics, and business intelligence. (30%) Design, manage, and monitor security design processes related to the security of Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence security. Provision security access as requested in compliance of operational procedures. Monitor security operations to ensure compliance with existing university and departmental security policies. Monitor security implementation to ensure continued compliance with intended access plans. Review university policies and guidelines to ensure that Decision Support security policies and procedures remain in compliance through partnership with the AITS Enterprise Systems Assurance team. Recommend changes or new policies as appropriate. (30%) Provide operational support for university-wide systems used by students, employees, and university clients. Work with IT professionals across the University of Illinois to provide core systems integration and operational services. Participate in On-Call rotation to support operational systems. (20%) Miscellaneous duties including (20%): Conduct research to identify opportunities for improving the BI Architecture and Decision Support product delivery focusing on new industry products, new features to existing products and industry trends with BI and data warehousing techniques. Identify methods to collect operational metrics in support of the following: measurement of return on investment; usage analysis; and security analysis. Analyze systems and processes to identify opportunities for increased efficiency and efficacy. Serve as principal analyst for BI Environment Management activities: Collaborate closely with the Project Management team to schedule Development, QA, and Dress Rehearsal environments; Coordinate with the AITS Database Administration team to create or refresh database environments; Design, manage, and monitor implementation processes related to testing, security, risk analysis, and quality assurance for ongoing Data Warehouse new releases; Collaborate with the DS Information Delivery team to support security and changes to existing structures during project implementation phases; Perform risk analysis, provide statistics, and report findings to the AITS Leadership Team. Serve as subject matter expert on enterprise infrastructure components and middleware. Monitor production, test, QA, and development Business Intelligence environments. Escalate issues to the appropriate team. This includes the data warehouse and BI technology environments; Capacity planning for Business Intelligence Architecture and Decision Support products; Back-up and disaster recovery plans, procedure testing, and implementation for Business Intelligence Architecture; Business Intelligence Architecture documentation and standards; Defining and implementing Business Intelligence Architecture standards for the Decision Support environment. Participate in committees and projects for AITS (e.g., service improvement initiatives) and/or partner organizations (e.g., Technology Services, ITS and ACCC) to meet enterprise objectives. As needed, serve as a backup resource for the Assistant Director, Business Intelligence Architecture and other members of the Business Intelligence Architecture team. Other related responsibilities as appropriate for a BI Technical Analyst Minimum Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent. Any one or any combination totaling two (2) years (24 months) from the following categories: College coursework which includes Information Technology (IT), IT Management, Programming, IT systems, or a closely related discipline, as measured by the following conversion table or its proportional equivalent: 30 semester hours equals one (1) year (12 months) Associate’s Degree (60 semester hours) equals eighteen months (18 months) 90 semester hours equals two (2) years (24 months) Bachelor’s Degree (120 semester hours) equals three (3) years (36 months) Work experience in IT-related functions, such as hardware/software support, programming, network design, network engineering, IT systems integration, or closely related field. Preferred Qualifications Preferred Education Bachelor's/Master's degree in relevant area (computer science, mathematics, statistics, engineering, etc.) Preferred Experience Two years of experience with relevant platforms (Windows Server, Linux and Oracle). Two years of experience with software application management. Two years of experience with large applications or systems. One year of experience creating and maintaining standardized procedures. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Knowledge of or ability to develop and understand security structures and hierarchies. Knowledge of or ability to develop and understand analytic queries. Knowledge of workstation and server security mechanisms. Knowledge of data management and administration, such as in data warehousing or data virtualization Knowledge in various business intelligence technologies (e.g., Business Objects, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Data Mining, Dashboards). Knowledge of data virtualization technologies (e.g., Denodo, Informatica Data Virtualization, SAP HANA Cloud, CData). Knowledge of Data Movement/ETL technologies tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend, AWS Data Migration, Skyvia, Fivetran, Stitch). Knowledge of cloud-hosted technologies, such as in data storage or business intelligence. Knowledge of managing technology projects and standard project management techniques. Knowledge of creating and implementing security plans. Knowledge of large, multi-project implementations. Appointment Information This is a 100% full-time Civil Service 5031 - Information Technology Technical Associate position, appointed on a 12-month basis. The expected start date is as soon as possible. The minimum salary for this position is $75,000 and the salary is commensurate with experience and qualifications. Sponsorship for Work authorization is not available for this position. For more information on Civil Service classifications, please visit the SUCSS web site at https://www.sucss.illinois.gov/pages/classspec/default.aspx . Application Procedures & Deadline Information Applications must be received by 6:00 pm (Central Time) on July 12, 2024. Apply for this position using the Apply Now button at the top or bottom of this posting. In order to be considered as a transfer candidate, you must apply for this position. Applications not submitted through https://jobs.illinois.edu will not be considered. If required by the position, transcripts or other documentation of credentials are to be provided no later than the first day of employment. For further information about this specific position, please contact Amanda Bubonic at abubo2@uillinois.edu. For questions regarding the application process, please contact 217-333-2137. The University of Illinois System is an equal opportunity employer, including but not limited to disability and/or veteran status, and complies with all applicable state and federal employment mandates. Please visit Required Employment Notices and Posters to view our non-discrimination statement and find additional information about required background checks, sexual harassment/misconduct disclosures, and employment eligibility review through E-Verify . Applicants with disabilities are encouraged to apply and may request a reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act (2008) to complete the application and/or interview process. Requests may be submitted through the reasonable accommodations portal , or by contacting the Accessibility & Accommodations Division of the Office for Access and Equity at 217-333-0885, or by emailing accessibility@illinois.edu . title: Analyst, Marketing Intelligence
description: About Annalect Annalect is the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group Annalect’s 2,000+ innovators leverage data and technology to help clients across Omnicom build relationships that matter — whether that means fostering consumers’ trust in brands, building new experiences, or delivering advanced analytics where it’s most needed. Annalect is the driving force behind Omni, Omnicom’s unique open operating system, which works hand-in-hand with clients’ and partners’ data and tools, to orchestrate better marketing outcomes. Annalect’s unique approach to data and technology – one that relies on transparency, neutrality, and interoperability – allows us to deliver purpose-built and scalable solutions that make data actionable. Our advanced teams of product leaders, data scientists, consultants, and engineers enable us to meet the business goals of our internal and external clients. Team Overview The Marketing Intelligence team is charged with evolving Omnicom’s campaign reporting capability and leading the transition of delivering campaign reporting through Omni, Omnicom’s marketing insights and data platform. We work in tandem and in support of the agency leads to ensure success but allow for agency customizations and ownership as needed. The Marketing Intelligence function is part of the Marketing Operations business unit within Annalect. Marketing Operations operates with one common theme that is consistent with Annalect’s overall strategy, which is to enable agencies to be able to deliver upon data-driven outcomes by providing best-in-class solutions. Unified under one organization this function contributes towards driving growth, and resource and process optimization across our agency partners which are core parts of Annalect’s strategic priorities. Position Overview With the introduction of Omni, Omnicom is centralizing its capabilities around provisioning data to the organization to make better, faster, and smarter decisions about their clients’ campaigns. The Marketing Intelligence function has been created to lead the charge in this regard, including development of new campaign reporting solutions, and leading the migration of campaign reporting to be delivered through Omni. This position is accountable for supporting Omnicom’s campaign reporting capability and helping to deliver the transition of campaign reporting through Omni. The role will work, alongside more senior Marketing Intelligence staff, in support of the agency leads to ensure success. Areas the incumbent will support within Marketing Intelligence include: Tech Stack Evaluation – ongoing recommendations of standard tools and technology, define process for including new tools Taxonomy & Naming Conventions – define standard taxonomy best practices and roll out client or account naming conventions Scoping & Pricing – templatize and customize new requests for profitable, realistic and efficient scoping Account support – expert client specific advice & guidance, access to flex support where required and aligned Best practices & training – create and disseminate best practices related to all of the above for standardization and time savings Key Responsibilities Deliver on campaign and marketing intelligence reporting deliverables while acting as a champion of data quality, including: Generating reports and manipulating reporting data, as needed Quality Assurance of data and reports Create and assist with documentation Support the Campaign Reporting Capability Development process, including owning or assisting with governance of taxonomy and tracking guidelines Support media, website, and cross-agency data aggregations as well as building and maintaining data automation systems, for example Datorama, AWS, and Tableau Support the organization in marketing intelligence capabilities, including data visualization; campaign dashboarding, reporting, and data services Required Skills And Qualifications 1 - 2 years’ experience in digital and campaign reporting Ability to work in an agile manner in a rapidly changing requirements environment Global and cross-functional team and partnership experience in complex, matrixed organizations Familiarity with BI technologies such as Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Alteryx, and Datorama Analytical mind with problem solving capabilities and aptitude Familiarity or exposure to marketing and ad technology data Excellent communications skills, with experience communicating across groups with varying degrees of technical background Analytical, evaluative, and likes to solve problems Experience with ad technology product development is a huge plus Perks of working at Annalect Culture! We have an incredibly fun, collaborative environment that encourages engagement and work/life balance Generous PTO that includes vacation days, personal days, a fantastic Summer Friday program and extended time off around the holiday season. As part of Omnicom, we have the backing and resources of a global billion-dollar company, but also have the flexibility and pace of a “startup” - we move fast, break things, and innovate. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation days, sick days, personal days, paid parental leave, paid medical leave, and STD/LTD insurance benefits. Compensation Range $49,000—$70,000 USD Annalect, a division of Omnicom Media Group is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class. Review Our Recruitment Privacy Notice
summary: Annalect, the Data & Technology arm of Omnicom Media Group, is seeking a Marketing Intelligence Analyst to support the development and delivery of campaign reporting through Omni, their marketing insights and data platform. The role involves evaluating tech stacks, defining taxonomy and naming conventions, scoping and pricing new requests, providing client support, and creating best practices and training materials. The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years of experience in digital and campaign reporting, be familiar with BI technologies such as Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Alteryx, and Datorama, and have strong analytical and communication skills.

title: Kodiak Senior Data Analyst - Revenue Cycle Intelligence
description: Your Journey at Crowe Starts Here: At Crowe, you have the opportunity to deliver innovative solutions to today’s complex business issues. Crowe’s accounting, consulting, and technology personnel are widely recognized for their in-depth expertise and understanding of sophisticated process frameworks and enabling technologies, along with their commitment to delivering measurable results that help clients build business value. Our focus on emerging technology solutions along with our commitment to internal career growth and exceptional client value has resulted in a firm that is routinely recognized as a “Best Place to Work.” We are 75 years strong and still growing. Come grow with us! Job Description: Our mission is to simplify complex business problems through technology, data, and industry expertise. At Kodiak, we’re proud to stand out in the industry as a technology company powered by data and unparalleled expertise. For nearly 20 years, Kodiak (formerly part of Crowe LLP) has worked with health system finance leaders to identify clear paths forward in building stronger, more financially sustainable, and efficient organizations. Our team collaborates with leaders at 40% of the country’s healthcare systems, especially those working in net revenue, revenue cycle, risk, and compliance. With a commitment to the well-being of patients and our shared communities, we pride ourselves on creating long-term value for our customers at every touchpoint. Job Summary: This position will be responsible for day-to-day work tasks for revenue cycle data analytics projects and utilize technical and interpersonal skills to assist internal and external clients. Using Kodiak’s technology and data, you will provide high-quality analysis and process improvement solutions that enhance our client's revenue cycle. You will have the opportunity to work closely with all levels of client management and play a significant role in ensuring accurate and insightful data quality in our engagements. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, or Bachelor of Science degree is required (an MBA, MHA, and/or MPH is a plus). Proficiency in compiling and analyzing large, complex datasets with accuracy using SQL is required. Strong experience with data visualization tools is necessary, Power BI is a plus. Relevant, in-depth revenue cycle experience is required. Intermediate to Advanced Excel skills required. Ability to translate data insights into slide decks and dashboards highlighting key stories. 3+ years of experience working in professional services and/or consulting. Strong financial, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate complex technical concepts and business impacts to diverse audiences, including executives and stakeholders. Highly organized, flexible, and adaptable with strong time management skills. Must have a strong attention to detail and ability to work both independently and collaborate with others in a team-oriented environment. Prior experience should include progressive responsibilities, including supervising and reviewing the work of others, and competence to own projects and processes, including managing simultaneous work-streams and responsibilities and the ability and mindset to improve existing processes. Ability to multi-task and work both independently and within internal teams and customers. Experience in system analysis, design, building, testing, and implementation is preferred. We expect the candidate to uphold Crowe’s values of Care, Trust, Courage, and Stewardship. These values define who we are. We expect all of our people to act ethically and with integrity at all times. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Crowe, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $70,000.00 to $147,767.00 per year. Our Benefits: At Crowe, we know that great people are what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you! How You Can Grow: We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper! More about Crowe: Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world. Crowe LLP provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Crowe LLP does not accept unsolicited candidates, referrals or resumes from any staffing agency, recruiting service, sourcing entity or any other third-party paid service at any time. Any referrals, resumes or candidates submitted to Crowe, or any employee or owner of Crowe without a pre-existing agreement signed by both parties covering the submission will be considered the property of Crowe, and free of charge.
summary: This role focuses on revenue cycle data analytics for healthcare systems.  The analyst will utilize technical and interpersonal skills to provide high-quality analysis, process improvement solutions, and data insights for clients. This role requires strong SQL, data visualization, and revenue cycle experience.

title: System Analyst MDM - Decatur, IL
description: Archer Daniels Midland (ADM) has embarked on a Digital transformation. We are moving to SAP and need your help to get us there! Want to use your technical skills and love of process to bring this new capability to ADM? Check out this opportunity! Position Summary As a part of our transformation, we know that data is at the center of everything that we do. We seek a dedicated professional to help take us to the next level of our Master Data Management (MDM) journey. We depend on our Systems Analysts to investigate data, seeking opportunities to reduce duplicates, improve the quality and discover anomalies that may exist, and then create the specifications and designs that will allow us to develop intuitive solutions. Job Responsibilities Provide deep functional & technical expertise for applications & products supporting one or more process areas Partner with Process Analyst(s) to participate in the preliminary investigation for project solutions requests, requirements gathering, collecting data from a variety of sources, evaluating and interpreting data, and drawing conclusions on solution options Provide input into system fit/gap analysis and design decisions Write detailed functional and technical designs for reports, interfaces, conversions, enhancements, forms, and/or workflows, partnering with development teams as needed Work with Process Analyst(s) to identify system configuration needs and perform system configuration as needed Ensure solution compatibility with documented architecture, security, and data standards Collaborate with other IT delivery teams to ensure efficient and effective design, development and implementation of end-to-end solutions Follow standard processes to create and maintain solutions documentation for projects, enhancements, and support requests. Provide technical input for role-based security designs and solutions Share knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to improve efficiency and effectiveness within the respective process area Work with the Solution Leader and Process Analyst to support the development, maintenance, and communication of solutions roadmap for application(s) that service the business process Provide regular and accurate status updates and other documentation to management and team members for assigned project, support, and improvement work Mentor and monitor progress of junior level personnel on complex projects as needed Provide technical expertise required to resolve escalated issues Provide leadership to others through example and sharing of knowledge/skill Job Requirements: Proven analytical, organization, time management, facilitation, and process management skills Works well both in a team environment and independently Strong analytical, organization, time management, facilitation, and process management skills Communicates clearly ideas and findings with team members using Microsoft Word and PowerPoint Uses Excel skillfully to demonstrate technical and non-technical information, ideas, procedures, and processes Maintain calm in a fast-paced, changing environment, and with all levels of the organization and cope with constantly evolving information Ability to evaluate and manage priorities while adapting to individual and team assignments as adjustments are needed Maintains a positive work environment through collaboration & conflict resolution Desired Skills: Knowledge of how current trends and process solutions can address identified business needs and capabilities Prior experience in an SAP and/or Informatica driven environment Ability to use SQL to analyze data Excited about this role but don’t meet every requirement listed? Studies show that often applicants will self-select out if they don’t check every box. We encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this role or another one of our openings. ADM requires the successful completion of a background check. REF:87606BR Benefits And Perks Enriching the quality of life for the world begins by taking care of our colleagues. In addition to competitive pay, we support your diverse needs with a comprehensive total rewards package to enhance your well-being, including: Physical wellness – medical/Rx, dental, vision and on-site wellness center access or gym reimbursement (as applicable). Financial wellness – flexible spending accounts, health savings account, 401(k) with matching contributions and cash balance plan, discounted employee stock purchasing program, life insurance, disability, workers’ compensation, legal assistance, identity theft protection. Mental and social wellness – Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and Colleague Giving Programs (ADM Cares). Additional Benefits Include Paid time off including paid holidays. Adoption assistance and paid maternity and parental leave. Tuition assistance. Company-sponsored training and development resources, such as LinkedIn Learning, language training and mentoring programs. *Benefits may vary for bargained locations, confirm benefit eligibility with your recruiter. #IncludingYou Diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging are cornerstones of ADM’s efforts to continue innovating, driving growth, and delivering outstanding performance. We are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce and create welcoming, truly inclusive work environments — environments that enable every ADM colleague to feel comfortable on the job, make meaningful contributions to our success, and grow their career. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that each person can bring to ADM because we know that diversity of perspectives makes us better, together. We are committed to ensuring all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, ethnicity, disability, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, sexual orientation, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in our industry, as we strive to ensure our workforce represents the world that we help to feed: people of color, women, gender non-conforming, LGBTQIA+, veterans and persons with disabilities. For more information regarding our efforts to advance Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging, please visit our website here: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion | ADM. About ADM At ADM, we unlock the power of nature to provide access to nutrition worldwide. With industry-advancing innovations, a complete portfolio of ingredients and solutions to meet any taste, and a commitment to sustainability, we give customers an edge in solving the nutritional challenges of today and tomorrow. We’re a global leader in human and animal nutrition and the world’s premier agricultural origination and processing company. Our breadth, depth, insights, facilities and logistical expertise give us unparalleled capabilities to meet needs for food, beverages, health and wellness, and more. From the seed of the idea to the outcome of the solution, we enrich the quality of life the world over. Learn more at www.adm.com. Req/Job ID 87606BR
summary: ADM is seeking a Systems Analyst with expertise in Master Data Management (MDM) to contribute to their digital transformation journey, specifically migrating to SAP. The role involves investigating data, reducing duplicates, improving quality, and creating specifications and designs for MDM solutions.

title: Senior Financial Analyst, Data Assurance
description: Job Description Here at Kraft Heinz, we grow our people to grow our business, because we believe that great people make great companies. When you join our table, you can expect access to an array of holistic wellness benefits* and perks, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 7% 401(k) matching, Business Resource Groups (BRGs) to help foster diversity, inclusion, and belonging for all employees, an industry-leading total rewards package that emphasizes a high discretionary bonus. *Benefits begin 30 days after hire for hourly employees, and immediately upon hire for salaried employees. Get a peek into life here at Kraft Heinz through our Instagram and TikTok channels! Senior Financial Analyst at a Glance…. This is a Global role where the Senior Financial Analyst is expected to support the Global BU/HQ functions in identifying and resolving variances between the internal financial reporting tool (SST) and external financial reporting tool (HFM). The senior analyst is expected to lead the variance analysis discussions, propose solutions and recommend solutions by working with local regional controllership teams, the FP&A teams and IT. What’s on the menu? Work with Global BU/HQ Functions in identifying and resolving variances between Financial Reporting systems Support month-end close reconciliation of internal financial reporting system (SST) to external reporting system (HFM) globally Support and execute financial restatements Assist in the implementation and execution of Global Controllership projects Participate in Data Governance Council meetings – where data changes to Financial Reporting Systems are presented and approved Team player who supports both onshore and offshore teams with requests/questions Recipe for Success – apply now if this sounds like you! Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or related field required. Additional relevant certifications are a plus. Such as CPA, CFA, or CMA Minimum 2 years of relevant experience ERP systems knowledge required; SAP is a plus Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel as well as knowledge in Oracle/Hyperion financial tools is a plus Understanding of fundamental accounting principles and financial statements Strong organizational skills – proven ability to organize others and plan actions to meet deliverables Demonstrated ability to work and think independently, interpret and exercise professional judgment, and creatively problem solve Location(s) Chicago/Aon Center Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination or harassment of any type. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require an accommodation to participate in the job application or hiring process should contact NATAI@kraftheinz.com .

The senior analyst is expected to lead the variance analysis discussions, propose solutions and recommend solutions by working with local regional controllership teams, the FP&A teams and IT.

title: Data Analytics Manager
description: Description Description – External There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines! We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world? We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with pioneering technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions. Job Overview And Responsibilities This person would be part of the Digital Channels, Personalization, and Loyalty technology Product Analytics team. In the position of Data Analyst Manager, your responsibilities include developing and maintaining solid relationships with key collaborators in the Digital Channels, Personalization, and Loyalty technology teams. You will also be leading and coaching a team that will collaborate with the Digital Operations Center (DOC) on operational metrics. You would be interpreting data from various sources, analyzing patterns and trends, and redefining it into actionable information to enhance Operational Excellence (OX). Additionally, you will be responsible for identifying application improvements and establishing metrics for measurement. Areas of focus will include, but are not limited to: Data Visualizations Application performance analysis Error patterns, top factors contributing to errors Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: recommendations for performance and greater scalability Modeling and coding of data United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. Qualifications Qualifications - External Required Bachelor's degree with a background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research) preferred 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst, Business Intelligence Developer, or a related analytical role 1+ years (3+ plus years preferred) as a Manager and at least 2 years in a Fortune 500 company Experience putting together presentations for collaborators and leaders at an MD and VP level and interact with all levels of management Proven Team Manager, ability to communicate a vision, inspire the team towards that vision and provide support to achieve it Expert level BI dashboarding experience (e.g. PowerBI, Tibco Spotfire, etc...) to produce meaningful, elegant dashboards. Advanced Excel knowledge Experience analyzing ecommerce platforms for Web, Mobile App, Loyalty, Demonstrated experience in handling substantial data sets and relational databases (SQL and Non-SQL) Ability to study/understand business needs, design data/technology metrics that connect business processes with quantifiable platform outcomes, Understand critical metric / Goal Settings from teams to large organizations Advanced level SQL skills Strong problem-solving skills, using data to tackle problems Desire to attack complex data sets Outstanding writing, communication, and presentation skills Ability to work independently and manage several simultaneous projects with a focus on results Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship Preferred Master’s degree in analytical field preferred Certifications including Google Data Analytics Professional Certificate, Power BI Data Analyst Associate, AWS Certified Data Analytics, Enterprise Data Warehouse certifications, Palantir, Client Side performance metrics tools e.g. Quantum Metrics Experience with DataDog / AppD / Kibana Experience with Enterprise Monitoring Systems Experience with Palantir Foundry, Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio Experience with AWS - Redshift, Quicksight, Athena Experience with Big Query, Quantum Metrics, Akamai Experience with text analytics and machine learning Data Engineering experience Exposure to Python, Spark, R Continuous integration & delivery using Agile methodologies Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT WHQ00023786
summary: United Airlines is seeking a Data Analyst Manager to join their Digital Channels, Personalization, and Loyalty technology Product Analytics team. This role involves analyzing data from various sources, identifying trends, and developing actionable insights to enhance operational excellence. Responsibilities include developing and maintaining relationships with key collaborators, leading and coaching a team, collaborating with the Digital Operations Center (DOC), interpreting data, and identifying application improvements. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in quantitative fields, 4+ years of data analysis experience, 1+ years of management experience in a Fortune 500 company, expert-level BI dashboarding skills (PowerBI, Tibco Spotfire), advanced Excel knowledge, and strong SQL skills.

title: Researcher (Data Science/Engineer)
description: Chapin Hall is seeking an experienced Researcher who will work collaboratively with Chapin Hall staff. This position will report directly to a Senior Researcher. This position allows for remote work and periodic in-person attendance at Chicago, IL meetings. The successful applicant is expected to work normal business hours and must have flexibility in their work schedule to accommodate business demands. Chapin Hall is seeking an individual to work on a team engaged in empirical, analytical, and conceptual child and family welfare research in Illinois. The Researcher’s main contribution to research projects is to manage, maintain, and upkeep Chapin Hall’s existing ETL (extract, transform, load) data processes to support Chapin Hall’s stewardship of the Illinois Department of Children and Family Services (DCFS) administrative data hosted at Chapin Hall. In this capacity, the individual will oversee data management, linkage, documentation, sharing of DCFS administrative data with researchers and policy staff, and conduct statistical analysis, and presentation of data analysis when appropriate. Substantively, the individual will develop and maintain programs that transform data into analyzable formats and/or that can be utilized for data analysis; perform analysis of DCFS administrative data using R, Python, VBA, SQL/PostgreSQL, STATA, SAS and/or other appropriate analytic software programs; and when appropriate, serve as data expert to provide consultation for and participate in discussions regarding study design and methodology for specific research projects. During DCFS’ multi-year transition from the Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System (SACWIS) to the new IllinoisConnect system, the Researcher will serve as the key point-of-contact for Chapin Hall to keep abreast with the latest developments and implications of the transition. The Researcher will also participate in meetings with external stakeholders and write sections of methods and data sources for funders and publications. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and strongly encourage individuals of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. Responsibilities Uses R, Python, VBA, SQL/PostgreSQL, STATA, SAS, and/or other appropriate analytic software programs to independently convert, merge, and assemble large-scale administrative data that often need to be cleaned for analysis for multiple projects. Develops and maintains programming codes that transform administrative data into analyzable formats and/or that can be utilized for data analysis, with a strong emphasis on generalizability and transparency. Automates existing and emerging processes for importing, documenting, integrating, and updating data as well as to coding best practices such as code review and version control, using GitHub and updating existing data dictionaries Chapin Hall maintains. Provides details regarding data usage to researchers and other DCFS university partners. Performs modeling and complex statistical analyses under supervision. Participates in discussions regarding study design and methods. Assists in developing study objectives, and designing sampling, randomization, and data collection procedures to achieve study objectives. Writes sections of research results for funders and/or publications, and assists with report production activities, including proofing, formatting and creating tables and graphs. Participates in meetings with external stakeholders and may present findings at meetings and/or conferences. Performs additional duties as assigned.
summary: Chapin Hall seeks an experienced Researcher to manage, maintain, and upkeep data processes for the Illinois Department of Children and Family Services (DCFS) administrative data. This role involves data management, linkage, documentation, sharing, statistical analysis, and presentation of data analysis. The Researcher will also serve as the key point-of-contact for Chapin Hall during DCFS's transition to the new IllinoisConnect system and participate in meetings with external stakeholders.

title: Senior Business Insights Analyst
description: The Aspen Group (TAG) is one of the largest and most trusted retail healthcare business support organizations in the U.S., supporting 15,000 healthcare professionals and team members at more than 1,000 health and wellness offices across 47 states in three distinct categories: Dental care, urgent care, and medical aesthetics. Working in partnership with independent practice owners and clinicians, the team is united by a single purpose: to prove that healthcare can be better and smarter for everyone. TAG provides a comprehensive suite of centralized business support services that power the impact of five consumer-facing businesses: Aspen Dental, ClearChoice Dental Implant Centers, WellNow Urgent Care, AZPetVet and Chapter Aesthetic Studio. Each brand has access to a deep community of experts, tools and resources to grow their practices, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-quality consumer healthcare experiences at scale. As a reflection of our current needs and planned growth we are very pleased to offer a new opportunity to join our dedicated team as a Senior Business Insights Analyst. This role is responsible for leveraging data and transforming it into insights and reporting that can be utilized across all levels of the organization. This role will be engaged in driving the business both through support of our business partners in both the offices and field teams along with informing strategy for our Executive Leadership Team. Responsibilities As a Senior Business Insights Analyst, you will be responsible for: Driving organizational excellence through insights and recommendations to optimize how we capture volume and rate to drive efficiency in our patient funnel Develop and distribute reporting that integrates both daily operational metrics and monthly financial results to inform end-users of the current state of the business Drive action from key stakeholders including leaders for the Field, Service Lines, and the Executive Leadership Team Add value to reporting through insights that go beyond what the target audiences can infer through data alone Create ad hoc analyses that determine the root cause of an issue and provide recommendations on how to drive improved results Having full understanding of how key metrics are derived, what they mean and what drivers relate to each. Enforcing data integrity, accuracy and governance in financial and management reporting Minimum Education And Experience BA or BS in Data Analytics, Finance, Business or other degree with equivalent work experience in analysis or insights bases roles. 1-3 years of experience in analysis-driven roles required. Experience in multi-unit retail environment is desirable. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are required. Experience managing cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders is desirable. Advanced skills with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint are required. Ability to find and query appropriate data from databases, along with validating and reviewing data and reports for accuracy and completion. SQL and Tableau knowledge are a plus. Ability to excel in fast paced environment, take direction, and handle multiple priorities If you are an applicant residing in California, please view our privacy policy here: https://careers.aspendental.com/us/en/tag-privacy-policy-for-california-employees Salary: 90-100k
summary: Aspen Group (TAG), a leading retail healthcare support organization, seeks a Senior Business Insights Analyst to drive organizational excellence through data analysis and insights. This role involves developing and distributing reports, identifying key performance indicators, conducting root cause analyses, and making recommendations to optimize patient volume, rates, and business efficiency. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and experience working with multi-unit retail environments. SQL and Tableau expertise is a plus.

title: Business System Analyst
description: ERP Business Systems Analyst II – $90K – $100K DOE + 10% discretionary bonus – Hybrid (Schaumburg, IL) Schaumburg, IL candidates only. Must be comfortable with up to 25% travel. Our industry-leading client is looking for your functional experience in ERP business systems analysis. Our next candidate will be well-rounded with ERP systems configurations, SQL databases, and Windows servers in a BSA role. If you are looking for a high-energy environment and are passionate about analytical techniques, practices, and problem-solving, this job is for you – apply now!! Who You Are: Bachelor's in Computer Science, Business, or related field experience required 5+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst with ERP systems required Experience with SQL, databases, HTML, and XML in a Microsoft or Windows server environment Experience communicating with business stakeholders to gather requirements What You'll Do: Work with stakeholders to gather requirements and processes for ERP implementations Plan, analyze, test, and implement phases of ERP and Application projects Provide subject matter expertise for peripheral projects affecting ERP companies and operational physical inventory support Travel up to 25% of the time for project-based needs Why Work Here: Join a stable and leading global company that is continuously improving its systems Work in a collaborative environment where a passion for owning your part of the process is present A company culture with empowerment, teamwork, collaboration, and promotions from within Complete benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and PTO What does this position pay? Compensation is determined by several factors, which may include skill set, experience level, and geographic location. The expected range for this role is $90k to $100k per year, plus a 10% discretionary bonus and annual merit review. Please note this range is an estimate, and actual pay may vary based on qualifications and experience. Complete benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and PTO. This company is looking for an experienced ERP Business Systems Analyst II who is eager to deliver a positive impact to business users throughout the organization while implementing ERP solutions. Please email your resume to Elissa Profant at eprofant@provenrecruiting.com if you'd like to grow your career in a nationwide industry-leading company while working alongside some of the finest IT personnel in Illinois. title: Variable Data Mail Programmer
description: PComm Direct, a direct mail printing company located in Addison Illinois, is seeking an experienced Direct Mail Variable Data Programmer to join our team. The ideal individual would be responsible for programming personalized direct mail jobs and be responsible for postal preparation, data-cleansing, and postal document preparation. This includes selecting, sorting, formatting, and manipulating data to meet client mail instructions and U.S. postal requirements for mail certification. Variable data programming includes letter and self-mailer setup for output to various print devices or digital media including websites and marketing emails. Perform quality checks and control, code review and standard data validation practices prior to production release. Ability to work in Quadient Inspire to program letters and self-mailer pieces with multiple variable fields with static text and graphics and merging the setup with data for print and digital output. Prepare and cleanse data for mailing requirements including personalization and postal presorting using BCC Mail Manager software. Ability to analyze client data requirements for direct mail jobs Strong skills in Access, Excel, Word, Acrobat, and Photoshop Ability to write code in Visual Basic and C++ or C# (preferred) Experience with batch processing (preferred) Thorough understanding of postal regulations and DMM Experience with File Transfer Protocol (FTP) Database Management skills (highly preferred) Perform quality checks and control, code review and standard data validation practices prior to production release. Knowledge of USPS bulk mail regulations Proficiency with mail processing software Experience with BCC Mail Manager and understanding of scripting with the Taskmaster feature. Experience with Microsoft Excel, various delimited file types (CSV, Tab, Pipe, etc.). Must have knowledge of printing terminology and basic print specifications including margins, bleeds, etc. Knowledge of variable data software (i.e. Quadient Inspire, XMPie, FusionPro) and Adobe Creative Suite Health insurance Employee assistance program Dental insurance Health savings account Paid time off Vision insurance 401k with match Schedule 8-hour shift Monday to Friday Work Location In-person or hybrid. #IND1

title: Senior Statistical Analyst
description: Company Description AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn. Job Description Key Responsibilities Perform statistical programming activities for all assigned Phase I-IV clinical studies sponsored by AbbVie and its partners. Perform statistical programming for clinical studies, integrated summaries, and in support of responses to requests from regulatory authorities. Provide programming and documentation support for multiple studies with high quality. Utilize experience in SAS and Linux. Review statistical analysis plans for all assigned studies and integrated summaries in conjunction with program lead and provide comments to study biostatistician. Utilize knowledge of statistical methodology in clinical trials, FDA regulations and CDISC standards. Create ADaM data set specifications for all assigned studies and integrated summaries. Ensure study analysis is consistent with standard templates and specifications. Contribute to submission support. Contribute to development of new standard templates. Participate in development of standard operating procedures and support documents related to Statistical Programming processes. Support urgent regulatory agency requests. Participate in a Statistical Programming process improvement initiative. Manage timelines and ensure good communication with CROs/FSPs and internal programmers. Oversee programming tasks for a single study. Project management and conduct high level review of deliverables provided by CRO/FSP to ensure good quality and accuracy. Qualifications Must possess a Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or a highly related field of study with at least 5 years of experience. In the alternative, employer will accept a Master’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in the aforementioned fields with at least two 2 years of related experience. Each educational alternative with at least 2 years of experience in the following: experience in SAS and Linux; knowledge of statistical methodology in clinical trials, FDA regulations and CDISC standards; project management and conducting high level review of deliverables provided by CRO/FSP to ensure good quality and accuracy. Employer will accept any suitable combination of education, training or experience related to the job opportunity. 100% telecommunicating permitted. Salary Range: $136,500 - $157,500 per year. Apply online at https://careers.abbvie.com/en. Refer to Req ID: REF24718K. Additional Information We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term and long-term incentive programs. AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.
