The role will also involve project management and overseeing programming tasks for a single study.

title: IT Systems Engineer
description: Do you want to play a pivotal role in the rapid growth of a VC backed scale up revolutionising the manufacturing industry? Quotacom are proud to be partnered with a company that seek to become the market leader of the $100 billion connectivity industry. Their success is growing as they rapidly manufacture fibre cables and switches that service some of the world’s largest 5G and data centre customers. The technology function has continuously transformed their digital operations, utilising top cutting edge technology has seen this team expand YoY. As part of their continued growth, they have engaged Quotacom exclusively to recruit a highly skilled, solutions-orientated IT Systems Engineer, to join their facility in Aurora, IL. As an IT Systems Engineer, you will be responsible for managing, upgrading, and maintaining their IT infrastructure, ensuring seamless and efficient operations. You will handle everything from system and network management to security oversight and user support Responsibilities: Manage, upgrade and maintain software, hardware, and network infrastructure, particularly within Active Directory/Window Server Environments. Administer and troubleshoot a Cisco switched environment, including VLANs and network segmentation.. Oversee system backups, ensuring data integrity, availability, and reliable recovery processes. Manage and optimize cloud environments, particularly our 365, Active Directory and Azure environment. Act as the primary liaison with external vendors and support services to resolve escalated issues promptly. Provide comprehensive technical support and training to users to ensure secure, effective system use. Define, and ensure compliance with, relevant policies and regulations. Develop and utilize automation scripts using languages like PowerShell and Python to streamline processes. Deliver exceptional customer service-oriented desktop support. Required experience: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent experience. Minimum 5 years of experience in system administration with a focus on Windows Server, Active Directory, and networking infrastructure. Proven ability to redesign and optimize IT infrastructure. Expertise in Windows Server and Active Directory administration. Proficiency in managing Cisco networking equipment, VLAN configuration, and OSI layers 1-4. Strong understanding of network protocols, LAN/WAN configurations, and related software. Excellent troubleshooting skills with a proactive approach to resolving issues. Solid understanding of cybersecurity principles and best practices. To learn more, please apply to this position, or email joe@quotacom.com with your resume to set up a confidential discussion. At Quotacom, we take the security and privacy of your personal data very seriously, any data we hold will be in accordance with data protection legislation. Full details of our privacy notice can be found at www.quotacom.com/privacy-notice
summary: A VC-backed scale-up in the $100 billion connectivity industry is looking for an IT Systems Engineer to manage, upgrade, and maintain their IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have experience with Windows Server, Active Directory, Cisco networking, and cloud environments. title: Category Insights Analyst, Marketing
description: Wilton's Journey So Far Wilton is a US heritage brand with a 95-year history in baking and decorating. Now fully integrated into the Dr. Oetker family, Wilton aspires to be the most influential and successful cake decorating brand. Learn more about Wilton at www.wilton.com . Job Summary Do you have a passion for telling stories with data to support the growth of your business? Our Category Insights Analyst is a key member of the Insights and Analytics (I&A) department and supports the Sr. Manager Category Strategy with developing category strategy, supporting channel strategy, and the delivery of revenue management. You’ll work closely with all of Wilton’s Brand & Product teams to ensure that customer and consumer related activities are driven by insights and are aligned to Wilton’s brand and purpose. Essential Responsibilities Create compelling strategies and selling stories from all available data resources. Support the development of category strategies, leveraging consumer and customer insights to become category experts across our entire portfolio. Work within a matrix organization to support and empower Brand & Product Teams and the broader commercial organization through insight generation and strategic guidance. Educate stakeholders on key finds and data tools. Ensure category insight drives the development of products and campaigns. Influence Net Revenue Management and Category/Brand Growth by driving strategy development and addressing key components of category analytics: Channel and Customer Mix – Identifying the ideal assortment that should be available across channel and retailer landscapes. Portfolio Pricing – Determining if our products are priced correctly against our competition and if there are any gaps in the market that we can exploit. Price Pack Architecture – Supporting the development of an optimized mix of product formats and ensuring these formats are priced correctly. Promotional Analysis – Performing post-mortem analytics to determine promo effectiveness and strategic recommendations. Merchandising – Creating insight informed merchandising analysis for best-in-class planograms aligned to categories and market channels. Innovations – Discovering which innovations, and what types of innovation, are driving market growth. Education And Experience Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or related subject is required. 2 to 4 years of experience in data analysis, reporting and presentation creation, preferably in a CPG environment. Proven experience in consumer and category analytics and insights development. Strong base knowledge of pulling/formatting/analyzing/extracting insights from syndicated, customer, and panel data sources (Circana, Nielsen, 84.51, Numerator, Stackline, etc.). Experience in Category Management analyzing insights to determine industry and consumer trends as well as developing strategies to support category and product decisions. Local candidates (Chicagoland area) preferred. Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Strong analytical and creative problem-solving skills (i.e. gathers critical data, translates analysis of an opportunity to resulting volume and financial goals, develops POV and recommendation) Basic financial and P&L acumen. Management of multiple projects at a time (timeline development, completion of tasks, and delivery of projects on time). Strong Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word skills. Excel Power Pivot skills a plus. Holds self and others accountable by partnering with cross functional teams. Solid working knowledge of the CPG market and marketing principles. Strong oral and written communication and problem/situation analysis skills. Ability to identify and seek needed information/research skills Critical and analytical thinking skills. Very detailed oriented and quality conscientious. Wilton values an engaging in-person work environment with focus on cross-functional collaboration and problem solving. We also recognize the need for workplace flexibility. This is why Wilton offers a hybrid schedule with the ability to work half a day on Fridays. Wilton is an equal employment opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, individuals with disability or veteran status as provided by law. Wilton Brands LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran. For applicants or employees who are disabled or require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, you may request assistance via email at TalentAcquisition@wilton.com . Contact Wilton Industries Inc. Wilton Talent Acquisition Team 800.794.5866 E-mail: TalentAcquisition@wilton.com www.wilton.com/careers
summary: Wilton, a cake decorating brand, seeks a Category Insights Analyst to support the development of category strategy, channel strategy, and revenue management. The role involves creating compelling strategies from data resources, leveraging consumer and customer insights, educating stakeholders, and driving category insight into product development and campaigns. The ideal candidate has a Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field, 2-4 years of experience in data analysis and reporting, and a strong understanding of consumer and category analytics. This role requires strong analytical and problem-solving skills, financial acumen, experience with syndicated, customer, and panel data sources (Circana, Nielsen, 84.51, Numerator, Stackline, etc.), and proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.

title: Quantitative Researcher (FTRs)
description: 🎯 Why we exist We’re on a mission to improve the reliability, transparency, and efficiency of our energy systems, fostering a future with sustainable and abundant energy. To accomplish our aims, we’re leveraging state of the art statistical learning and convex optimization methods (AI) to build the financial rails of our future energy systems that will accelerate the deployment of clean energy resources. We envision energy systems that are efficient, autonomous, resilient, and powered by 100% renewable energy. 🧗 Who we are Our founders (ex-Apple, Bluevine; ex-Affirm, Square, Google) are Stanford alumni with experience in complex systems, machine learning and structured finance. Our world-class investors, Maverick Ventures and Caffeinated Capital, are aligned to our policy objectives and platform vision. We're headquartered in New York City, with a flexible approach to remote work. The Role Comity is looking for a Quantitative Researcher (FTRs) to help us develop market-leading power contract origination strategies with transmission congestion products. You’ll study, design, and deploy models and optimization algorithms for transacting Financial Transmission Right (FTR) contracts in multiple Independent System Operators (ISOs). You’ll keep abreast of the latest research in quantitative finance and distributionally robust optimization, as well as help develop our data strategy and information systems by evaluating available data sources that can be integrated into our system to improve performance. As an early hire in this role, you will have broad impact and ownership over our algorithm design, research agenda, technology choices, and team culture. We're excited about you because: You have 2+ years of experience applying quantitative methods to FTRs, PTP/UTC products, and/or congestion forecasting. You have a strong working knowledge of one or more ISOs/RTOs. You have an advanced degree in quantitative finance, computer science, statistics, machine learning, operations research, or a related quantitative field. You have deep knowledge of applied math, probability, statistics and numerical algorithms, including knowledge of optimization techniques in contexts such as financial or electrical engineering, operations research, or economics. You are adept at communicating mathematical concepts, analytical results, and data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are a lifelong learner and empathetic teacher. We’re committed to the growth and development of our teammates. We work towards a shared understanding by listening with intent and holding open discussions because we know that's how we'll deliver quality results. We believe strong foundations are more important than specific technical knowledge, but experience with any part of our data stack (Python, CVXPY, Snowflake) is a plus. Compensation Range: $160K - $200K
summary: Comity is seeking a Quantitative Researcher to develop market-leading power contract origination strategies involving Financial Transmission Rights (FTRs) and transmission congestion products. The role involves studying, designing, and deploying models and optimization algorithms for FTR contracts across multiple Independent System Operators (ISOs). Responsibilities also include staying current on quantitative finance research, developing data strategy and information systems, and contributing to the team's research agenda, technology choices, and culture.

title: Bioinformatics Analyst
description: Job Title: Bioinformatics Analyst Location: Remote Duration: 06 months Remote, 100% Onsite, or Hybrid Onsite Schedule: May be remote, onsite, or hybrid. Working hours are typically 9AM-5PM Central Time, with some flexibility depending upon applicant location. Job Description We are seeking a Bioinformatician to join our cross-functional team and provide advanced bioinformatics support for studies of age-related diseases. The successful candidate will use a variety of ‘omics data to test and refine biological hypotheses in coordination with wet-lab and computational colleagues. Key responsibilities include: upstream processing of ‘omics data (QC, normalization, exploratory data analysis). downstream processing of bulk, single-cell, and/or spatial transcriptomic data (e.g., cell type annotation, differential gene expression analysis, gene set enrichment analysis, results visualization). Additional responsibilities may include analysis of proteomics or other data modalities depending upon project needs. Applicants should be familiar with high-performance computing systems, shell scripting in a Linux environment, and have strong facility with R and/or Python, including relevant bioinformatics packages (e.g., Seurat, edgeR/limma). Those with experience integrating multi-modal data (e.g., scRNAseq + scATACseq, spatial RNAseq + spatial proteomics) are especially encouraged to apply. A background in human disease biology is helpful but not required. What are the top 3-5 skills, experience or education required for this position: PhD in Bioinformatics, Genetics, Molecular and Cellular Biology, or related field or MS with at least 6 years of experience. single-cell and/or spatial transcriptome QC and analysis (e.g., with Seurat or Scanpy) bulk RNAseq data processing and analysis facility with R and/or Python for data exploration and statistical analysis experience with high-performance computing (HPC) and job submission systemsAbout Us: Established in 2004, SPECTRAFORCE® is one of the largest and fastest-growing diversity-owned staffing firms in the US. The growth of our company is a direct result of our global client service delivery model that is powered by our state-of-the-art A.I. proprietary talent acquisition platform, robust ISO 9001:2015/ISO 27001 certified processes, and strong and passionate client engaged teams. We have built our business by providing talent and project-based solutions, including Contingent, Permanent, and Statement of Work (SOW) services to over 140 clients in the US, Canada, Puerto Rico, Costa Rica, and India. Key industries that we service include Technology, Financial Services, Life Sciences, Healthcare, Telecom, Retail, Utilities and Transportation. SPECTRAFORCE is built on a concept of “human connection,” defined by our branding attitude of NEWJOBPHORIA®, which is the excitement of bringing joy and freedom to the work lifestyle so our people and clients can reach their highest potential. Learn more at: http://www.spectraforce.com Benefits: SPECTRA FORCE offers ACA compliant health benefits as well as dental, vision, accident, critical illness, voluntary life, and hospital indemnity insurances to eligible employees. Additional benefits offered to eligible employees include commuter benefits, 401K plan with matching, and a referral bonus program. SPECTRA FORCE provides unpaid leave as well as paid sick leave when required by law. Equal Opportunity Employer: SPECTRA FORCE is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Please contact Human Resources at LOA@spectraforce.com if you require reasonable accommodation.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Work Model: Onsite Type : Fulltime Job Description Spring Grove, IL (Onsite) Need someone with manufacturing experience We Have a Need For An IT Business Systems Analyst To Support Our Manufacturing Operations That Has Process And Technology Proficiencies In Production planning and control Shop floor scheduling and control Quality and Inspection operations (including non-conformance processes) Machining and other heavy industrial operations Item master configuration and functionality knowledge Outside purchasing Manufacturing accounting and job costing Materials management In line process data collection Quality compliance and specification management The Drivers For This New Position Are Leading manufacturing enhancements and process improvements to support our operations on-time delivery and quality goals Delivery advanced technology capabilities with automated data capture to feed our analytical tools Supporting our goals of productivity, non-conformances reduction, material yielding, throughput and other operational goals by delivering manufacturing application enhancements Being an integral resource of the overall "service team" to our shop employees Responsibilities Learn and apply deep functional understanding of manufacturing processes. Lead the scoping and design of manufacturing enhancements. Serve as a functional trusted business partner and thought leader to our operating departments (Saw, Forge, Machine, Heat Treat, Inspection, QA, Product Certs, and Production Control). Properly identify and deliver to user requirements while implementing change management to serve those requirements. Provide the business owners the information required for them to make educated decisions regarding system changes. This includes defining overall scope, work effort, weighing the risk to change, the time to change, and the benefits gained by the change. Staying on top of technology trends and matching those trends to our customer's needs. Document the processes with our business owners while learning the manufacturing end of our business. Skills / Qualifications Manufacturing and Quality background or experience Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work collaboratively with various types of people Strong "customer first" mentality Keeping an open mind to what our front end system should be in the future. Have a skillset, mindset, toolset approach. Skillset meaning building technical knowledge and experience to advance us to the future. Mindset a willingness to engage constructively with our business owners. Toolset designing and developing strong applications for our business owners. Display a continuous improvement mindset by always looking for global, broad-based changes rather than focusing on spot solutions. Seek knowledge from experts both inside and outside the company to improve personal effectiveness Leverage intellectual horsepower and creativity to devise innovative solutions. Exhibit internal drive to personally grow into a long-term larger role with management responsibilities Education and/or Yrs. of Experience Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Information Technology, Quality Manufacturing, Supply Chain or Related Field. Strong ERP or other systems experience in Manufacturing (5-7 years)
summary: This job description seeks an IT Business Systems Analyst with extensive manufacturing experience to support operational processes and technology. The ideal candidate will have expertise in production planning, scheduling, quality assurance, machining, materials management, and process data collection. They will lead manufacturing enhancements, deliver advanced technology capabilities, and serve as a trusted business partner to various departments.

title: Senior Data Visualization & Reporting Consultant (Power BI)
description: You have a clear vision of where your career can go. And we have the leadership to help you get there. At CNA, we strive to create a culture in which people know they matter and are part of something important, ensuring the abilities of all employees are used to their fullest potential. Join a newly created Portfolio Management team designed to synthesize aggregated information across the organization to ensure our overall underwriting strategies are producing optimal profitability. This position will move you closer to the business and allow you to creatively apply your expert skills in Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Power Apps. This new individual contributor role implements and maintains Portfolio Management data visualization dashboards and process oriented apps, facilitates data integration, data quality and reports creation and maintenance for the full scope of the Portfolio Management team. In this position you will promote data standards and coding structures through in-depth knowledge of internal management information reporting requirements. You will demonstrate deep technical proficiency in data reporting, maintenance and control procedures for data collection and reporting system applications. You will also conduct control activities to ensure data quality and adherence to CNA’s data policy. This position is flexible to a variety of locations and hybrid or remote work arrangements depending upon candidate qualifications and preferences. JOB DESCRIPTION: Essential Duties & Responsibilities Performs a combination of duties in accordance with departmental guidelines: Specialized expertise designing, implementing, developing and maintaining dashboards and apps, developing and executing data mapping and transformation processes and requirements within and between applications and data sources across CNA; rationalizing and analyzing large amounts of data across multiple sources. Creates and implements testing methods and procedures as appropriate. Collaborates with management, technical staff and subject matter advisors to understand business issues, troubleshoot problems and develop and recommend cost-effective data solutions for data anomalies. Conducts data analysis, develops and executes requisite changes to implement approved requests, ensuring that new requirements comply with CNA’s data policy and/or reporting needs. Crafts high level design of data solutions. Consults with relevant stakeholders to analyze dashboard usage and capabilities, identifies associated risks, resolves problems and recommends and/or executes resolutions. Tests changes prior to deployment into production environment as appropriate. Ensures data integrity by developing and executing necessary processes and controls around the flow of data. Performs data cleansing to ensure quality of data output. Utilizes technology to analyze data and/or metrics from applicable systems to review data processes, identify issues, determine actions to resolve or escalate problems that require data, system or process improvements. Conducts training and coaching of users on features and functions of dashboard and other related tools/reports. Leads data related research and root cause analysis activities, provides correction specifications, and escalates issues as appropriate. Works with technical and non-technical stakeholders on various analyses and research, and participates in and/or may lead special projects as appropriate. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. May perform additional duties as assigned. Reporting Relationship Typically reports to Director or above Skills, Knowledge & Abilities Deep analytical, integrative and problem-solving skills with proven ability to manipulate and analyze high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varied sources. Solid communication, interpersonal, influencing and presentation skills to work effectively among all levels of internal/external stakeholders. Strong ability to multitask in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment. Skillful at learning new system applications/functions. Readily adapts to change. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in related discipline or equivalent work experience. Typically a minimum of five to seven years of experience in data/statistical analysis, data architecture, data modeling and business intelligence. Advanced skill and experience with Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Power Apps, with a minimum of five years of experience blending and analyzing multiple data sets, building reporting pipelines and dashboards and utilizing analysis and reporting/visualization tools. Applicable certifications preferred. In New York/California, the average base pay range for this role is $107,000 to $134,000. Salary determinations are based on various factors, including but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location. I n certain jurisdictions, CNA is legally required to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation for this role. In District of Columbia, California, Colorado, Connecticut, Maryland, New York and Washington, the national base pay range for this job level is $71,000 to $133,000 annually. Salary determinations are based on various factors, including but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and location. CNA offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits package to help our employees – and their family members – achieve their physical, financial, emotional and social wellbeing goals. For a detailed look at CNA’s benefits, please visit cnabenefits.com. CNA is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities in the recruitment process. To request an accommodation, please contact leaveadministration@cna.com.
summary: CNA seeks a Portfolio Management Analyst to design, implement, and maintain dashboards and apps using Microsoft Power BI and Power Apps. This role involves data analysis, integration, and quality assurance, ensuring data integrity and adherence to CNA's data policy. The position requires strong analytical and communication skills, experience in data architecture and business intelligence, and a deep understanding of data reporting and visualization tools. The role is flexible in terms of location and work arrangements.

title: Senior Quantitative Researcher - Futures
description: Senior Quantitative Researcher - Futures PM at a market leading trading firm is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Quantitative Researcher to there join their Futures team. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing high-performance algorithmic trading strategies in Futures markets. You will collaborate with top academic minds in research and engineering to continually improve existing strategies and stay at the forefront of quantitative trading advancements. TC $450K-$750K. Responsibilities: Design, implement, and optimize high-performance algorithmic trading strategies in Futures markets. Collaborate with the best academic minds in research and engineering to continually improve existing strategies and develop new ones. Investigate and implement new trading products and strategies. Qualifications: Master's / PhD in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related fields. Strong experience in quantitative trading with a focus on futures. Experience in alpha generation with a proven track record of well performing signals. Proficient in machine learning techniques and tools. Strong coding skills in languages such as Python, C++, or Java. linkedin.com/company/algocapitalgroup - Please follow Algo Capital for the latest job updates.
summary: Senior Quantitative Researcher specializing in Futures markets at a top trading firm. title: Business Intelligence System Analyst - Chicago - Up to 100k!!!
description: Business Intelligence System Analyst - Chicago - Up to 100k!!! One of our biggest clients, an elite law firm with global presence (more than 7 offices around the world) in Chicago, IL is looking for a Business Intelligence System Analyst to join their team. This role offers a mix of onsite and remote work, with 3 days onsite and 2 days remote. Key Responsibilities Responsible for organizing data, creating ad hoc and long-term reporting solutions. Preferred Qualifications: Prior experience in progressive financial analysis Demonstrated technical and analytical skills in a professional capacity Familiarity with Elite 3E Additional Skills and Abilities: Exceptional attention to detail and proficiency in pattern recognition Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical abilities Effective interpersonal communication skills This role presents an opportunity for professional growth and advancement within the organization. If you have a passion for business intelligence (BI), we welcome you to apply!!! After you apply for this position, we will need you to complete a short series of questions to help us expedite your application. Please look out for an email from Jarvis@hirewithjarvis.com and we recommend you add this to your safe sender list, please check your Spam or Junk folders if you don't receive the email shortly. title: BI Engineer
description: Double Good creates joy through our product based fundraising platform. Our solution helps organizations raise funds fast. We deliver made-to-order delicious popcorn direct to supporters through an ecommerce platform. We're 220 employees strong and growing. We are building a high fidelity and scalable modern data platform at Double Good. We are looking to hire a motivated BI Engineer to join us on the ground floor of this exciting movement. You will report directly to the Head of Data and play a pivotal role in executing our data strategy and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization. This role will be hybrid based out of our downtown Chicago office. About the Role: Data Product Development: Build prioritized Data Products including dashboards, data assets for Double Good stakeholders that provide actionable insights for decisions makers. Drive it end-to-end with our agile data product development framework starting with business value and end state to relevant data models and compelling visualizations on our BI platform Last mile Data Pipeline Development: Design, build, and maintain reliable last mile data pipelines using dbt with Snowflake, that create relevant tables and views for performant Data Products Advanced Analytics: Perform complex data analysis to uncover actionable insights and trends and present recommendations to leadership Collaborative Work: Work closely with data and analytics engineers as well as business stakeholders to ensure seamless integration of Data Products Data Quality and Governance: Contribute to the establishment and maintenance of robust data quality standards, high quality documentation and governance processes Continuous Improvement: Conduct technical research and data profiling using Python, SQL as needed to recommend innovative data solutions that create business value Experience & Skills We Value: Bachelor's Degree in a Tech-related field; Master's degree is a plus. 4+ years of experience in BI & Analytics roles with strong exposure to Analytics / Data Engineering Strong expertise in building insightful visualizations and presentations in any of the modern BI tools Passion for tackling complex business, system, and data challenges, with a continuous drive for innovation. Exceptional communication skills with an ability to translate complex technical concepts for non-technical audiences Proven experience in working with large datasets with focus on efficient querying, data quality testing and automation Advanced expertise in SQL, intermediate or more in Python Excellent problem-solving and communication skills Nice to Have and/or You'll Learn: Familiarity with modern Data Governance principles Experience building data products that scale at a hyper-growth startup Experience with Manufacturing industries and ERP will be advantageous Join Double Good and be part of an innovative and high-growth organization, where you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of our Data & Analytics team and make a meaningful impact on the success of our unique fundraising platform. About Double Good: At Double Good, we believe in the power of joy and connection. Our hand-crafted, small batch popcorn sold through a user-friendly app allows organizations to focus on what they love. Our values - people matter, deliver excellence, own it, and enjoy the ride - guide the journey. As featured on the Today Show, Double Good is not just about the product - we have a strong social mission. We partner with purposeful organizations to benefit students and youth athletes. We've helped organizations raise over $200M and 50% of sales goes directly to our customers. As the #1 product-based virtual fundraising app, we are experiencing rapid growth. Join us in making a positive impact on communities nationwide. Double Good offers our employees: Competitive pay Autonomous work environment 401k with 4% Match Health Insurance, Dental & Vision offered with competitive company contribution Healthiest You (teladoc service) covered 100% by Double Good Company sponsored disability and life insurance Working with amazing charity partners and helping kids. Relaxed, Fast-Paced work environment. (It's a thing, we swear). Company events (Happy Hours, Massages, Ice Cream Trucks) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We desire to have our employees reflect the diverse communities we serve. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
summary: Double Good is seeking a motivated BI Engineer to build and maintain a modern data platform. The role involves building data products, designing data pipelines, performing advanced analytics, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure seamless integration. The ideal candidate will have 4+ years of experience in BI & Analytics, strong expertise in visualization tools, and advanced SQL & Python skills.

title: Azure Data Engineer (no C2C or 3rd party consultants)

Leads Data Modeling, collaborates with data architecture and Enterprise Integration teams Leads enterprise data strategy, researches various tools, frameworks and processes for building scalable modern data platforms as well as help business stakeholders with establishing consumption patterns for reporting and advanced analytics Leads Designs and implements processes to ensure data integrity and standardization. Learns and applies modern data preparation, integration and metadata management tools and techniques. Leads strategy for implementing new techniques in the enterprise by adhering to architectural standards and best practices, business stakeholder communication. Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s in CS or quantitative field AND 8-10 years of data engineering. Masters preferred Strong effective communication skills, both verbal and written Experience in Azure cloud with Data Lake, Synapse database, Azure Data Factory and Databricks **NON-NEGOATIABLE Experience in Data Analysis using various tools such as SQL, SAS, R, Python. Experience in Data Modeling. Experience in reporting and dashboarding tools such as Tableau, Power BI etc. Working knowledge of Data Quality, Data Governance and Data compliance tools. Has a wide range of experience knowledge and/or skill in specific aspects of the job within their own discipline and is learning about the broader function. Anticipates problems and is able to recognize wider implications. Determines methods and procedures to complete new assignments Works under limited to no supervision. The role involves building data warehouses, cloud data lakes, and data science platforms while adhering to data governance and security requirements.

title: Database Engineer
description: Database Engineer About The Position We are looking for a Database Engineers to join our Engineering Team. As a Database Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the performance, availability, and security of clusters of PostgreSQL instances. You will also be responsible for orchestrating upgrades, backups, and provisioning of database instances. You will also work in tandem with the other teams to help our engineers, product managers and analysts make better decisions and drive insights with data. Responsibilities Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases Handle common database procedures, such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc. Profile server resource usage, optimize and tweak as necessary Work with Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and various business groups to implement solutions using an iterative approach. Troubleshooting performance issues. Develop simple automation scripts to streamline common database procedures Skills & Qualifications Strong proficiency in MySQL and PostgreSQL database management Experience with replication configuration in MySQL and PostgreSQL Knowledge of de-facto standards and best practices in MySQL and PostgreSQL Proficient in writing and optimizing SQL statements Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL features, such as extension, Partitioning, Indexes and procedures, Autovacuum, stats collection, etc. Ability to plan resource requirements from high level specifications Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git Proficiency in analyzing slow queries and connection optimization Familiarity with AWS and Infrastructure as Code tools like Terraform, strong plus High attention to detail and constructive attitude in peer code reviews Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or comparable experience Benefits Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, 401(K) plan, company paid short term and long-term disability and life insurance Flexible Paid Time Off Policy Paid time off for volunteering Pre-tax commuter program Paid maternity leave Paid parental leave Credits for employees Company provided breakfast, coffee and soda Voluntary benefits like Pet Insurance and Identity Protection

Prior resource was off-shore and off-hours creating some complexities • Will assist with code reviews, enhancements • MUST BE willing to perform hands-on work • Likely a Contract-to-Hire opportunity after 6 months to 1 year+ Additional Skills & Qualifications Furthermore: • You bring 9 to 12+ years of experience in data engineering designing, implementing and maintaining efficient data platforms • You have experience in leading and mentoring a team of data engineers, promoting a culture of excellence and continuous improvement • You have demonstrated experience in migrating on-premises data to cloud and setting up stable, scalable frameworks • You have strong understanding of data modeling techniques and experience in designing data models for cloud data warehouses and OLTP applications • You have advanced proficiency in Python for data processing and automation • You have strong understanding of relational database concepts and have experience with performance tuning techniques • You have hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure and services, preferably Azure, as it relates to data integration/migration. • You have experience with Kafka and CDC tools for real-time data synchronization • You have familiarity with BI tools and technologies for creating reports and dashboards • You have understanding of REST APIs and how to use them in practice • You have experience with continuous integration and collaboration tools like Azure ADO, GitHub and Confluence. • You have exposure to writing UNIX/LINUX scripts

company: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
title: Senior Research Administration Systems Analyst
description: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children’s Hospital of Chicago provides superior pediatric care in a setting that offers the latest benefits and innovations in medical technology, research and family-friendly design. As the largest pediatric provider in the region with a 140-year legacy of excellence, kids and their families are at the center of all we do. Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children’s Hospital of Chicago is ranked in all 10 specialties by the U.S. News & World Report. Location Simpson Querrey Biomedical Research Center Job Description The Sr Research Administration Systems Analyst is responsible for supporting the management and administration of the SMCRI technology solutions for research administration management including systems that support proposal routing and submission, related compliance requirements, post-award accounting and effort reporting. Essential Job Functions Supports the management and administration of Workday Grants, grants and agreements modules of Huron Research Suite and the effort reporting solution, Employee Compensation Compliance. Serves as the system administrator for Huron Research Suite and Employee Compensation Compliance. Monitors and supports integrations between research administration systems, including the setup and ongoing maintenance of award data between Huron Research Suite and Workday Grants. Collaborates with Research Business Office users regarding research administration system enhancements, inquiries, error resolution data issues, and governance. Collaborates with Finance on all Workday Grant related reporting and integrations needs, including the management of current reports and integrations as well as the development and implementation of future reports and integrations. Supports system upgrades and modifications, including identifying requirements, configuration, testing, and deployment (including change and release management), and communication related to Workday Grants and ancillary Finance and Human Capital Management business processes. Assists the Director with supporting the Research Business Office with management of the research administration systems configuration and data governance. Collaborates with external and internal stakeholders on the organization’s application and reporting requirements for research administration, while eyeing continuous process improvement, efficiency, and optimization. Provides strategic direction on development and implementation of process improvements and innovative or alternative solutions. Provides advice and options on the best way to automate processes in the system. Partners with the organization to refine business process maps to bring efficiencies to the overall business processes and visibility to the end-to-end process. Supports the Director in overall guidance for various research administration systems and integrations including, but not limited to, researching, and resolving problems with Workday and/ or issues with business processes plus recommendations of alternative solutions. Maximizes effectiveness of standard and advanced reports utilizing appropriate reporting tools. Monitors Brainstorms on Workday Community and communicates the information with the impacted Research Business Office units. Supports the Director in preparing management reports, KPI’s and audit schedules as directed by management. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Bachelor’s degree and three years of professional experience in research administration systems or seven years of professional experience in research administration systems. Experience with Workday Grants and Huron Research Suite grants and agreements modules is preferred. Working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications is required. Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, complex technical issues in a clear, concise matter, to individuals with little or no technical background required. Attention to detail and the ability to multitask required. Prioritizing, organizing and assessing work in order to meet aggressive deadlines and cope in fast-paced environment required. Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills required. Capable of working in a diverse, multi-disciplinary team and interacting with all levels of the organization required. Benefit Statement For full time and part time employees who work 20 or more hours per week we offer a generous benefits package that includes: Medical, dental and vision insurance Employer paid group term life and disability Employer contribution toward Health Savings Account Flexible Spending Accounts Paid Time Off (PTO), Paid Holidays and Paid Parental Leave 403(b) with a 5% employer match Various voluntary benefits: Supplemental Life, AD&D and Disability Critical Illness, Accident and Hospital Indemnity coverage Tuition assistance Student loan servicing and support Adoption benefits Backup Childcare and Eldercare Employee Assistance Program, and other specialized behavioral health services and resources for employees and family members Discount on services at Lurie Children’s facilities Discount purchasing program There’s a Place for You with Us At Lurie Children’s we embrace and celebrate diversity and equity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team with a variety of backgrounds, skills, and viewpoints — recognizing that diverse identities strengthen our workplace and the care we can provide to the Chicago community and beyond. We treat everyone fairly, appreciate differences, and make meaningful connections that foster belonging and allyship. This is a place where you can be your best, so we can give our best to the patients and families who trust us with their care. Lurie Children’s and its affiliates are equal employment opportunity employers. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, order of protection status, protected genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
summary: The Sr Research Administration Systems Analyst will support the management and administration of technology solutions for research administration at Lurie Children's Hospital. This role will work closely with various departments to manage systems like Workday Grants and Huron Research Suite, ensure integrations between systems, and address data and error issues. They will also contribute to process improvements, automation, and reporting, working with internal and external stakeholders.  They will be responsible for identifying and resolving system issues, recommending solutions, and creating reports.

title: IT Business Analyst
description: Position Description As a SCW Analyst for John Deere A&CS Part Services located in Portland, OR you will work In collaboration with your customers and teammates, directly support the advancement of the Smart Connected Warehouse (SCW) initiative at John Deere –driving transformational change to Warehouse Management solutions and processes via new and advanced capabilities by configuring and testing systems in support of the global design, local layout and functional requirements. Works closely with world-wide Operations and Engineering leads responsible for Warehouse Management processes (Deere and 3P) throughout all phases of the Smart Connected Warehouse global implementation to ensure delivery of common solutions of optimal performance within the Parts/A&CS division. Provide production support for facilities with modern solutions deployed including deploying new capabilities as they are developed. Create training documentation for warehouse office and floor staff. Perform end- user training and directly support implementations. Duties Include Researches, analyzes and documents business requirements for developing or enhancing systems of low to medium complexity. Facilitates understanding of both the business and Information Technology (IT) to ensure business decisions meet the business requirements as well as facilitate business decision meetings to keep projects moving forward. Maintains a strong and collaborative relationship with the business and IT and serves as a strong advocate of the new/enhanced process or solution through various methods of communication to the organization. Participates in unit and integration testing or works closely with the testing team to ensure understanding of business requirements in order to ensure process/system is thoroughly tested. You will also be participating in on-call rotation to support after hour emergency system support for systems on weekends. Desired Skills And Experience 2+ years of experience working in warehouse or other operation. 2+ years of experience working in an engineering role in support or operations. 2+ years of experience with SQL, SAS, and Python for data analysis. Experience Training personnel (processes, best practices). Experience supporting operations in the use of technical tools or IT systems. Experience developing and interpreting process maps. (Example: Visio). 2+ years of experience working within Operations and Engineering function. Strong communication and collaboration skills. Education Degree in an Engineering/Technology discipline or equivalent experience - University Degree (4 years or equivalent). Degree in Business/Management discipline or equivalent
summary: As a SCW Analyst, you'll be part of the Smart Connected Warehouse (SCW) initiative at John Deere, driving transformational change to warehouse management solutions and processes. You'll configure and test systems, support global implementation, provide production support, and create training materials. This role requires strong communication, collaboration, and technical skills, including experience with SQL, SAS, Python, and process mapping.

title: Hybrid Work - Need Sr Data Engineer in Chicago IL
description: The Senior Data Engineer will be responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of the Data Initiatives throughout the organization, to ensure that optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. You will engage in supporting the data analysts and data scientists, and data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. Do you find the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company’s integration and data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives most exciting? We really should explore together. Drive requirements, scope, and technical design of the integration workflows, to make sure the build is conducted accurately and according to spec. Develop and maintain requirements, design documentation and test plans. Seek out, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability. Coordinate with BI Engineers, Financial Applications and Oracle HR teams around data management including schemas, failure conditions, reconciliation, test data set up, etc. Build the infrastructure required for optimal ETL/ELT pipelines to ingest data from a wide variety of data sources using Microsoft Azure technologies such as Azure Data Factory and Databricks. Construct and maintain of enterprise level integrations using the Snowflake platform, Azure Synapse, Azure SQL and SQL Server. Create data tools for data analytics and data science team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Design analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to deliver actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Troubleshoot issues helping to drive root-cause analysis, and work with infrastructure teams to resolve incidents and arrive to a permanent resolution. Partner with data and analytics teams to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. Provide direction and coordination for development, and support teams, including globally located resources. Understand the layout and working of existing integrations that send and receive data between Oracle, Concur, JDE, Corporate Data Platform and other systems. Qualifications A relevant technical BS Degree in Information Technology 5+ years writing SQL queries against any RDBMS with query optimization 5 years of data engineering experience leveraging technologies such as Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, ADLS Gen 2, Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Databricks, Apache Spark, Scala, Synapse, SQL Server Experience with scripting tools such as Power Shell, Python, Scala, Java and XML Understanding the pros and cons, and best practices of implementing Data Lake, using Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage Experience structuring Data Lake for the reliability, security and performance Experience implementing ETL for Data Warehouse and Business intelligence solutions Skills to read and write effective, modular, dynamic, parameterized and robust code, establish and follow already established code standards, and ETL framework Strong analytical, problem solving, and troubleshooting abilities Good understanding of unit testing, software change management, and software release management Knowledge of Dev-Ops processes (including CI/CD) and Infrastructure as Code fundamentals Experience performing root cause analysis on data and processes to answer specific business questions, and identify opportunities for improvement Experience working within an agile team Excellent communication skills
summary: Senior Data Engineer responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and supporting data initiatives across the organization. This role involves optimizing and re-designing the company's integration and data architecture, building and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines, and creating data tools for analytics and data science teams. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Snowflake, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Apache Spark, and other data engineering technologies.

title: Sr. Data Engineer (AWS / SSIS) - Contract - 100% REMOTE
description: Primary Responsibilities: Architect and manage scalable data pipelines across on-premise and cloud data repositories Create data flow diagrams, and document source to target mapping Extract business requirements and translate them into actionable tasks Maintain the data warehouse performance by optimizing batch processing through parallelization, performance tuning, aggregations etc. Create user-facing dashboards that provide key insights at a glance for its specific audience Recognize and adopt best practices and cost-effective solutions in developing analytical insights on-prem and in the cloud Provide guidance and mentor junior team members Keep current with Business Intelligence data trends and technological innovations Execute on POC’s with new technologies, drive innovation, and new ideas Job Requirements: 7+ years leveraging Microsoft and its associated array of offerings ( SQL, PL/SQL, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, PowerBI ) 5+ years leveraging AWS and its associated array of offerings ( Glue, Redshift, Athena, S3, Spectrum, PySpark ) Deep expertise in Python and C# Collaboration with development teams with established source control (git). Strong understanding data modeling (i.e. conceptual, logical and physical model design, experience with Operation Data Stores, Enterprise Data warehouses and Data Marts). Strong experience with business intelligence and data warehousing design principles and industry best practices including multi-dimensional modelling ( star schemas, snowflakes, de-normalized models, handling “slow-changing” dimensions ) Ability to work with stakeholders and changing priorities Ability to learn and apply new technologies to business problems
summary: This role requires a senior data engineer with a strong background in both on-premise and cloud data warehousing. Technical Support: - Provide advanced troubleshooting and resolution of hardware, software, and network issues. - Assist users with complex technical problems and escalate issues as necessary to specialized teams. - Ensure timely and effective response to service requests and incidents. 2. Service Desk Operations: - Manage and prioritize tickets in the service desk system. - Monitor service desk metrics and performance indicators. - Develop and implement standard operating procedures to improve service efficiency. Skills: - Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field preferred. - Minimum of 5 years of experience in a service desk or technical support role, preferably in the financial sector. - Proven experience in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues.

title: PowerBI Developer
description: PowerBI Developer - Chicago, IL (remote to start, and the majority of the time moving forward) Summary Under the general direction of the Director, Business Intelligence, our PowerBI Developer will serve as a key resource for understanding our business stakeholders' questions and harnessing enterprise data into compelling data stories to address those inquiries. What you'll be doing Participate in discussions with business partners to define key business questions, translate them into necessary requirements documentation and develop visual data-driven solutions which answer those questions Develop reports, thoughtful visualizations, dashboards and KPI scorecards using Microsoft's Power BI and Azure stack employing leading visualization techniques Perform UX design activities and Power BI navigation features (e.g. bookmarks, drill-throughs) to guide end-users through a data-driven story Develop calculations in SQL, DAX and Power BI measures which are accurate and performant on large datasets Work with our internal customers to manage User Acceptance Testing (UAT) processes and address their feedback Assist with governance and deployment of Power BI, including administration, content distribution/sharing, training and support Champion the leading Power BI design methodology and best practices Extract data from various data sources; perform exploratory data analysis, cleanse, reshape, and aggregate data Evangelize data analytics best practices among peers and stakeholders Proactively monitor and evaluate the impact of monthly Power BI releases Conduct deep-dive data analysis for business insights and recommendations, including ad hoc analytics for executive-level requests and priorities Requirements 3+ years of experience with Power BI development, visualizations and deployment Experience (more the better) with the rest of the Microsoft BI stack: TSQL, Power Query, MDX and DAX, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS Strong SQL Server database experience SQL development experience by writing queries and procedures and also using functions to create curated data for use in reporting Experience documenting business requirements, processes and workflows Nice to have experience Advanced level of MS Excel skills with knowledge of functions, macros, and VBA programming is preferred.

title: SQL Developer
description: Want to be a bswifter? bswift’s successful creation of an online benefits enrollment/administration system has provided a simple, intuitive, and engaging experience for both employers and their employees. Located in downtown Chicago, bswift offers software and services that streamline benefits, HR and payroll administration for employers and public and private exchanges nationwide. bswift’s state-of-the-art cloud-based technology and outsourcing solutions significantly reduce administrative costs and time-consuming paperwork, making life easier for administrators and millions of consumers who manage their benefits with bswift. We’re looking for motivated and goal-driven team members who can do what it takes to make a company great. The reward is a fun, flexible and creative environment with ample opportunity for professional and personal growth. If you love the bswift values of pursue excellence, embrace accountability, deliver superior service, and be a great place to work, we want to hear from you! The EDI Payroll Tech – Senior Configuration Specialist will focus on executing & delivering on payroll type exports file work and direct billing exports integration for Implementation & Ongoing clients. They will be responsible for requirements review, executing configuration, testing and timely delivery of interfaces for new, direct or channel partner clients. They would be also involved in developing technical solutions, process improvements, file failures & process documentation used by the payroll team. Fundamental Components: • Consistently reflect our core values of higher standards, greater accountability, and more fun to bswift associates, clients, and partners. • Review & understand requirements provided by consultants. • Analyze requirements to develop high level technical design for project/issue. • Configure payroll type exports on bswift platform per client/vendor requirements. • Manage and communicate your project timelines, status and open items with related project team members. • Project Management of multiple projects, issues to deliver the best work for our clients. • Collaborate with the team & other bswift resources to meet client and vendor deliverables. • Demonstrate passion for quality assurance standards by test plan execution of new and existing payroll type export files to ensure delivering accurately on client requirements. • Researching, breaking down problems, analyzing and resolving payroll export file issues in a timely manner. • Fosters continuous improvements by seeking system design changes that drive operational efficiency and business processes to serve our clients better. • Develop understanding of bswift system, payroll team tools, payroll training and contributes back to improve process documentation materials that can help EDI and the client teams. • Apply knowledge of bswift system & processes to be effective in delivering timely and accurate solutions for our client needs. • Act as a coach and mentor for others with bswift tools, configuration, testing and defect management. • Assist in file failure process and respond to client needs in a timely manner. • Develops and improves process documentation materials that can help EDI and the client teams. Required Qualifications • 4+ years of data interpretation and analysis experience. • Experience with databases as well interpretation and manipulation of related data. • Ability to quickly understand underlying data model structure based on business need to service client needs. • Hands on experience in building, modifying, unit testing and debugging stored procedures. • Experience in troubleshooting, query optimization & performance analysis. • Experience in managing code versions, source code changes using source control tools like Visual Studio. • Knowledge of SQL DDL, DML operations. • Efficient in building recursive queries using CTEs. • Expertise in developing Transact-SQL scripts for reuse in normalizing ad hoc queries to produce custom reports. • Creating complex stored procedures using linked server, CTE, temp table, SQL joins, ranking functions and dynamic SQL. • Experience in developing, updating, debugging applications (like C# programs on .NET framework) that pull data from SQL Server or file, modify it, validate it, aggregate it per client requirements. • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products especially Excel. • Good written/verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel; ability to listen, clarify and respond well to questions. • Ability to operate and make timely decisions in fast-paced atmosphere. • Strong analytical skill set and ability to effectively use data for strategy. • High level of productivity, reliability, responsibility, attendance, dependability, organization, and accuracy/thoroughness. • Ability to take initiative to meet challenges with resourcefulness and new innovative approaches while maintaining a high level of quality. • Must possess a passion for teamwork, client service and reaching business results through problem solving. • Night or weekend work may be necessary to meet client deliverables. Preferred Qualifications • Prior payroll development experience is preferred. • Working knowledge of payroll systems / payroll administration. • Knowledge of Health and Welfare benefits and/or implementation is preferred. • Working knowledge of .NET is preferred. Education A Bachelor’s Degree from a four-Year College or university, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Standard working hours are 8am-5pm Central Time, unless otherwise stated in the Job Description. In the spirit of pay transparency, we are excited to share the base salary range for this position is $72,000-$82,000, exclusive of fringe benefits or potential bonuses. If you are hired at bswift, your final base salary compensation will be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experience. In addition to those factors – we believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members as a part of any final offer. Please keep in mind that the range mentioned above is the full base salary range for the role. Hiring at the maximum of the range would not be typical in order to allow for future & continued salary growth. We also offer a generous compensation and benefits package! bswift is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. At bswift, our values are Pursue Excellence, Embrace Accountability, Deliver Superior Service, and Be A Great Place To Work . We pride ourselves on having an engaged, friendly and smart team that goes the extra mile to get the job done right. The reward is a fun, flexible and creative environment with ample opportunity for professional and personal growth. bswift was named one of Chicago’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For® in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020 and 2021, as well as one of the Nation’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For® in 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, and 2020. We are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of personal characteristics or status. We take affirmative action to recruit, select and develop women, people of color, veterans and individuals with disabilities. If you have what it takes to join our award-winning culture, we’d love to hear from you!

They will also develop technical solutions, improve processes, document file failures, and assist in the payroll team's documentation.

title: Data Consultant
description: Genesis10 is currently seeking a Data Consultant with our client in the financial industry located in Chicago, IL and Denver, CO. This is a 12 + month contract position. taking ownership of one's own responsibility to learn Pro-active and be able to drive direction of work that needs to be completed Ability to identify, analyze and address problems to resolve issues whenever possible in way that minimizes negative impact and risk to the organization Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual critical thinking skills Ability to work with Technical and Non-Technical business owners Ability in delivering messages across a wide spectrum of individuals having varying degrees of technical understanding Strong leadership skills and qualities which enable you to work with peers and various levels of management Pay Range: $49.86 - $57.86 Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10: • Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. • The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. • Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) • Behavioral Health Platform • Medical, Dental, Vision • Health Savings Account • Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident) • Voluntary Term Life Insurance • 401K • Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) • Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) • Remote opportunities available For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website. Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: IT Business Systems Analyst II
description: The IT Business Systems Analyst (BSA) will help solve business/system challenges through leading discovery, information gathering and data analysis efforts. The BSA plays a critical role in developing business requirements, configuring, building, testing, certifying, installing, and maintaining all changes and modifications to supported applications, including the company ERP system. The BSA w ill be responsible for analyzing and documenting existing processes and requirements and may assist in business process redesign as needed. The BSA will work closely with business functional areas and other IT team members to support the various applications. The BSA will be instrumental in assisting colleagues across levels to make informed business decisions from a functional/technical perspective and drive efficiencies. Strong technical knowledge and experience in development, configuration, and support of MES/ERP systems is essential . Responsibilities: Develops and maintains a working relationship and understanding of business operations and system interfaces throughout the company. Serves as the primary liaison between IT and assigned business functional areas. Responsible for requirements gathering, specification development, test plan development and execution through interviews, workflow analysis and/or facilitated discussions with others. Assist in evaluating business needs, research and perform impact analysis of new requirements or changes. Gathers, analyzes, and reports on data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of results and architect business solutions that leverage ERP capabilities. Documents business processes and/or system functionality. Develops and maintains the corporate knowledge base for ERP and ancillary applications and associated environments. Serves as an expert on the functional configuration, capabilities, and usage of the company ERP system. Maintains application configuration, performs testing and troubleshooting to provide functional and technical support of the organization's ERP and its ancillary systems. Supports the design, build and testing of ERP configurations, new reports, workflows and 3 rd party integrations. Develops training plan and provides ongoing training to users as needed. Develops test cases and performs comprehensive functional testing. Acts as the escalation point for help desk cases to ensure timely and accurate closure of issues. Serves as the primary point of contact to manage functional and technical issues with vendors. Assists with meeting planning, note taking, and follow-up tasks. Follows change control procedures and maintains proper documentation. Demonstrates strong customer services skills and a calm, positive, professional demeanor to accurately identify and resolve user issues. Strives to determine root cause of problems, identifies resolutions and coordinates fixes through completion. Assists in the planning, coordination, and implementation of projects. Actively monitors new and emerging technologies, trends, issues, and solutions to remain current of developments in the industry. Delivers quality work on time, translates planning into action, proactively monitors and controls task status by collecting and analyzing task data to anticipate and address barriers, appropriately communicates, and resolves or escalates any problems that arise. Upholds the security and confidentiality of documents and company data. Provides support as needed outside of normal business hours. Participates in 24x7 production support as needed. Works both independently and in a team-oriented collaborative environment. Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or related field. Equivalent experience will be considered. 4 years of professional working experience as a Business Systems Analyst. 3 years of experience supporting modern ERP and IT applications; defining and mapping business processes and understanding integration between various applications. Deacom ERP experience is preferred, but not required. Manufacturing experience is a plus. S trong analytical, logical, and problem-solving skills. Good verbal and written communication skills. Intermediate knowledge of O365 required, and deeper/advanced experience with Excel and/or Visio preferred. Excellent organizational skills. Detail-oriented. Positive attitude, highly adaptable. Ability to perform well under pressure and be resourceful in meeting deadlines. Reliable, predictable attendance is required. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary. Limited travel possible.

title: System Engineer II
description: Grubhub is a place where authentically fun culture meets innovation and teamwork. We believe in empowering people and opening doors for new opportunities. If you’re looking for a place that values strong relationships, embraces diverse ideas–all while having fun together–Grubhub is the place for you! We are looking for a Systems Engineer II that will focus on cloud automation for our team. Our team is responsible for maintaining the current systems and network infrastructure supporting our existing multi-site topology, and is involved in our expansion to new locations and cloud providers. We deliver excellent customer service, outstanding employee experience and leading edge technology solutions for approximately 7,000 users across multiple office locations. This position reports to the Systems & Infrastructure team which is responsible for a wide array of infrastructure platforms and services that support our employees across the globe. This includes the support of virtualization and cloud platforms (virtualization of servers, desktops and applications), management of services deployed across multiple cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and management of hyperconverged platforms in our primary and secondary data centers (infrastructure services, virtual desktops (VDI), and some application services) The Impact You Will Make Design, recommend and implement automation systems both on-prem and in the cloud. Assist with day-to-day administrative activities to maintain infrastructure systems: cloud infrastructure, cloud applications, hyper-converged, server platforms and infrastructure security. Identify and improve processes via automation. Interact with employees to understand the way they perform work, and seek creative ways to improve our workflows with technology. Work with members in various offices to ensure that projects and priorities are aligned, coordinated, and prioritized. Contribute to improving internal tools and automation to make maintaining production services easier, safer and more robust. Troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve cloud and network issues while identifying areas of improvement to rectify any deficiencies or enhance performance. Work with the team to identify opportunities to improve processes and engineering models Capacity Planning: Analyze cloud systems requirements and system interdependencies. Disaster Recovery / Disaster Resiliency: Ensure planned testing activities are performed and technical criteria are met. Remain current on new technologies and evaluate for value and improvements. Manage and deploy monitoring to ensure availability of network and systems. What You Bring to the Table 4+ years implementing and maintaining a cloud and hybrid virtual infrastructure. Experience with major cloud providers such as Azure, AWS, GCP Cloud technologies including Compute/Containers, Storage, etc. Strong knowledge and experience with Windows Server 2019-2022 (including core installations) in an Enterprise environment. Experience with various Linux distributions (CentOS and Ubuntu preferred). Experience with automation technologies such as Terraform, Ansible, Pulumi Experience with security and authentication protocols (SAML, LDAP). Ability to create PowerShell or Python scripts to drive automation. Technical writing, documentation, clear communication skills Virtualization concepts, and storage technologies that often support it (VMware, AHV, vMotion, NetApp and Dell EMC). Knowledge of Network protocols and routing and troubleshooting utilizing various capture and analysis tools. Knowledge of SD-WAN technologies and theories. Knowledge of wireless technologies, spectrum analysis, encryption, and authentication. Knowledge of TCP/IP, IPSec VPN tunnel configuration and troubleshooting (IKE1/IKE2), SNMP. Understanding of distributed systems. Track record of sound judgment, problem-solving, decision making, organizational and analytical skills. Ability to collaborate and communicate with all levels of the organization, from peers to management and executives. Experience working with virtual/remote staff members. Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university or equivalent work experience. And Of Course, Perks! Flexible PTO. Grubhub employees enjoy a generous amount of time to recharge. Health and Wellness. Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits, 401k matching, employee network groups and paid parental leave are just a few of our programs to support your overall well-being. Compensation. You'll receive a highly-competitive compensation package with eligibility for generous incentives, bonuses, commission, and RSUs. Free Meals. Our employees get a weekly Grubhub credit to enjoy and support local restaurants. Social Impact. We believe in giving back through programs like the Grubhub Community Relief Fund, and provide our employees opportunities to support causes that are important to them.
